To eliminate some cost that she spends everyday, she requests a loan to purchase a motorbike to transport the vegetables to the market. (She took picture with her husband)

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport the vegetables to the market.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao C., 42, is a widowed grocery vendor and resides with her elderly mother and her younger brother in Prey Veng, Cambodia. She typically makes around US$5 of profit each day and is aided by two daughters who work as garment factory workers in Phnom Penh.

Selling groceries has been a difficult business, as there are many competitors and high inflation which makes prices skyrocket. She is asking a loan from Kiva via Credit, the local partner, to add her grocery’s inventory. This will satisfy her and allow her to attract many buyers as well. In the future, she wants to open a tailor shop for her daughters. She does not want her children to work away from their home town.

loans.use: To add her grocery’s inventory.

loans.name: Louk

texts.en:
Louk R., 35, is a farmer living in Siem Reap with her husband, Pi Pit, and their four children. Their children are aged 13, 11, 3, and they also have a young 3 month old baby. Louk R. typically makes US$2 working her fields each day and her husband makes US$5 per day as a construction foreman. The family's monthly expenses are US$75 for food, US$30 for utilities, and US$25 for public transportation and costs of motortaxis. Louk R. has asked CREDIT for a loan of US$1000 to purchase fertilizer for her crops to improve her crop yields. In the future, Louk R., would like to purchase another plot of land to grow more crops and diversify her options for customers.

Louk R. was unavailable for a photograph at the time of the interview, so her husband is pictured above.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea P. is 53 and has a business selling fish at the market. She is able to earn approximately $3 each day. This business is good as fish is a favorite food among Cambodian people, who prefer fish to meat. But she still faces some problems. She does not have enough capital to sell a large amount of fish each day. Her husband Nov Mee is 54. He is a motor-taxi driver and makes $4 per day. The high price of gas has put many motor-taxi drivers off of the road and the remaining are making less profit. This couple has four children together, two of who are employed as garment workers and one of whom is married and no longer at home.

Mrs. Chea is asking for a loan from Kiva via local partner Credit to purchase a motorbike for family transportation. This will reduce some of the cost that this family spends on motor-taxi.

Mr. Nov is pictured because his wife is not available.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for family transportation.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Soam

texts.en: Soam S., 41, sells fish and groceries in her village. She earn approximately US$7 per day. Her husband, Chhuon Vantha, 45, works as a construction worker building houses and normally makes US$5 a day. This couple has six children, two of whom are employed as garment workers with a salary US$150 each a month. Mrs. Soam is requesting a loan from Kiva via Credit, Kiva's local partner, to add to her inventory. The increase in inventory will attract many more customers.

loans.use: To add her grocery's inventory.

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Em S., 38, is married and lives in Prey Veng, Cambodia. Since 2003, she has been selling fish to earn a living and is able to make US$30 in revenue per day. Her husband, Ou Sara, 42, has a business selling corn and earns approximately US$6 of profit per day. This couple have six children, one of whom is married and no longer lives at home. She is requesting a loan from Kiva to rent a section of the river to fish.

loans.use: To rent a section of the river to fish.

loans.name: Jovitha

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza Tanzania!

This is Jovitha B.. She is a married woman with three children between the ages of two and six. She established her grocery business in 2007. Currently, she is getting a monthly profit of $80. She works twelve hours a day, six days a week. Jovitha is requesting a loan for $450 to purchase additional stock of maize flour, soap, cooking oil, and biscuits. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so she can use it while in process of paying back her loan, a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of micro leasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of maize flour, soap, cooking oil, and biscuits.

loans.name: Por

texts.en: Por T. works as a mechanic repairing bicycles and motorbikes in his village. He earns a living of US$5 each day. His wife, Pheng Dalin has a business selling grocery items and she typically makes around US$10 in revenue per day. Selling grocery items is a lucrative business in the village as there are a few vendors that compete in the same business. To attract more customers, Mr. T. is requesting a loan from Kiva to add inventory to the grocery.

loans.use: To add inventory for his wife's grocery store.

loans.name: Samoeurn

texts.en: O. Samoeurn is 51 years old and sells roasted bananas in her village, while her husband, Heng Davut works as a motorcycle taxi driver. O. earns approximately $1.27 per day and her husband earns around $2.50 per day. Together, they have five children, one of whom is married, living in Ratanak Commune in the Battambang Province.  Another one of her sons is a construction worker.  She also has two daughters who are employed as garment workers.  Unfortunately, the income of O.'s husband has been declining due to a shift away from motorcyle taxis.  After several discussions, O. and her husband decided that purchasing a higher quality motorcycle would attract more customers and therefore strengthen his daily income.  Therefore, O. is requesting a loan of $1,000, which will be used to purchase  a new motorcycle for her husband (who is pictured with their son).

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to instead existing old one

loans.name: Lim

texts.en: Lim S., 46, is married and lives with six children in Kampong Chhnang, Cambodia. She has a home business selling porridge and noodles and earns around US$3 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman that typically makes US$5 each day. To earn more money, Lim has decided to open another business. She has requested a loan from Kiva to purchase equipment like a TV and speakers to open Karaoke place. This will double the family income in the future.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to open a Karaoke place.

loans.name: Hout

texts.en:
Hout S., 33, is a true entrepreneur and has a business selling grocery products in Kampong Chnnang province, Cambodia. She typically makes around US$ 3.50 per day. Her husband, Seng Kea, 31, works as a mechanic to earn a living and is able to make about US$ 2.30 each day as well. This couple together has four children.

Mrs. Hout is asking for a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike to use as transportation and sometimes her husband can use this motorbike to operate a motor-taxi as well. (Hout and her husband are pictured together.)

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to operate a motor-taxi and for transport

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Revina

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza Tanzania!! Revina K. is a married woman with three children aged between 13 and 18 years old. Revina is 40 years old. She opened her beauty saloon in 2003, and she has two employees who assist in running the business. She works 9 hours a day and 6 days a week. She earns a monthly profit of about $50 from this business.

Revina is requesting a loan of $450 so that she can buy other hair products, such as shampoo and weavings. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of the products she offers. Revina thanks you for your support.

loans.use: Buy other hair product such as shampoo and weavings for the salon

loans.name: Assa Komuntale's Group

texts.en:
Assa is the leader of this four-member group. She is 40 years old and married with three children between the ages 22 and 17. Two of her children go to school and the eldest is working. She lives in her own five-room house in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala, where she also works. Her house has electricity and piped water and the family gets three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses include feeding the family, school fees, and medication.

Assa works six days a week and rents her working place. She sells crafts (wholesale and retail) to all categories of people. She sells to an average of eight people a day. She uses public transport to buy her items from Kampala city centre. She's been in this business for the last three years. She first had a retail shop but due to competition and demand for crafts in the area, she changed the business.

Assa has been with MCDT for six years and is servicing her thirteenth loan, working all along with her same group mates. Her major challenges are fluctuation of prices, high transport costs, and seasonality. Assa aspires to see her business grow bigger and to open another branch in Wandegeya, one the city suburbs. She will use this loan to increase stock in her business.

loans.use: To increase her stock of crafts.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Micro Credit Development Trust SACCO (MCDT) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong P., 36, is employed by one of the organizations in the village and is able to make US$ 7 each day. Her husband, Oeu Chhy, is a rice farmer and acts as cow dealer as well.

The weather conditions have been difficult in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Hong P. included. She has 4 children. Hong P. would like a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase a cow for sale. (Mr. Oeu is pictured because his wife was not available.)

loans.use: To purchase a cow for sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Va

texts.en: Va S., 38, is married and lives with her husband and children in Prey Veng, Cambodia. Since 2000, she has sold groceries to earn a living and is able to make US$2 per day. Her husband, Samrith Rous, 42, has been a construction foreman since 2001. On average, he makes US$7 each day. This couple has three children, two of whom are students and the other is employed as a construction worker. Mrs. Va is requesting a loan from Kiva via Credit, a local partner of World Relief, to build a bigger store and add more grocery products.

loans.use: To build a bigger store and add more grocery products.

loans.name: Euk

texts.en:
Euk L., 28, is a rice farmer who resides with her children in Prey Veng, Cambodia. Collecting output is hard this year because the weather has been bad in the past year. Most of the provinces have no irrigation systems yet, so farmers have to farm by depending on the sky. They all are very happy when the clouds are dark but if there is no rain they will face crop damage.

Euk L. normally makes US$ 3 each day. Her husband since 2001 has a business as a motor-taxi driver to earn a living and is able to make US$ 4 a day as well. This couple together has two children. Euk L. is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate a motor-taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate a motor-taxi business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Đurđija

texts.en: Đurđija is a married woman with two children from the town of Prnajvor. Đurđija is requesting a second loan of 1,000 KM to buy more clothes to sell at her stall at the market. She needs to earn money because her husband's salary is not enough to cover household costs. She wants to expand her business in order to earn more money.

loans.use: To buy more clothes.

loans.name: Jadranka

texts.en: Jadranka is from Prnjavor and she is married. Her husband has a full-time job and his monthly salary is 700 KM. Jadranka sells clothes at the market on a bench that she rents. This is her second loan  in the amount of 1 000 KM and Jadranka intends to use this loan to purchase additional clothes for her bench. Her wish is to expand her goods in order to earn more money that she needs because she has two children and both of them go to school.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for re-sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Zene za Zene, a partner of Women for Women International - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Gospava

texts.en: Gospava is a widow from the town of Doboj and she works as a seamstress at home. She owns one sewing machine and she does everything that she can with this machine. She wants to use this loan in the amount of 600 KM to buy textiles for sewing. Her wish is to make a new suits and pants and to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: To buy textiles for sewing

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Zene za Zene, a partner of Women for Women International - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Nada

texts.en: Nada was born in 1977, and she lives with her husband and two children in the town of Doboj. Nada is a housewife and her wish is to start making cookies at her home. She has a lot of free time and she wants to use this loan to buy ingredients for making cookies. She will buy molds in order to have more interesting cookies to sell in her neighborhood and to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making cookies.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Zene za Zene, a partner of Women for Women International - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Zora

texts.en: Zora lives with her husband and two children in the town of Doboj. Her children go to school and her husband has a full time job. This is her first loan from WWI in the amount of 600 KM and Zora wants to use it to buy chicken feed for her chickens. She hopes to fatten and sell them in the future in order to earn money and save some meat for her household during the winter.

loans.use: To buy food for chicken.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mr. Heng P., 49, and his wife, Mrs. Samet Roen, 48, who live in a small village across Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, have been married for twenty years and have seven children; two sons and five daughters. Their first daughter is a garment factory worker. Two of their children assist their mother in selling recyclable materials and two other children study in local schools. The two youngest children stay at home.

Mr. Heng and his wife have been growing rice since they were married. The couple works very hard for their living because they have a lot of children and with only farming business, they can't make their living standard get better so Heng found an additional job as a construction worker and his wife created another business selling recyclable materials.

Samet Roen and her two children buy recyclable materials from villagers for re-sale to middlemen. Currently the couple needs a pump for their farming business. Therefore, Heng is requesting a loan of US$ 300 to buy a pump for growing rice.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump for growing rice

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Slavojka

texts.en: Slavojka is a widow from the town of Doboj. She receives her husband's pension in the amount of 400 KM. Together with her daughter, she owns a tailoring shop. Slavojka is requesting a loan in the amount of 600 KM to buy additional material for their sewing needs. She hopes this will help her offer better products to her customers.

loans.use: To buy material for sewing.

loans.name: Thyda

texts.en:
Mrs. Thyda M., 34, and her husband, Mr. Lay Sophal, 33, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1999 and have two sons. One son studies in a local school, and the other son is still young and stays at home. In addition to their children, the couple also raises one orphan nephew, who studies in university.

Mrs. Thyda has been a silk weaver since 1990, using a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Lay is a security guard for a company in Phnom Penh. Thyda and her husband hope that their work can continue to support their nephew's study until he finishes university. Now Thyda is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap P., 30, and her husband, Mr. Chin Chun, 30, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2002 and have one daughter.

Mrs. Sopheap has been a silk weaver since 1990, using a skill she learned from her neighbor. She has taught her husband to become a silk weaver as well. Besides weaving, he also fishes. The couple sells their finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Sopheap is requesting a loan of $450 to purchase silk materials for her weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Aida Camara

texts.fr: AIDA CAMARA S. EST NEE A BAMBEY LE 28 /01/1963 .ELLE HABITE AU QUARTIER DVF DE BAMBEY OU ELLE MARIEE ET MERE DE TROIS ENFANTS.APRES LES TRAVAUX MENAGERS ELLE FAIT DU COMMERCE POUR AMELIORE SES REVENUS AFIN DE MIEUX GERER SA FAMILLE.SON ACTIVITE CONSISTE A ACHETER DES TISSUS EN BAZIN ENSUITE ELLE LES FAIT TEINDRE AVANT  DE LES REVENDRE A SES CLIENTES .
texts.en:
Aida Camara S. was born in Bambey on January 28, 1963. She lives in the DVF district of Bambey. She is married and the mother of 3 children. When her housework is done, she runs a little business to bring in more income so that she can better support her family. Her business consists in buying "bazin" cloth which she hand-dyes before re-selling it to her customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of cloth for women

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for UIMCEC, a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Sokhum

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhum S., 32, and her husband, Mr. Tin Oy, 27, live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2002 and had two sons. One of their sons drowned in the water and died.

Mrs. Sokhum has been raising pigs for three years. She bought piglets from villagers to raise and sell to a middleman. Her husband has been a motor taxi driver for three years. He drives people around the village and sometimes to Phnom Penh. Sokhum is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise.

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en:
Mr. Tuy R., 32, is single and lives with his parents, who live in a small village across from the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. He has eight brothers and sisters, and his parents grow rice in the village.

Mr. Tuy has been a mason for two years. Besides construction work, he also farms. Currently he and his parents lack the money for his farming business. Therefore, Tuy is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase water pipe line, fertilizer, rice seed and pesticide for growing rice.

loans.use: To purchase water pipe line, fertilizer, rice seed and pesticide for growing rice.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: MAMADOU G. EST NE A BAMBEY EN 1958.il est gérant d'une boulangerie dans son quartier situé au dvf de bambey .avec le ramadan il veut augmenter son stock de farine  c'est pour cela qu'il sollicite ce pret.
texts.en:
Mamadou G. was born in Bambey in 1958. He runs a bakery in his neighborhood in Bambey. He is requesting this loan because he wants to increase his flour supply for the upcoming observance of Ramadan.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase flour supply for bakery

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with a grown daughter. She runs her business in the central market of her home town of Pavlograd. Irina sells women's clothing items. She started this business 5 years ago after she got downsized. Currently, her turnover capital is about US$ 2000. Monthly net profit is about US$ 300-400.

Irina has proven to be a reliable client as she has had perfect credit history with Nadiya Ukraine ever since she got her first loan. One of the attractions of her business is Irina's natural thoughtfulness and friendliness as she serves her customers which makes buying from her a pleasant experience. Irina is dreaming about constructing a vending kiosk to keep her inventory there. Today she is requesting a 3000 Grivna loan to re-stock her merchandise and purchase 40 shirts for retail sale.

loans.use: To purchase 40 shirts for re-sale

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena D. is divorced with a grown daughter. She lives in Simferopol and sells women's clothing in the central city market. Her merchandise always sells well because of the lower-price policy Yelena has set in her kiosks. She is a hard worker and usually works late hours after all other market vendors are done with their sales for the day. Yelena has been in the trade for 4 years. Currently, her turnover capital is about US$ 2400. Gross income is about US$ 2400 a month, while monthly net profit is usually about US$ 800.

Yelena has always been very committed to her family. She doesn't only provide for her daughter and herself but also her mentally challenged aunt who has been living with them for a while. Yelena would like to get a loan of 3000 Grivnas for 1 month to buy assorted inventory for her vending locations. She is hoping to generate additional profit to provide for the needs of her family. Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in a month.

loans.use: To increase income

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: MR M. EST UN VIEL HOMME  QUI HABITE AU DVF DE BAMBEY .IL EST MARIE ET PERE DE CINQ ENFANTS .IL FAIT DU COMMERCE DE CHARBON DEPUIS UN AN CECI DANS LE BUT DE SUBVENIR AUX BESOINS DE SES ENFANTS . IL DEMANDE CE PRET DANS LE BUT DE RENFORCER SON STOCK PENDANT LA SAISON DES PLUIES.
texts.en:
Mr. M. is an elderly man who lives in DVF in Bambey. He is married and the father of 5 children. He has been selling charcoal for one year, with the intention of better supporting his children. He is requesting this loan to bolster his stocks before the rainy season.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of charcoal

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for UIMCEC, a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: KHADY B. est une femme commerçante née le 05/01/1956 à bambey .elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants au quarier leona de bambey .depuis presque huit ans elle vend au détail de l'encens qu'elle mélange elle meme de façon artisanale.c'est dans le but de renforcer son stock de matieres premieres qu'elle sollicite ce pret afin de satisfaire sa clientèle pendant l'hivernage.
texts.en:
Khady B. is a saleswoman born on January 5, 1956 in Bambey. She lives with her husband and children in the Leona neighborhood of Bambey. As an artisan, she has been making her own incense and selling it as retail for almost eight years. She is requesting this loan in order to strengthen her supply of raw materials and satisfy her clients during the winter season.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Incense sales

loans.name: Fatim

texts.fr: FATIM EST UNE NATIVE DE BAMBEY LE 12/04/1951.ELLE EST mariée et mère de trois enfants .elle a une expérience de seize ans dans la vente de jus de fruits sur le marché local.elle dispose d'un réfrigérateur dans lequel elle conserve  les jus qui sont prets  à consommer.elle sollicite ce pret dans l'optique de renforcer son stock de bissap et de pain de singe qui sont les matières premières qu'elle utilise pour faire les jus qu'elle revend.
texts.en:
Fatim F. was born in Bambey on April 12, 1951. She is married and the mother of three children. She has been selling fruit juice at the local market for 16 years. She stores her juices in a refrigerator so that they are ready to drink. She is requesting this loan in hopes of strengthening her supply of bissap and baobab fruit, which are the raw materials she uses to make the juices she sells.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Natural fruit juice sales

loans.name: Muniba

texts.en: Muniba was born in 1975 and she is from the town of Visoko. Her husband works, and Muniba grows vegetables. She would like a loan to buy more seeds for sowing in the fall. She hopes to plant a lot of vegetables, so that she will have something for the winter. After the winter, she will probably have some corn, which she will sell to earn additional money.

loans.use: To buy seeds.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Zene za Zene, a partner of Women for Women International - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Advija

texts.en: Advija is a 45-year-old widow and she receives a pension in the amount of 600 KM. She has two children. This is not her first loan at WWI, and this loan amounts to 1,100 KM. Her intent is to buy poultry for the winter. After some time, when she has fattened them, she will sell the birds and earn money that she will spend on her daughter's needs. She is going to school and she needs additional money for that reason.

loans.use: To buy poultry to raise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Zene za Zene, a partner of Women for Women International - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady Y. est née le 02/01/74 dans le département de Bambey,elle réside à keur Djimith mais mène son commerce de fruits et légumes au marché cental de Bambey.Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent de contirbuer aux dépenses familiales et surtout l'entretien de ses enfants.elle a deux (02) ans d'expérience dans son activité.
texts.en:
Khady Y. was born January 2, 1974 in the Bambey region. She lives in Keur Djimith but runs her fruits and vegetables business at the main market in Bambey. The income generated by her business allows her to contribute to family expenses and especially to take care of her children. She has two years of experience working in this business.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fruit and vegetable sales

loans.name: Sabaheta

texts.en: 39-year-old Sabaheta is married with two children, ages 20 and 22. Her husband has a job that earns about 250 KM monthly. This is Sabaheta's first loan at WWI in the amount of 1000 KM. She will use it to buy seeds and compost to expand her vegetable business. She hopes this business expansion will allow her to better support her household.

loans.use: To buy seeds and compost.

loans.name: Mediha

texts.en: Mediha is a widow and she lives in the town of Visoko. She has one son, who is married. This is not Mediha's first loan at WWI. She is now asking for a loan to buy food for her cow. Her wish is to keep this cow throughout the winter and she thinks that she will manage to with this loan.

loans.use: To buy food for cow.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Zene za Zene, a partner of Women for Women International - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Ngoné

texts.fr: Ngoné Dieye est née en 1967 à Bambey, elle habite au quartier DVF de Bambey. elle a une expérience de cinq ans dans la vente de denrées alimentaires. Avec le Ramadan elle veut renforcer son stock afin de satisfaire sa clientéle.
texts.en:
Ngoné Dieye was born in 1967 in Bambey. She lives in the DVF neighborhood of Bambey. She has worked for five years in food commodity sales. With the upcoming observance of Ramadan she wants to strengthen her supply and satisfy her clients.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Food commodity sales

loans.name: Ndeye Nguissaly

texts.fr: Ndéye Nguissaly Badiane est née le 18/01/69 à Bambey, elle habite au quartier Wakhaldiam. Son activité consiste à vendre de la fripperie. elle bénéficie d'une expérience de cinq ans.Avant la rentrée des classes, elle veut renforcer son stock, c'est pour cela qu'elle sollicite ce pret.
texts.en:
Ndéye Nguissaly Badiane was born January 18, 1969 in Bambey and now lives in the Wakhaldiam quarter. Her business consists of selling second-hand clothing. She has five years of experience in this domain. She is requesting this loan because she wants to increase her stock before the start of the new school year.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma R. M. vive en casa de sus padres (zona de San Pedro, ciudad de La Paz) con su hijo de 18 años.
Irma es peinadora y presta sus servicios en domicilios particulares dela ciudad. 
Su vivienda ya tiene varios años y los techos se han deteriorado tanto que presentan filtraciones (sobre todo en época de lluvias).
El crédito solicitado será destinado a la refacción de los techos de calamina en dos habitaciones.
Esta es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente.
texts.en:
Irma R. M. lives with her parents (zone of San Pedro, city of La Paz) and her 18 year old son. Irma is a hairdresser and offers this service at the client’s home. Irma’s home is old and the roof is in a particular bad condition, and during the rainy season it gets worse as all the water filters through the house. The requested loan will be used to repair the roof and ceiling in two rooms. This it is the first time that Irma is requesting a loan and the socioeconomic analysis carried out determines that Irma qualifies for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair the roof and ceiling in two rooms

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
Aurora a sus 33 años, es madre de 5 hijos, que son su mayor tesoro, vive junto a su esposo José, quien la apoya mucho. Junto a su pareja, que es electricista, tiene un taller en su propio domicilio, trabajan juntos hace 10 años, brindando servicios eléctricos a sus clientes, que en su mayoría son los motocarristas. Atienden durante todo el día, lo que le gusta de su trabajo, es que aprende mucho, hasta el punto de reemplazar a su esposo cuando este no está.Lo más difícil, es no contar con un local adecuado, para dar mayor comodidad a sus clientes y tiene que atenderlos en las afueras de su casa.    
Aurora trabaja para solventar sus gastos diarios y la educación de sus hijos.
Con el dinero que solicita, quiere mandar a ampliar su negocio, comprar materiales de trabajo y posteriormente alquilar un local para poner su taller.
texts.en:
Aurora is 33 years old; she is a mother of 5 children who are her biggest treasure. She lives with her husband, José, who supports her a lot. Together with her partner, she is an electrician and has her own shop at her home. They have worked together for 10 years, offering their services to their clients, who are mainly motorcar drivers. They wait on customers all day long; she enjoys her work and has learned a lot from it- so much that she replaces her husband when he is away. What is hardest is not having an adequate shop in order to better convenience her clients; she has to help them outside her home. Aurora works in order to meet her daily expenses and to pay for her children's education. She would like to expand the business, purchase work supplies and subsequently rent a space to set up her shop with the money she is asking for.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Adquirir herramientas y materiales para su taller, y más adelante un local adecuado para la atención de sus clientes.

loans.name: Mwaka's Hiyari Ya Moyo Group

texts.en:
Mwaka is 40 years old. She is a single mother of three children, aged 17, 15, and 11 years old. She has been a bedsheet seller since 2003. She works at her business everyday and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Mwaka is requesting a loan to buy more bedsheets for resale. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling either clothing or firewood.

loans.use: To buy more bedsheets for resale.

loans.name: Bikombo's Tujiimarishe Group

texts.en:
Bikombo is 27 years old. She is married with 5 children aged between 8 and 1 year old. She has been a food seller since 2000. Every day, she works from 8am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

Bikombo now looking for a loan to buy more food items such as rice, maize flour and bananas for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mtumwa , who has a business selling food, charcoal, and firewood.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria, de 42 años, es madre de dos hijos maravillosos, vive junto a su esposo Jorge, a quien la apoya mucho, para juntos, salir adelante.
Ella se dedica a la venta de salchipapa (plato que consiste en papas y salchichas fritas) y gaseosas, en una esquina de su localidad, desde hace 5 años, solo vende por las noches.Sin embargo, no es el único negocio que tiene, ya que también apoya a su esposo, quien se dedica a comprar granos (maíz, fréjol, arroz, y otros) al por mayor en diferentes caseríos, para luego llevarlos a vender a las diferente tiendas de granos. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo, es que conoce mucha gente, y ver que está surgiendo muy lentamente pero seguro. En su negocio de venta de comida y bebidas heladas le va muy bien, como también a su esposo con quien comparten sus ideas de negocio.
Maria trabaja para solventar sus gastos diarios y la educación de sus hijos.
Solicita este préstamo para implementarse con muebles, sillas y mesas, para su negocio de venta de comida, como también alquilar un local para almacenar los granos que trae su esposo.
texts.en:
Maria, a 42 years old lady, and mother of two marvelous children, she lives with her husband Jorge. Maria and Jorge work hard in order to succeed. Maria sells salchipapa (dish that consists of potatoes and fried sausages) and carbonated soft drinks, at a street corner in her neighborhood. It has been five years, since she sells her products at night. Nevertheless, this is not the only business that Maria and Jorge have, they also buy wholesale grain products (corn, beans, rice, etc…) to then sell them at various small food stores. They like this job because they get to meet many people, and to see that they are progressing, slowly but surely. Their businesses are going well, but their marriages also, as they are able to share their entrepreneurial ideas and execute them. Maria works in order to pay for daily expenses and the education of her children. She is requesting this loan to purchase furniture, chairs and tables for her food selling business, and to rent a storage room for the grains her husband buys.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase furniture, chairs and tables for her food selling business and to rent a storage room for the grains her husband buys.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase an inventory of used clothes

loans.name: Nuria

texts.es:
Nuria tiene 34 años, es madre de 4 hijos estudiantes que son su mayor inspiración de salir adelante. Ella vive junto a su esposo Vicente, quien la apoya en todo, sobre todo en su negocio.
Se dedica a la venta de verduras regionales (tomates, caiguas, ajíes, pepinos, culantros y otras variedades) en un puesto del mercado Bellavista. Se levanta muy temprano (2:00am), para ir a comprar en el puerto, las variadas verduras que traen los campesinos.Luego de comprar, trae sus productos a venderlos al mercado hasta las 7 de la mañana, cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes que consumen mucho de estos productos regionales. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es vender y dar una buena atención.
Nuria trabaja para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos diarios y la educación de sus hijos.
Ahora, quiere implementar su puesto con más productos y exportarlos a la capital, posteriormente poner una  bodega en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Nuria is 34 years old and the mother of 4 children who all attend school. They are her greatest inspiration to succeed. Nuria lives with her husband Vincente, who supports her in all things, above all in her business. She sells regional produce such as tomatoes, cucumbers and many other types of vegetables from a small stand in the Bellavista market. She gets up very early, 2am, in order to go shopping at the port and take advantage of the variety of produce brought in from the countryside. After purchasing the vegetables, she brings them to the market to sell at 7am. She counts on a good quantity of customers who consume a lot of the regional produce. What she likes about her work is the selling and the good customer service. Nuria works to help with the household costs and the education of her children. Now, she would like to stock her stand with more products and grow her business, eventually setting up a small cafe/shop in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO STOCK A GREATER VARIETY OF PRODUCE TO SELL AND GROW HER BUSINESS

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela, de 36 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, quienes son el significado de vivir y seguir luchando por salir adelante, ella y su esposo Wilson tienen el deseo de salir adelante en su negocio, sobre todo por le futuro de sus hijos.
Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad desde ya hace 3 años, negocio que tiene dentro de su vivienda, el mismo que respalda el sustento económico de su  familia, vende durante todo el día, y lo que le gusta más de su trabajo es que se socializa e intercambia muchas ideas con personas que conocen de negocio. Lo más difícil es no contar con un local apropiado para dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
Mariela trabaja para sus gastos diarios y la educación de sus hijos.
El dinero que pide será para ampliar su negocio, comprar productos comestibles, y sobre todo mejorar la estructura de su tienda, más adelante tener su minimarket.
texts.en:
Mariela is 36 years old and has 3 children, who are her motivation for working hard. Mariela and her husband, Wilson, would like to grow their business to help secure their children's future. For 3 years now, they have run a small grocery shop from their home. What they enjoy most about their business is the interaction with the customers and the exchange of ideas with people who know their business. The most difficult thing is not having a separate shop, which would be better suited for the comfort of their customers. Mariela works to cover household costs and the costs of educating their children. The money she is requesting will be used to grow the business, buy more products, and above all make improvements to the shop, so that one day they will have a proper mini market.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock their small general store and make improvements so that it's more comfortable and attractive for their customers.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 30 años, en la actualidad vive con su hija de 2 años y su esposo. Trabaja desde hace más de 5 años a las actividades ganaderas y agrícolas, iniciativa que nació al ver que su esposo tiene extensiones de terrenos cultivables idóneos para tener ganado, ahora ha visto los resultados de su trabajo, efectivamente si le ha dado resultados.Ha visto la mejor manera de incrementar sus ganancias  aumentando la cantidad de vacas, a las cuales dedica la mayor parte de su tiempo y vende su leche, para alimentarlas, ella misma cultiva alfalfa. No existen dificultades que han de considerarse, pues Gloria disfruta del trabajo que realiza, que además le permite obtener el sustento diario.
Ella está motivada cada día por el futuro que le quiere dar a su pequeña hija.
Solicita este préstamo con el que podrá mejorar la infraestructura de su establo, poniendo un techo de calamina.
texts.en:
Gloria is 30 years old and currently lives with her two-year-old daughter and her husband. For more than five years now she has worked at ranching and farming, an initiative that she began when she noticed that her husband had plots of cultivatable land suitable for ranching. Now she has seen the result of her work, and it has produced effective results. She has found that the best way to increase her earnings is to increase the number of cattle, to which she devotes the largest chunk of her work - selling their milk and raising alfalfa herself to feed them. They have not had to consider the difficulties as Gloria enjoys her work, which has allowed her to earn their daily bread. She is motivated everyday by the future she wants to give her little daughter. She is requesting this loan so she can improve the structure of the stable, adding a corrugated metal roof.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Add a new corrugated metal roof to her stable

loans.name: Magatte

texts.fr: Magatte N. est une femme agée de 59 ans. Elle habite à Bambey au quartier DVF, malgré son age , elle s'adonne au commerce de bijoux et de tissus depuis quatre ans.Elle tire des revenus subtentiels sur ce commerce. Avec les fetes qui s'approchent, elle veut renforcer son stock et  sollicite ce pret à cet effet.
texts.en:
Magatte N. is 59 years old. She lives in the DVF neighborhood of Bambey and, despite her age, she has devoted herself to the sale of jewelry and fabrics for four years. She generates a great deal of revenue in this business. She is requesting this loan to strengthen her supply for the upcoming holiday.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Jewelry and fabric sales

loans.name: Aquiles

texts.es:
Aquiles tiene 33 años, cuida y vive con sus ancianos padres.  Hace 5 años decidió tener su propia granja de cuyes con todas las normas técnicas debidas, negocio que le permite tener ahora 300 de estos animalitos. Las ventajas de criar cuyes es la rentabilidad de la misma, por lo que no dudó en aprender esta actividad, sobre todo porque él ha estudiado la carrera de agronomía, lo que le permite tener conocimientos para el correcto cuidado. Adicionalmente, a su negocio, trabaja en el ministerio de agricultura como capacitador en temas agrícolas, de esa manera, desarrolla su carrera, de manera dependiente y también independiente con su granja de cuyes.
Aquiles se esfuerza mucho porque quiere tener algo bueno en la vida, que le permita tener una economía  sostenible.
Solicita este crédito porque también desea incursionar en la ganadería, para lo cual invertirá  en la compra de un torete y también en la mejora de la infraestructura de su granja.
texts.en:
Aquiles is a 33-year-old man who lives with and looks after his elderly parents. Five years ago, he decided to set up his own guinea pig farm that met all the technical standards. This farm allows him to raise 300 of these small animals. The advantage of raising guinea pigs is its profitability, which is why he did not hesitate in learning about this business, especially since he studied agriculture in college. He was able to learn a lot about the proper care of animals while studying this major. Aside from his business, he also works as a facilitator at the Department of Agriculture, dealing with agricultural issues, which further helps him develop his guinea pig farm. Aquiles works hard because he wants to have something good in his life that will allow him to earn a steady income. He is requesting this loan because he also wants to get into ranching, which is why he will invest in the purchase of a bull calf as well as in the improvement of his farm’s infrastructure.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve infrastructure of guinea pig farm and purchase a bull calf to start ranching business

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
Pascuala tiene 54 años D. edad, actualmente vive con su esposo y 2 D. sus 5 hijos. Hace 10 años buscó su propia fuente D. ingresos, que le permitiera ser un sostén más D. su hogar, es así que, junto a varias personas que compartían la misma visión decidieron fundar un mercadillo cercano a su barrio, para que cada uno ocupara un puesto y pueda vender lo que  desee, entonces, por su parte decidió vender comida y desD. ese entonces elabora desayunos y almuerzos todos los días, excepto los fines D. semana, días que descansa, ya que su jornada diaria consiste en levantarse a las 5 D. la mañana, comprar y preparar la comida que ha D. vender  hasta las 6 D. la tarD., donD. deja todo sus utensilios limpios y listos para el día siguiente, ella ya está acostumbrada a esta forma D. vida y disfruta D. el hecho D. tener su propia fuente D. ingreso. 
Pascuala se esfuerza porque  quiere seguir apoyando a los dos menores D. sus hijos que todavía estudian.
Solicita un préstamo con el que se implementará D. ingredientes, comprando por sacos el arroz y el azúcar, que es lo más utiliza, y evitar que el alza D. precios le ocasione menores ganancias, su mira es seguir adelante con su negocio y mejorarlo.
texts.en:
Pascuala is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two of their five children. Ten years ago she looked for a way to earn her own income, one that would allow her to help in the household costs. This was how she, together with several people who shared the same vision, decided to start a small market in their neighborhood. Each person has their own small stand and can sell what they want. Pascuala decided to sell food and ever since then she has prepared breakfasts and lunches every day, except on the weekends when she rests. She gets up daily at 5am to buy and prepare the food that she will sell until 6 in the afternoon, after which she cleans all of her utensils so that she's ready for the following day. She is now accustomed to this schedule and way of life, and she enjoys having her own source of income. Pascuala works hard to support her two youngest children, who still attend school. She is requesting a loan which she will use to purchase wholesale the ingredients she uses most, such bags of rice and sugar. Her vision is to continue to grow her business and make it better.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO PURCHASE WHOLESALE THE INGREDIENTS SHE USES MOST IN THE DAILY MEALS SHE PREPARES AND SELLS.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase sugar, flour and other raw materials for his pastry shop

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel tiene 33 años, en la actualidad vive con su esposo y su hijo. Es una madre de familia dedicada a ser parte proveedora de los recursos económicos de su  familia, ella y su esposo se dedican al transporte, ofrecen servicio de taxi, todos los días contratan chóferes para que manejen sus dos autos, esta actividad la vienen realizando hace 8 años, tiempo en el que les ha traído satisfacciones.Además de esto, Raquel es inversionista en un negocio de confección de cubierta para carros que administra su padre, de esa manera asegura su ingresos económicos, cuando hay días en que la demanda de transporte es baja y aumenta excesivamente  el costo de combustible.
Raquel se esfuerza porque ella y su esposo desean tener más en la vida por el bien de su único hijo. El préstamo será invertido en la reparación y mantenimiento de los carros que tienen, en un futuro desea poder vender carros y obtener de esas ganancias su casa propia.
texts.en:
Raquel is 33 years old and lives with her husband and their son. She is a mother who is dedicated to doing her part as a provider of income for the family She and her husband have a taxi business, contracting every day with drivers for their two cars. They began this business 8 years ago, and over the years they have done well. In addition, Raquel is also an investor in a business making covers for cars, which is run by her father. In this way she secures her income during the times when the demand for taxis is low or the costs of fuel are high. Raquel works hard because she and her husband want a better life for their son. The loan will be used for repairs and maintenance on the cars. In the future, they would like to be able to sell cars and use the money to buy their own home.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: THE LOAN WILL BE USED FOR REPAIRS AND MAINTENANCE ON THEIR TWO TAXIS.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra tiene 32 años, vive con su pequeño hijo de 8 años. Cada día trabaja en su propio salón de belleza, brindando todo tipo de servicio en cuanto a peinados, maquillaje, cortes y coloraciones de cabello, etc. Inicio este negocio después de haber concluido sus estudios de cosmetología, eso fue hace 11 meses y desde entonces no ha parado de trabajar, atiende en su salón 4 veces a la semana, es una gran satisfacción ejercer lo que ella considera su vocación, por ello que seguirá adelante.
Sandra se esfuerza por su hijo, ya que es  el motor que impulsa su trabajo.
El préstamo será invertido en implementar su salón de belleza con más espejos, también con otros instrumentos que necesita.
texts.en:
Sandra is 32 years old and lives with her 8-year-old son. Every day, she works in her own beauty salon, offering every type of service, including hair-styling, make-up, cuts and coloring, etc. She began this business after finishing her cosmetology studies 11 months ago; since then, she has not stopped working. Her salon is open four times a week. Sandra experiences great satisfaction from following her vocation, and she will succeed for this reason. Sandra works hard for her son, who is the driving force behind her efforts. The loan proceeds will be invested in outfitting her beauty salon with more mirrors and other needed equipment.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Outfitting a salon with materials and instruments, and installation of mirrors.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 48-year-old family man from a small village near Nabatieh in Southern Lebanon. Ibrahim has two children and he sells medical equipment for a living. He is a very dynamic entrepreneur. Ibraham has successfully completed two previous loan cycles with Al Majmoua, and now he has requested a loan of US$ 1,000 to assist his children to move to a new apartment.

loans.use: To assist his children with moving expenses

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina tiene 45 años, vive con 2 de sus 4 hijos. Todos los días, se dedica a atender su propio restaurante, el cual instaló hace 3 años, en una de las avenidas principales de su barrio, desde entonces no ha dejado  su negocio, con mucho esmero y dedicación, prepara todo tipo de comidas, lo que vende principalmente son almuerzos, para ello, durante toda la mañana cocina y a medio día abre su restaurante para vender sus menús, cerca de las 5 de la tarde cierra para lavar los utensilios, afortunadamente  Dina es apoyada  por sus 2 hijos, que también lavan los cubiertos y el menaje, en ocasiones  le ayudan a atender su negocio; este ritmo de trabajo es de lunes a sábado, el domingo es su día de descanso, no considera una dificultad grande que se presente en sus actividades diarias, ya que mira este negocio con mucho optimismo.
Dina se esfuerza porque ella sola es el sostén de su hogar, desea que sus hijos se sigan superando.
Solicita este préstamo con el que podrá comprar abarrotes, y demás ingredientes básicos para preparara sus alimentos, de esa manera almacenarlos para que la inversión sea menor y las ganancias sean mayores.
texts.en:
Dina is 45 years old, she lives with 2 of her 4 children. Everyday she works in her own restaurant, which she began 3 years ago, in one of the main streets of her neighborhood. Since then she has not left her business. With great care and dedication, she prepares all kinds of meals. She primarily sells lunches, and so during the mornings she cooks and at midday she opens her restaurant to sell her meals. Around 5 in the afternoon she closes to wash her utensils. Fortunately Dina is supported by her two children, who also wash the dishes and kitchen pans, and occasionally they help her take care of her business. This work takes place Monday through Saturday, Sunday is her day of rest. She doesn't consider her daily activities a great difficulty as she sees this business wtih great optimism. Dina works hard because she is who supports their home, and she wishes her children to be successful. She is seeking this loan in order to buy groceries and basic ingredients to prepare her meals. In this way she will be stocked and the investment will be small and the earnings will be great.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supply her business and stock ingredients to prepare her meals

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty tiene 39 años, vive con sus 2 hijos y su anciano padre. Tiene su bodega desde hace 10 años, su madre, al estar enferma, le traspasó este negocio, el cual viene trabajando intensamente para lograr que su bodega sea una de la que tenga mayor demanda en su zona, para esto a surtido sus estantes de una gran variedad de productos, y la atención esmerada que brinda garantizan sus ventas, por eso, no cesa de atender todos los días su bodega, ya que de eso depende la economía de su hogar.
Betty es el único sostén de su casa, por ello es que se esfuerza tanto.
El préstamo al que accederá será invertido en la compra de mercadería al  por mayor para su tienda.
texts.en:
Betty is 39 years old, and lives with her two children and elderly father. She has had her grocery store for ten years. Her mother, upon getting sick, gave her the business and she has worked tirelessly so that her store is the one in most demand in her area. To do this, she has stocked her store with a great variety of products and provides painstaking attention to her customers in order to guarantee sales. For this reason, she never ceases tending to her store given that she depends on it to support her household. Betty is the sole provider for the family, which is why she puts forth such great effort. The loan would be invested into the purchase of merchandise at wholesale for her store.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise at wholesale for her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Cover wedding expenses

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith tiene 29 años, vive solo con su pequeña hija de 3 años. l talento para las ventas le ha permitido tener un record de ventas muy exitoso en la venta de cosméticos por catálogo, día a día esta en búsqueda de nuevos clientes, los productos que ofrece son de las marcas más prestigiosas.Debido a ese record de ventas, la empresa de cosméticos le ofreció un trabajo como impulsadota, donde promociona estos productos de belleza y a la vez, vende su propia mercadería, a lo largo de 3 años, nota que ha progresado mucho, y seguirá adelante a pesar de las  largas caminatas diarias que hace para  vender.
Edith se esfuerza motivada por su pequeña hija. Con el dinero que solicita quiere incrementar su mercadería, lo que le permitirá expandir su mercado de ventas.
texts.en:
Edith is 29 years old and lives alone with her small 3 year old daughter. Her talent for sales has enabled her to have a very successful record of cosmetic sales by catalogue. Every day she seeks new customers, and the products she offers are from prestigious brands. Due to this sales record, the cosmetic business offered her a position as a spokesperson, where she prootes beauty products as well as sell her own merchandise. Over 3 years she has grown a lot and she will continue to succeed in spite of the long walks she does daily in order to sell. Edith is motivated by her small daughter. With the money she sekks from the loan she will increase her merchandise which will permit her to expand her sales market.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase her cosmetic merchandise to expand her sales market.

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Ibrahima B. est né le 01 février 1959 à Bambey Serrere dans le département de Bambey. il s'active dans le commerce de poissons depuis cinq ans. il dispose d'une large clientéle constituée des femmes de son quartier.
texts.en:
Ibrahima B. was born on February 1, 1959 in Bambey Serrere in the Bambey region. He has been working in fish trade for the past five years. He has a large customer base made up of women from his district.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fish Selling

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 59-year-old woman who is an expert at making traditional Lebanese "Saj" bread. Fatima lives in a small village in the south of Lebanon. She is a member of a lending group of motivated women called "Al Takaful," which means Solidarity in Arabic.

The women of Al Takaful are determined to make their living independently, though they must overcome social pressures and challenging economic conditions to do so. This is the first time Fatima has asked for a loan from Majmoua and she hopes to become a regular client in the future. She will use the US$ 300 she is requesting to purchase a mixing machine which will help her prepare her Saj bread dough.

loans.use: Purchasing a new bread-dough mixing machine

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Sadith

texts.es:
Sadith tiene 36 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Es una mujer trabajadora que siempre ha visto la manera de solventar los gastos de su familia, diariamente y durante todo el día, atiende su bodega, con ello aporta en la economía de su hogar, ya que muchas veces el sueldo de su esposo no alcanza, hace 4 años que puso su  propia bodega, en la cual, desde sus inicios ha ofertado todo tipo de productos, así como verduras, frutas y también carne. Por motivos de salud, un tiempo, solo se limitó a traer mercadería no perecible, ahora está en ese proceso de recuperación y falta poco para que se restablezca por completo, esa fue una dificultad pasajera, pero que ya está superando.
Sadith se esfuerza diariamente por sostener la educación de sus hijos.
Solicita este préstamo porque con ello podrá incrementar su mercadería y surtir su tienda como fue desde el inicio, con variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Sadith is 36 years old, and lives with her husband and two children. She is a hardworking woman who has always found a way to settle her family's expenses. Every day, for the whole day, she tends to her general store, and that is how she contributes to her household's economy because her husband's income is often not enough. Four years ago she set up her own general store, which from the beginning has offered all sorts of products such as vegetables, fruits, and also meat. For a while, due to health issues, she limited herself to non-perishable merchandise. She is now in the process of recuperating and her health is nearly completely restored. That was a temporary difficulty which she is already overcoming. Sadith works every day to support the education of her children. She requests this loan to increase her merchandise and stock her store as it was in the beginning, with a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Re-stocking her store with a variety of products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a wider variety of goods for wholesaling

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es:
Ingrid tiene 38 años, actualmente vive  con su esposo y dos hijos.
Desde hace 8 años trabaja en su propio tienda, la necesidad de emprender su propio negocio fue a raíz de no querer trabajar fuera de casa, para atender a sus pequeños hijos que necesitan del calor de una madre, por tal motivo instaló la bodega en su mismo domicilio, aprovechando que se encuentra en una zona céntrica de su localidad, además le permite estar al tanto de los quehaceres de su hogar, todo el día es la atención de su bodega, en la cual vende todo tipo de mercadería, desde gaseosas, golosinas hasta abarrotes, Ingrid disfruta de realizar esta actividad cada día y no considera dificultades que pueda mencionar.
El motivo de su esfuerzo es por ver crecer a sus hijos con una estabilidad económica para educarlos.
Ingrid solicita este préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mercadería y de esa manera aumentar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Ingrid is 38 years old and lives with her husband and two sons. For 8 years she has worked in her own store, the necessity of launching her own business began when she didn’t want to work outside the home so she could care for her small children who needed their mother. So she opened a store in her own home, taking advantage that she is located centrally in her area. In addition this enabled her to get the household chores done and attend to her store all day, where she sells all kinds of merchandise, from soda pop, candy to groceries. Ingrid enjoys working every day and doesn’t consider herself to have any particular difficulties that she can mention. The motive behind her efforts is to see her children grow in a economically stable home and provide them an education. Ingrid asks for this loan to invest in purchasing merchandise and in this way increase her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of merchandise in her store

loans.name: Joel

texts.es:
Joel tiene 30 años, vive con sus padres. Es un joven que trabaja desde hace un año en la crianza de cuyes, tuvo esta iniciativa porque proviene de una familia que se dedica a esta actividad, implementó su criadero en varias celadas, donde clasifica a sus cuyes de acuerdo a la edad y sexo, la atención diaria y esmerada que les dedica le ha permitido aumentar considerablemente la cantidad de cuyes en su granja, en la actualidad posee más de 200, la tranquilidad de la rentabilidad en sus ventas es que es proveedor de una empresa agroindustrial, que demanda semanalmente una cantidad de cuyes, esta actividad, es su forma de vida, y le trae satisfacciones poder ser sostén en su familia.
Joel es movido constantemente por sus deseos de superación y su visión de un futuro mejor.
Invertirá el préstamo en la implementación de otro ambiente para la granja, para lo cual necesita materiales de construcción, en el futuro quiere ser un gran empresario agroindustrial en la rama de la crianza de cuyes.
texts.en:
Joel is 30 years old and lives with his parents. He is a youngster who has worked for one year raising guinea pigs. He had initiative given that he comes from a family that dedicates itself to this activity. He implemented his breeding place into various areas, where he classifies his guinea pigs based on age and sex. His daily level of attentiveness and the painstaking efforts have allowed him to considerably augment the number of animals in his farm. Currently, he possesses more than 200. The tranquility he has in his sales lies in that he is a purveyor of an agricultural enterprise which demands a weekly amount of guinea pigs. This activity is his way of life, and being able to sustain his family brings him great satisfaction.

Joel is motivated constantly by his wishes to improve his standard of living and by his vision of a better future. He will invest the loan into implementing another area in his farm, for which he requires construction materials. In the future, he would like to be a great agricultural businessman in the arena of raising guinea pigs.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of an additional area to improve his guinea pig farm.

loans.name: Kaire

texts.fr: Kairé D. est née le 08 Mars 56 à Bambey. Elle habite au quartier DVF elle vit avec  son mari sa petite famille. Son activité consiste à vendre des légumes au marché. Elle capitalise une expérience de trois ans.
texts.en:
Kairé D. was born on March 8, 1956 in Bambey. She lives in the DVF district with her husband and small family. Her business consists of selling vegetables at the market. She takes advantage of her 3-year experience.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of vegetables at the Bambey market

loans.name: Rocío

texts.es:
Rocío tiene 31 años, vive solo con sus dos hijos. Cada día trabaja en las diversas tareas del campo, cultiva papa, cereales, cebolla y alfalfa, también se dedica a la crianza de animales, al engorde de animales para luego venderlos en las ferias ganaderas de Huancayo, estas actividades le toma varias horas, todos los días sin excepción,  ya que se asegura de conseguir lo necesario para los gastos de su casa, se levanta muy temprano para cortar el pasto y darle alimento a sus animales, seguido de eso vela por el bienestar de sus campos de cultivo. Para la venta de su ganado, viaja cada tres meses para las diferentes ferias en las ciudades aledañas a su localidad.
Rocío se esfuerza para sostener a sus dos hijos que están en edad escolar.
Solicita este préstamo con el que adquirirá un torete flaco, lo hará engordar para luego venderlo en la feria ganadera.
texts.en:
Rocío is 31 years old and lives by herself with her two children. Every day, she works in the diverse tasks of the field: cultivating potato, grain, onion and alfalfa crops. She also raises farm animals, fattening them to later sell in the cattle fairs of Huancayo. She works odd hours every day of the week without exception, since she has to be assured of earning what she needs for household expenses. She gets up very early to feed the animals and allow them to graze, after which she looks after her crops. To sell her livestock, she travels every three months to different fairs in neighboring cities. Rocío strives to maintain her two school-age children. She is asking for this loan to purchase a small bull, which she will fatten and later sell at a cattle fair.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a small bull to fatten and later sell at a cattle fair.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein, 39 years old, is married and has 5 children. He owns a small fruit and vegetables shop in the Palestinian camp of Beddawi. This is the first time Hussein has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. He needs a loan for the amount of USD 1,000 to purchase more fruits and vegetables. Indeed, the holy month of Ramadan is usually a high season month for this type of business as there is more demand for vegetables than in other months.

loans.use: Increase his inventory of fruit and vegetables

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 42-year-old woman who lives in a small village close to Nabatieh, Southern Lebanon. Fatima makes "manakish" a traditional variety of Lebanese bread. Manakish is a small, soft, circular bread which is often covered in Zaatar, a Lebanese spice akin to thyme, or with cheese, or meat. Fatima's dish is very popular, a staple of the Lebanese diet.

Fatima is part of a lending group of independent women called "Al Takaful," which means Solidarity in Arabic. Though many others sell manakish, Fatima has a loyal clientele who return daily to enjoy her carefully baked bread. Fatima has requested US$ 300 to purchase new supplies. This will be Fatima's first loan with Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase new bread-making supplies

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana tiene 34 años, vive con su esposo y 3 hijos. Diariamente trabaja en el cuidado de sus animales, llevándolos a pastear al campo, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 18 años, también cultiva habas, olluco y papa, viaja periódicamente a la ciudad de Huancayo, en la cual vende su cosecha y también sus animales. Se siente ya habituada a estas labores, es satisfactoria cuando toda su familia colabora, generalmente durante las épocas de siembra y cosecha.
Ana quiere ser mejor en la vida, para lo cual está trabajando constantemente y para que sus hijos sean mejor que ella.
Invertirá el préstamo en la compra de sacos de abono para la próxima siembra, cultivará sus productos y pastos para alimentar a sus animales.
texts.en:
Ana is 34 years old, living with her husband and 3 children. She works daily in the care of her animals, taking them to pasture in the countryside. She has been doing this for 18 years, and also cultivates beans, "olluco" (an Andean tuber), and potatoes. Periodically she travels to the city of Huancayo, where she sells her harvest and also her animals. She is already used to these labors, which are satisfactory with the help of her whole family, generally during the planting and harvest seasons.

Ana wants to improve herself in life, which is why she works constantly, and so that her children will do better than her. She will invest the loan in the purchase of sacks of fertilizer for the next planting season; she will cultivate her produce and pastures to feed her animals.


Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sacks of fertilizer for the next planting season.

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.es:
Fortunato tiene 38 años, en la actualidad vive con sus 3 hijos. Desde hace 18 años se dedica a las tareas agrícolas, sembrando papa, maíz y arveja, actividad que hace para vender y para consumo propio. Todos los días sale a ver sus campos de cultivo; en el caso del maíz, lo hace secar y luego lo desgrana para ponerlo en sacos y almacenarlo para futuras ventas.El proceso para cultivar sus tierras es prepararlas echando abono, luego utiliza sus arados para la siembra, después viene la época de riego  y  echar fertilizante e insecticidas, si necesita de aplicarlos, de esa manera asegura una buen cosecha.Durante los últimos años, las variaciones climáticas han afectado seriamente sus cosechas por lo cual, desde ahora decidido cultivar para su propio consumo y producir alfalfa para la alimentación de sus animales, durante los próximos meses irá inclinando su labor mayormente a la ganadería.
Fortunato invertirá el préstamo que pide en la compra de abono para preparar su terreno, cultivar alfalfa y otros productos más.
texts.en:
Furtunato is 38 years old and lives with his 3 children. For the past 18 years he has been farming, planting potatos, corn and peas which he does to sell as well as for his own consumption. Every day he tends to his fields. In the case of corn, he dries it and later threshes it, puts it in sacks and stores it for future sales. The process for planting his fields is first to prepare them with organic fertilizer, later using his plough he sows them, and afterwards is the period when he irrigates and applies fertilizer and insecticides, if necessary. All this is to insure a good harvest. Over the past few years, climate changes have seriously affected his harvest and for this reason he has decided from now on to plant for his own consumption and to produce alfalfa for feediing his animals. During the next months, he will shift his work to mostly livestock farming. Fortunato will invest the loan he is requesting in the purchase of organic fertilizers to prepare his land to raise alfalfa and other crops.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy organic fertilizers to prepare his fields for planting.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, 49 years old, is married and has five children. He owns a home decoration shop in the city of Tripoli, Northern Lebanon. Ahmad sculpts beautiful wooden decorations for the home.

This is the first time Ahmad has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. He needs a loan of $US1,200 to purchase a new machine to sculpt wood and thereby improve his business.

loans.use: Purchase a new machine to sculpt the wood

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a talented 41-year-old woman who owns her own business producing "faux bijoux," or costume jewelery and accessories for women. Fatima lives in a small village close to Nabatieh in Southern Lebanon and she makes and sells these beautiful and popular products herself.

Women throughout the village know Fatima for her work, and much of her business comes from friends and relatives who pass on the word about her stylish jewelery products to others. She is member of a solidarity lending group called "Al Araada," which in Arabic means "The Will."

Indeed Fatima has a very strong will, and she is determined to succeed in her business. In order to purchase new materials which will help her diversify the jewelery she makes, Fatima has requested a loan of US$ 300. Fatima is confident that this capital will enable her to expand her business, and she will repay her loan over a period of four months. This is the first loan Fatima has requested from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: Purchase new supplies of metals and gems to make costume jewelery

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy D. est une jeune femme née à bambey le 1 janvier 1981. Aprés les travaux ménagers, elle s'adonne au petit commerce d'habits et de pots de fleurs. Elle sollicite ce pret pour s'approvisionner en marchandise.
texts.en:
Amy D. is a young woman who was born in Bambey on January 1, 1981. After she has done her housework, she sells clothing and pots of flowers. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy more merchandise.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of clothing and pots of flowers

loans.name: Albina

texts.es:
Albina tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo y 4 de sus 7 hijos. Trabaja arduamente en las tareas del campo, siempre está muy atenta a los cambios climáticos o alguna plaga que pueda estar en sus campos de cultivo, ya que de eso dependen las ganancias para su familia, esta actividad la viene haciendo desde hace 10 años.Cultiva en sus propias tierras, olluco, habas y papa, que lleva directamente a los mercados para la venta; también cría cerdos de los cuales vende sus crías.Hace poco tiempo, con sus ahorros compró una pequeña parcela para iniciarse en el cultivo de café y también cría algunos animales.
Albina realiza estos esfuerzos porque  sus hijos y su futuro, son lo que la motivan día a día.
El dinero será invertido en la compra de sacos de abono para preparar su tierra en esta próxima época de siembra, tanto para sus productos agrícolas como para la alfalfa para sus animales.
texts.en:
Albina is 42 years old and lives with her husband and four of her seven children. She works very hard in the fields and is always very attentive to climactic change or plagues that might be present in her fields, since her family lives off of the food they grow on their land. She has been working as a farmer for the past ten years. She grows olluco (a Peruvian variety of potato), broadbeans and potatoes, and takes them directly to local markets to sell. She also raises pigs and sells piglets. She recently bought a small parcel of land with her savings to grow coffee and raise a few animals.

Albina works as hard as she does for the future of her children; they are what motivate her each day.

Albina will use the money to buy bags of fertilizer to prepare the earth for planting, both for the crops she grows to sell and for the alfalfa she grows to feed her animals.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for farmland

loans.name: Nolberta

texts.es:
Nolberta tiene 45 años, en la actualidad vive con 5 de sus 7 hijos y su esposo. Es una mujer de mucho coraje y valor para seguir adelante, y así lo viene haciendo con las actividades ganaderas, para ello, ocupa la mayor parte de su tiempo en las diversas tareas  que ella misma se ha puesto como meta, de cuidar a sus animales diariamente, limpiando su establo y alimentándolos, esta labor es la primordial, esporádicamente se dedicó al cultivo del campo, pero reconoce que esto no le ha traído las recompensas que esperaba, por ello, hace un año decide dedicarse enteramente a las tareas ganaderas. 
El motivo diario de sus esfuerzos es sostener la educación de sus hijos.
Nolberta solicita un préstamo con el que comprará un toro adicional para la mejora y crecimiento de su ganado.
texts.en:
Nolberta is 45 years old, and currently lives with five of her seven children and her husband. She is a very courageous and brave woman with a desire to get ahead, which she does by conducting her livestock activities. This endeavor occupies much of her time, including many of the related tasks that she herself has set as her goal in this area: caring for her animals on a daily basis, cleaning their stalls and feeding them, duties that are paramount in her work. She also dedicated herself to farming sporadically, but recognized that this did not bring her the economic return she had hoped for. For this reason, it’s been one year since she’s dedicated herself solely to the livestock trade.

Her daily motivation is her desire to support her childrens’ educations.

Nolberta solicits this loan to purchase an additional bull, in order to grow and improve her herd.
