Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull to increase her livestock herd.

loans.name: Noha

texts.en: Noha is a 41 year old seamstress from Nabatieh, in Southern Lebanon. Noha is a member of "Al Wurud" solidarity lending group which means "The Roses" in Arabic. Noha is very devoted to her work and is eager to cooperate with other women to develop her business. Noha has requested a loan of $300 to purchase more thread to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase new thread for her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es:
Claudio trabajaba como empleado en un empresa, pero al ver que no le alcanzaba con lo que ganaba ahí para solventara los gastos de la casa y de sus 3 hijos, decidió poner su propio negocio, fue así como empezó vendiendo un poco de abarrotes por su casa, pero al darse cuenta que era la única tiendita del fraccionamiento, y que todos los vecinos ahí iban a comprar, decidió establecerse como una tienda de abarrotes y así fue haciendo cada vez mas grande su negocio.

El necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para tener más inventario en su tienda para ofrecerles más productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Claudio used to work as an employee of a company, but when he realized that he wasn't earning enough to pay for his household expenditures and support his three children, he decided to open his own business. So, Claudio started selling a few groceries from his home. When he realized that his was the only little grocery store in the neighborhood and that all of his neighbors were doing their shopping there, he decided to officially establish his grocery store and started to expand it bit by bit.

Claudio needs a $250 loan to increase his store's inventory so that he can offer more products to his customers. He will repay this loan in three months.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for grocery store

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo y el último de sus hijos, de 26 años,
Es una persona que siempre está trabajando para seguir superándose,  desde hace 15 años tiene una pequeña librería bazar donde vende toda las mañanas, todo tipo de útiles de escritorio y algunos artículos variados para regalos, de igual manera, en el stand que arrienda tiene su propia oficina de servicios contables, así, ejerce de manera independiente su profesión, esto le ha servido para que durante años ella y su esposo sean el sostén del hogar y ahora todos sus hijos son personas independientes, ella se siente muy contenta y feliz  porque puede seguir generando sus propios ingresos, a pesar de que las condiciones del mercado han cambiado debido a la competencia que está presente en la misma galería donde está su negocio, ya que cuando ella empezó era la única de ese rubro, ahora tiene que competir con otros puestos iguales al suyo.
Nancy desea seguir adelante, y estar siempre ocupada con el trabajo que le agrada hacer.
Invertirá su prestado en la compra de millares de papeles y espirales que son indispensables para su librería.
texts.en:
Nancy is 48 years old and she lives with her husband and the last of her children, aged 26 years old.

She is a person who is always working hard on improving herself. For the last 15 years she has had a small office supply store where she goes every morning to sell all kinds of office supplies and a few other gift items . Also her small stand has its own office of accounting services, so to manage her business independently. This has served her for many years when she and her husband were depended on for the household maintenance. She feels so happy that she has been able to keep earning their own income regardless of the job market that has been fierce from all the competition. When she first started her stand was the only one but now there are many located near her.

Nancy wants to keep her level of success and she wants to always be busy with the work that she loves to do. She will invest this loan in the purchase of stacks of paper and notebooks that are of great necessity in her store.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store, especially paper and notebooks.

loans.name: Magali

texts.es:
Magali tiene 26 años, vive con su esposo y su pequeño de 6 años, en casa de su suegro y cuñados. Ella y su esposo se dedicaron por varios años al transporte público en microbús, su esposo era el chofer y ella la cobradora, pasaron así los años, y sus ahorros le permitieron adquirir un auto de segunda mano, para trabajar haciendo taxi todos los días, los años de experiencia en esta actividad, ya suman 6, les permite tener bases sólidas en su economía.Adicionalmente, Magali es niñera, esto es un ingreso extra para ella y su familia. 
Esta pareja de esposos se esfuerza porque desean tener un hogar estable y su casa propia.
Magali solicita este préstamo el cual invertirá en la reparación del motor de su carro, para que de esa manera tenga una larga vida  su motor.
texts.en:
Magali is 26 years old and lives with her husband and little 6-year-old in her in-laws´ house. She and her husband worked in public transportation for several years; her husband was the driver of a minibus and she was the fare collector. Their savings enabled them to buy a second-hand auto which they work as a taxi service every day. The years spent in this activity, which now number 6, have enabled them to solidify their economy. In addition, Magali is a nanny; this is extra inome for her and her family. This couple works very hard because they want to have a stable home and their own house. Magali requests this loan, which will be used to fix their taxi´s motor so that this way the motor will last for a long time.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair vehicle used for taxi service.

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Ibrahima N. est né le 18 janvier 1956 à Bambey. il s'active dans le métier de la photographie depuis cinq ans. il veut acquérir un nouveau appareil avec ce pret.
texts.en:
Ibrahima N. was born on January 18, 1956 in Bambey. He has been working as a photographer for 5 years. He wants to acquire a new camera with this loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of photographic materials

loans.name: Mijail Jose

texts.es:
Mijail es un joven que desde muy pequeño ayuda a sus padres en el negocio de la venta de frutas, pero hace 2 años que empezó a estudiar su carrera se vio en la necesidad de independizarse del negocio de sus papas para poder tener mas ganancias y así poder pagarse sus estudios, al mismo tiempo que seguir ayudando al gasto familiar.

El necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía y poder ofrecerles frutas de la temporada a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mijail is a young man who has been helping his parents in their fruit selling business since he was a kid. Two years ago he started college and had to leave his parents’ business to establish his own so that he could increase his income to allow him to pay for his studies and to contribute to the family income.

Mijail needs a $250 loan to purchase products so that he can offer fruit that is in season to his clients. He will pay this loan in three months.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits.

loans.name: Yenny Judith

texts.es:
Yenny es maestra de secundaria pero como en un principio no le alcanzaba con su sueldo, decidió vender cosméticos y zapatos por catalogo en la escuela entre los mismos maestros. Ahora ya es muy conocida entre los maestros y los mismos alumnos que también le compran, y sus ventas han ido incrementando cada día más.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para tener más mercancía para ofrecerles a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Yenny is a high school teacher. When she first started working her income was not sufficient to pay her expenses so she supplemented her income by selling cosmetics and shoes by catalog to her co-workers. Her business is now well known among the teachers and students and her sales have been increasing each day.

Yenny needs a $250 loan to purchase more merchandise to offer to her clients. She will repay this loan in three months.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen desde hace 18 años se dedica a la venta de productos naturales, ella desde muy joven se ha encargado del cuidado de su madre, es por esa razón que siempre se ha visto en la necesidad de tener un negocio para poder solventar tanto sus gastos como los de su mama, ahora entre su misma clientela le han empezado a pedir que venda otras cosas esa por eso que ya vende cosméticos y quiere invertir en ello para complacer a sus clientes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía y tener más opciones para sus clientes.
texts.en:
For the past 18 years Carmen has sold natural products. Since she was very young she has taken care of her mother and for that reason she has always had the need to have a business, to pay not only her expenses but also her mother's. Now her clientele has started asking her to sell other things and because she already sells cosmetics, she wants to invest more in that to please her clients. She needs a loan for US$250, which she will repay in three months, to buy merchandise and have more options for her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Gloria Aracely

texts.es:
Gloria empezó el negocio de la repostería para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos, ya que sus hijos empezaron a estudiar y se dieron cuenta que no les alcanzaba con lo que su esposo ganaba, y ya que ella es una mujer muy emprendedora decidió empezar su propio negocio de repostería hace 6 años.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar materia prima suficiente, ya que la demanda actual sobrepasa su capacidad de producción
texts.en:
Gloria started the bakery business to help her husband with the expenses because their children started school and they realized that what her husband earned was not enough. Because she is a very enterprising woman, she decided to start her own bakery business six years ago. She needs a loan for US$250, that she will repay in three months, to buy sufficient raw material because the current demand surpasses her production capacity.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw material

loans.name: Iliana

texts.es:
Iliana desde muy pequeña ha sido una persona muy trabajadora, y desde hace 4 años que se caso empezó a dedicarse a la venta de edredones, para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, y para tener sus propios ingresos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía y así incrementar su inventario y estar preparada para la época de frío.
texts.en:
Since she was very little, Iliana has been a very hardworking person. Four years ago she married and began selling quilts to help her husband with the household expenses and to have her own income. She needs a loan for US$250, which she will repay in three months, to buy merchandise and thereby increase her inventory to be prepared for the cold season.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Angel Abad

texts.es:
Angel  es transportista, brinda sus servicios en el Trufi 88 del sindicato Eduardo Avaroa. Dicha actividad es su única fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de su esposa y su pequeño de 4 años. Paga el alquiler de una casa ubicada en laa Zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.


El crédito será invertido en el mantenimiento de su herramienta de trabajo (movilidad), puesto que la máquina necesita con urgencia una revisión.


Es su segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica de manera óptima
texts.en:
Angel is a taxi driver, working through the Trufi 88 section of the Eduard Avaroa syndicate. This is his sole income to maintain his wife and 4-year-old son. He rents a house located in the Pasankeri Zone of the city of La Paz. The loan will be invested in the maintenance of the tool of his trade, since the vehicle urgently needs an inspection. This is his second loan through Impro, his successful loan completion is his best qualification.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 8 años, su esposo es comerciante. Ella inició el negocio por la necesidad de apoyar en el gasto familiar, siempre le han gustado las ventas, por lo cual se dedico a esto, empezó vendiendo joyería entre su amigos y conocidos y poco a poco fue haciendo una cartera de clientes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y así poder cumplir unos pedidos que tiene pendientes.
texts.en:
Francisca is married and has two children who are ten and eight years old. Her husband is a salesman. She started the business to help with household expenses. She has always liked sales and for that reason started selling jewelry to her friends and acquaintances and little by little built a client base. She needs a loan for US$575, which she will repay in six months, to buy merchandise and thereby be able to fill orders that she has pending.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Enedina

texts.es:
Enedina inicio su negocio para sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que ella es la que se hace cargo de la manutención de sus hijos. Comenzó hace 7 años vendiendo comidas en su casa posteriormente rento un local y se amplio, y poco a poco ha salido adelante.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $350 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar materia prima. Con tu apoyo ella podrá continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Enedina started her business to help her children get ahead because she is the one responsible for supporting them. She started seven years ago selling food in her home and later rented a locale, expanded and little by little she has come out ahead. She needs a loan for US$350, which she will repay in four months, to buy ingredients. With your help she will be able to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Rosa inició el negocio porque se quedo sin empleo y tenia que darles de comer a sus 2 hijos de 5 y 3 años, así como ayudar a su mamá que se encuentra enferma de diabetes y ya no puede caminar debido a que le amputaron ambas piernas. Ella se dedica la venta de colchas y zapatos por catalogo y gracias a esta actividad ha podido salir adelante.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para compra de mercancía y un estante para mostrarla y así incrementar las ventas.
texts.en:
Rosa started the business because she was out of work and had to feed her two children who are five and three years of age, and also help her mother who is sick with diabetes and can't walk due to the fact that they amputated both of her legs. She works selling bedspreads and shoes by catalog and thanks to that has been able to come out ahead. She needs a loan for US$475, which she will repay in six months, to buy merchandise and a shelf to display it on and thereby increase the sales.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Yaliou

texts.fr: Yaliou A. est âgé de 29 ans, célibataire sans enfants. Il tient de puis 2 ans une boutique d’alimentation générale à Kpalimé, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il souhaite augmenter la capacité de son commerce avec ce crédit en achetant des sacs de riz, des cartons de savons, laits de sucres et d’autres boîtes de conserves. Ceci fera augmenter ses ventes qui, par ricochet entraîneront une augmentation de ses profits.
texts.en:
Yaliou A., 29, is single and has no children. For two years, he has been tending a little general store in Kpalimé, a town located about 120 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. He wants to bolster the capacity of his little business with this loan by buying sacks of rice, cases of soap, milk, sugar, and tinned goods. This will increase his sales which will lead to an increase in his profit.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying sacks of rice, cases of soap, milk, sugar, and tinned goods

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is a great Mom with two grown children, a husband and a happy family. She has invested much of her life in her most precious endeavor, raising her children. However, she could always successfully balance work and family without any damage to either. That has probably been one the secrets of her success. Olga launched her own venture only 7 years ago. However, she already has about $2000 in inventory. Her net profit is about $500 a month.

Olga is a very reliable client. She has been prompt with all her payments to Nadiya Ukraine and has never had a late payment. Today, as Olga and her husband are both retired, their business provides a stable source of income and security in life. Olga is hoping to continue keeping this business stable. She is requesting a loan of 5000 Grivnas to construct a vending kiosk and increase the assortment of merchandise she offers for retail sale in her stand. She is hoping to keep her business running and bringing her a profit in the future as well.

loans.use: To construct a vending stall

loans.name: Luis Francisco

texts.es:
Luis Francisco inició el negocio porque no alcanza con su sueldo para poder solventar los gastos de sus hijos tanto en sus estudios como en los problemas de salud de dos de ellos. Por lo que se empezó a dedicar a reparar pulidoras y aspiradoras, y gracias a esta actividad ha podido sacra adelante a su familia.

El necesita un préstamo por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar herramienta para dar un mejor servicio a mis clientes y así obtener mayor ganancia para el sustento de la familia.
texts.en:
Luis Francisco started his business because he was not able to afford his two children's educational or health care expenses on his salary. This is the reason he began to repair polishing devices and vacuum cleaners. Thanks to this activity, he has been able to help out his family.

Luis needs a loan of $475 to buy tools that will allow him to provide better service to his clients and will therefore increase the contribution he makes toward supporting his family; he will repay the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools.

loans.name: Novinyo Yao

texts.fr:
Novinyo Yao E. est âgé de 42 ans, marié et père de 5 enfants. Il est revendeur de « sodabi », une boisson locale tant appréciée par la population, à Kpalimé, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Yao désire par ce crédit faire de stock en sodabi afin d’eviter des ruptures de stocks en période de pénurie. Il compte sur cette opportunité pour gagner sa vie.
200 000 12 mois
texts.en:
Novinyo Yao E., 42, is married and the father of 5 children. He sells "sodabi," a local drink much appreciated by the populace in Kpalimé, a town located about 120 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Yao wants to use this loan to stock up on sodabi so as to avoid running out of it when there is none to be had. He is counting on this opportunity to support himself.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying "sodabi" for re-sale

loans.name: Valeryi

texts.en:
Valeryi offers taxi services in Ivano-Frankivsk. He has been working in this sphere of business for 2 years. Valeryi admits he has benefited a lot from financial assistance he has received from Nadiya Ukraine. Currently, his business has grown to the point where he receives about US$ 40-50 daily. 

Valeryi is hoping to buy a better and trendier vehicle in the future to offer more high-class services to his clients. At this point he is only saving some money to make his dream come true. Valeryi thinks this 5000 Grivna loan will help him move closer to the fulfillment of his plans. He is hoping to spend this amount on painting the body of his vehicle to give it a fresh look. Some day when he saves enough, he is hoping to buy a newer but affordable vehicle.

loans.use: to paint his car, used as a taxi

loans.name: Eva Alicia

texts.es:
Eva inició el negocio porque su hijo sufrió un accidente al caerle agua hirviendo en su cuerpo y debía de costear los gastos del tratamiento ya que su pequeño duro mucho tiempo en el hospital por lo que ella perdió su empleo; movida por las necesidades económicas ella empezó con la venta de perfumes y ropa lo que le ha permitido salir adelante.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía nueva y perfumes para el desarrollo del negocio y tener más ventas. Con tu apoyo Eva saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Eva started her business after her son was scalded in an accident involving boiling water. She had to pay for the cost of treatments for the extended time her young son spent in the hospital. For this reason, Eva lost her job. Driven by financial need, she began to sell perfumes and clothing; this activity has enabled her to improve her situation.

Eva needs a loan of $475 for the purchase of new merchandise and perfumes that will allow her to develop her business and increase sales. She will repay the loan within 6 months. With your help, Eva will succeed in her mission.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Sergey

texts.en:
Sergey is running a transportation services business in Ivano-Frankivsk. He is married with a teenage daughter who is 16. Sergey has been in this business for 9 years already. He rents a car and uses it to offer taxi rides to his customers. His daily income is about US$ 30-40.

Sergey would like to purchase the vehicle he's renting at this point to be able to manage his time and efforts more efficiently and become full owner of business. We believe Sergey's focused approach to business and his diligent hard work will help him repay this loan on time and expand his business as a result.

loans.use: To purchase a vehicle to use as a taxi

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi T. est revendeuse de pagnes au centre commercial de Kpalimé, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agée de 29 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle opère dans ce secteur depuis 5 ans. Akouvi désire par ce crédit augmenter la capacité de son activité en achetant des balles de pagnes pour la revente. Ceci lui permettra de gagner plus afin de mieux subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Akouvi T. sells "pagnes" (lengths of African print cloth) in the commercial center of Kpalimé, a town situated about 120 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. At 29 years old, she is married and the mother of 2 children. She has been working in this sector for 5 years. Akouvi wants to use this loan to bolster her business by buying bales of "pagnes" for re-sale. This will allow her to earn more so as to better support her children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "pagnes" for re-sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FECECAV - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Mónica inició el negocio porque falleció su esposo y se quedo desamparada con tres hijos y necesitaba solventar los gastos del hogar, así como pagarles la escuela y las deudas que le dejo la enfermedad de su esposo y el pago de su casa. Ella se dedicó a la venta de ropa nueva y usada y le ha ido bien hasta la fecha.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $675 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía nueva y seminueva para el desarrollo del negocio y tener más ventas.
texts.en:
Mónica started a business when she lost her husband and was left with three children and the dilemma of how to pay for houshold expenses. These expenses include her children's schooling costs and the debts resulting from her husband's illness as well as house payments. She began selling new and used clothes and the business has been going well up until now.

Mónica needs a loan of $675 to purchase new and almost-new merchandise for the development of her business and to increase sales; she will repay the loan within six months.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr:
Kossiwa G. est revendeuse de céréales au grand marché de Kpalimé, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agée de 47 ans, kossiwa est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle souhaite par ce crédit s’approvisionner en maïs, mil, haricots et arachides. Elle compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer ses conditions de vie.
100 000 12 mois
texts.en:
Kossiwa G. is a reseller of grains in the central market place at Kpalime, a town located about 120 kliometers from Lome, the Togolese capital. Kossiwa is 47 years old, married and is the mother of five (5) children. She is requesting this loan to purchase corn, millet, beans and peanuts. She expects that this opportunity will improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sacks of corn, millet, beans, and peanuts

loans.name: Maria Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira inicio el negocio por la falta de dinero y que no le ayudaba el papa de sus hijos con la manutención de los pequeños. En aquel entonces su necesidad principal era la salud de su hija menor por que tenia pegado el labio con la encía y se necesita una operación, aunado que tenia que darles de comer a sus hijos y solventar los gastos de la casa. Entonces ella encontró en la venta de zapatos una fuente de ingresos que le permitía generar ganancias y no descuidar a sus hijos. A través del tiempo a adquirido muchos clientes y ha crecido su negocio, no solo separa en los mercados con su carro para vender, sino también en su casa vende y ha acondicionado un cuarto para negocio. Ahora sus hijos están mas tranquilos por que no les falta casi nada y esta juntando para la operación de su hija,

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar estantes para exhibir sus productos y más mercancía. Con tu apoyo Elvira saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Elvira started her business for lack of money and because she was not receiving financial support for her children from their father. At that time, her priority was the health of her youngest daughter, who had a deformity and needed an operation, even though she needed to feed her children and pay household expenses, too.

Elvira discovered a source of income in shoe sales, which allowed her to make financial gains without neglecting her children. With time, she has acquired many clients and has grown her business. She not only drives to the market to sell her products, but she has outfitted a room in her house to sell from home. Now, her children are more calm because they lack almost nothing that they need and are facing her daughter's operation together.

Elvira needs a loan in the amount of $400 to purchase shelves to display her products and to buy more merchandise; she will repay the loan in six months. With your help, Elvira can achieve her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shelves and merchandise.

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Komla A. est âgé de 35 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. Il est mécanicien à Kpalimé, un village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il désire par ce crédit acheter des outils de travail pour mieux répondre aux exigences de la clientèle. Il compte sur cette opportunité pour changer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Komla A. is 35 years old, married and the father of three (3) children. He is a mechanic in Kpalime, a town located about 120 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. With this loan he would like to buy work tools so that he could better respond to the needs of his customers. He is expecting this opportunity will improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of work tools to respond to the needs of his customers

loans.name: Martha Yolanda

texts.es:
Martha inició el negocio por la falta de trabajo y por que nadie le ayudaba en los gasto de sus hijos y de la casa, ante la necesidad de solventar los gastos del hogar y de sus pequeños ella busco una actividad que le generara ingresos y en su casa empezó a vender refrescos y frituras, poco a poco fue creciendo hasta tener una pequeña tienda de abarrotes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $950 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar vitrinas y estantes ya que le esta yendo muy bien y quiere tener buena imagen en su tienda.
texts.en:
Martha started her business for lack of a job and because no one was helping her with the costs of raising her kids and paying for her house. Confronted with the necessity of resolving the expenses associated with her home and her small children, she sought an activity that would generate income. From her house, she began to sell refreshments and fried finger foods. The business grew little by little to the point of having a small grocery store.

Martha needs a loan of $950 to be repaid within six months in order to buy display cabinets and shelves; her business is going well and she wants her store to have a good image.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy display cabinets and shelves.

loans.name: Issaka

texts.fr: Issaka M. est âgé de 33 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il est revendeur d’huile à moteur à Kpalimé, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Issaka espère avec ce crédit acheter beaucoup plus de marchandises pour la revente afin de mieux répondre à la demande de ses clients et de gagner aussi plus d’argent pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Issaka M. is 33 years old, married and the father of two (2) children. He is a reseller of motor oil in Kpalime, a town situated about 120 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. With his loan Issaka plans to buy much more merchandise for resale so that he can meet the demands of his customers. Also, he will earn more profit to support the needs of his family.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase containers of motor oil for resale.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Abra A. tient depuis 3 ans une boutique d’alimentation générale à Kpalimé, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle est âgée de 55 ans, mariée e mère de 5 enfants. Elle espère par ce crédit approvisionner sa boutique en achetant des sacs de riz, des cartons de sucres, de laits et autres boîtes de conserves. Cet approvisionnement va entraîner une augmentation des ventes et par conséquent une hausse des gain ; ce qui lui permettra de bien subvenir aux besoins de la famille
texts.en:
For three years, Abra A. has been tending a general store in Kpalimé, a town located about 120 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She is 55, married, and the mother of 5 children. She hopes to use this loan to replenish the inventory of her store by buying sacks of rice, cases of sugar, milk, and other tinned foods. This improved range of goods will lead to increased sales and thus, an increased profit, which will allow her to better support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sacks of rice, cases of sugar, milk, and other tinned goods

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FECECAV - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
Gonzalo inició el negocio para poder ayudar a su familia ya que falleció su papa y su hijo mayor nació con problemas de asma. Su principal necesidad era la de mantener a su mamá ya que se había quedado viuda y con hijos pequeños que mantener y pagarles su estudio; además que su hijo presentaba mayor al momento de su nacimiento presento problemas de bronquitis y asma los cuales se le complicaba muy seguido. El se dedica la compra y venta de llantas negocio que le ha redituado buena ganancias y le ha permitido salir adelante.

El necesita un préstamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar más llantas para el negocio y así hacer crecer las ventas y tener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Gonzalo started his business to be able to help his family, given that he had lost his father, and because his oldest son was born with asthma problems. His primary concern was to support his widowed mother, who had young children to care for, and to pay for their school. Additionally, his son demonstrated breathing problems from birth in the form of bronchitis and asthma; the complications soon worsened. Gonzalo works in the purchase and sale of tires, a business that has brought him good earnings and has allowed him to get ahead.

Gonzalo needs a loan of $400 to be repaid within 6 months to purchase more tires for his business and thereby increase sales and have more income.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Nogaye

texts.fr: Ngone N. est née le 01 janvier 1954 à Bambey.Elle habite au quartier DVF.Elle s'active dans le commerce d'épices depuis plus d'un an.elle a sollicité ce pret pour renforcer son Activité.
texts.en:
Ngone N. was born on January 1, 1954 in Bambey. She lives in the DVF district. She has been working in the trade of spices for more than a year. She requested this loan to strengthen her business.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of Spices

loans.name: Lesbia Elvira

texts.en:
Lesbia Elvira F. Martínez 37 years old Q3665,- / $500 This is the story of a young woman who, just as so many others, struggles to find her way in life. Perhaps more than for others, her work plays a major role in helping her find her life's direction. This woman is called Lesbia and she lives in the Guatemalan City Prison called Santa Teresa.

I get the opportunity to meet with Lesbia when I accompanied Sergio Roberto Gonzalez, the director of FAPE, on a special day organised by FAPE to teach the women how to run a business. Entering the prison is relatively easy, and the two stamps on my arm ensure that I can rejoin the outside world. Obviously for the women here, it is another story. This facility is a place where most of the inmates await their trial. The slow process of the courts means that some of them have been waiting for more than four years. Sitting together in the prison's enclosed patio area, we begin our chat and Lesbia tells me that she has been there for four years and one month.

Before she began her time in this facility, Lesbia was living in Guatemala City. Her family is from a nearby area called San Miguel Petápa. She is trained as a teacher and has a 20-year-old brother.

In prisons in Guatemala, like many other developing countries, authorities supply only the most basic essentials. Beyond shelter, food and water, the standard of a prisoner's life depends on what their family can provide them with. Items such as clothing, books, and toiletries are all given by the inmate's families. Because Lesbia's mother is ill at the moment and cannot visit her, she has no one but herself to rely on.

Living circumstances within the prison are far from easy. The women live in a single room with 24 other inmates. The beds are made out of concrete. In order to give a semblance of privacy, the prisoners hang sheets between adjacent beds giving each woman has a solitary square metre of her own. Currently there are about 225 people live in the facility.

Last year, students from the University Rafael Landivar (URL) came to the prison and to teach interested inmates how to run a small business. There were courses given in all kinds of business related subjects, such as credit control, writing a business plan, etc. Inspired by the course, Lesbia decided to make all kinds of small decorative items for books and pens by hand. These charming products gave an outlet to Lesbia's talents and a focus to her life while incarcerated. But it has become more than that now.

The course organisers successfully petitioned the facility to allow inmates that performed very well in the course the chance to sell their wares at a market stall in the university for a day. Lesbia was one of those chosen. She tells me with pride how she was able to sell all of her goods, and that it proved to her how well her business could perform in the outside world. The experience has inspired her to pursue her entrepreneurial dream and more than just a distraction from her mundane existence in jail.

In the picture, Lesbia is holding a big bag of her products that she hopes to sell at a local church. I am amazed when she mentions to me that it has taken her only two days to produce so many items. There's nothing else to do in prison, she admits; there are no books, no televisions, and so days are very long there. She focuses her entire life upon her business. In order to work in the evening times, Lesbia had to seek special permission for the use of a lamp. She's even allowed to own a scissors, a necessary item for her work. Privileges like these are only available to women that show that they are dedicated entrepreneurs and participate in all of the offered social programs.

Lesbia initially sold her products to friends that came to visit her in jail. However, since the facility recognises Lesbia's responsible behaviour, they now approve her non-family visitors more readily. This has proved very useful, as Lesbia is now able to use these visits to send out her products to clients as well as to receive materials. Many of her suppliers she has never met in person, only over the phone. It is certainly a challenge to run her business from this facility, but she is able to manage.

Before her business, Lesbia didn't believe that she was very creative. Now, however, she actively seeks out inspiration for new product designs wherever she can. Some of these designs shall be part of the new selection of products that she hopes will be ready in time for Christmas. Lesbia realises very well that her customers like her products, but in order to maintain their interest, she needs to offer them something new and keep her products fresh. A brilliant commercial thinker, if you ask me.

I ask Lesbia if there is something that she wants me to write in her story, and she tells me that she wants to thank FAPE for giving her this life-changing opportunity. She tells me how she knows that funding women in prison may have been seen as a risky investment and that FAPE was the only organisation who thought it worthwhile. Having FAPE believe in them has given her back a large part of her dignity and self esteem.

Towards the end of our interview, when I ask Lesbia about what her dreams are, she becomes a little emotional. She explains to me how being in prison can change a person's way of thinking. She feels that she has grown, spiritually and as a person. Her biggest wish now is to be able to have a little shop somewhere in the city where she can sell not only her own products, but also the products of people that find themselves in situations similar to the ones that she herself faced. Her experiences have taught her much about herself, she tells me, and she hopes that the lessons that she has learned she will be able to teach to others. This is what she is working for now: the new life she wants to build after prison and the credit will help her with this!

loans.use: To buy materails for making handicrafts.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa A. is 50 years old, married and the mother of five children, two of whom are currently in school. For the last 12 years, she has made a living and supported her family by selling grocery products and yams. She says business is slow because she lacks enough money to buy supplies. That's why she has applied for a loan to increase her inventory. She believes the loan will help her increase her savings and provide for her last two children, who are now in school. She is a member of the group called Partners. Members agree to  support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more products like tin fish, canned tomatoes, cocoa, skimmed milk and body pomade.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert N. is a 55 year old businessman who sells hardwares. He is married with six children, who are all currently in school. Robert is very hardworking and provides for his family's daily needs. He sells items like radio sets, batteries, touch lights, screwdrivers, machine oil, door locks, and lanterns in Dunkwa, where he lives with his family. He also supports his wife's business selling used clothing, which helps provide for the family.

With this loan, he wants to purchase more goods in order to increase sales. He hopes to rent a container shop that can accommodate all his products. This will ease his cost movements and risk of theft. He is a member of the community group called Anointed Trust Group. In this group, Members guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of hardwares to sell.

loans.name: Ataa

texts.en:
Ataa P. is in business in the local market of Dunkwa, a suburb of Obuasi in the Ashanti Region of Ghana, where she lives with her family. She is a 46-year-old woman, married with six children who are currently in school. She is a busy petty trader who sells tomatoes, spices and other vegetables on top of a table in the market. Ataa says the sale of vegetables provides her with income to put food on the table for her family. However, she does not have sufficient working capital to run the business well and this retards her business progress.

She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality stock to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes, spices, vegetable oil, etc. for re-sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is 24 years old. She is married and has a little child. To support her household, she has been selling foodstuffs like maize, plantains, beans, groundnuts, and gari in the neighborhood to her loyal customers. She enjoys selling foodstuffs and takes pride in serving her customers.

Alberta says the sale of these products is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her make a good income to support her family. Alberta is a member of the group called Anointed Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan

loans.use: To buy food stuffs like maize, plantains, groundnuts, gari, and beans for re-sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary H. is a 44 year old widow and mother of four children. From the income she's earned from her business, Mary has been able to support all her children in completing high school.

She is a petty trader who sells vegetables and fruit in the local market and she enjoys selling goods. Mary has good customer care and because of that many customers buy from her stand. However, she buys her supplies on credit at relatively high prices due to lack of adequate working capital.

With this loan, she wants to purchase supplies of vegetables, salt, and fruit in bulk to better serve her customers. She belongs to the community group called Progress Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to repay their loans.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables, salt, and fruit in bulk.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is thirty-nine years old. She is married with five kids, of whom two have successfully completed high school and the other three are still in schooling. Ellen enjoys selling and she is motivated to work hard because she dreams of a better future for her kids.

Ellen owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc. However, she is constrained by low capital from making meaningful progress. She is requesting a loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams etc. to make increased profits. She believes with her good customer relations, the loan will enable her to realize her dream. She is a member of the community group called Esther Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Sopey Saliou Touré Group

texts.fr: La communauté rurale de ndoulo est situé dans l'écovillage Keur Goumak (http://www.sem-fund.org/keurgumaggfr.php). Comme le village a souffert de longues années de sécheresse et désertifictation, les femmes se sont constituées en groupement pour s'activer dans les travaux de petit commerce. L'activité repose sur la capacité du Groupement à acheter des denrées de première nécessité (des sacs de mil, tablettes de Maggi, des sachets de lait en poudre, bidons d’huile, des cartons de savons, des sacs de sucre, des sacs de riz, des paquets de biscuits) au moment où les prix sont très bas sur le marché et de les stocker. Se faisant, elles vont satisfaire la demande en organisant la redistribution  « vente »  continue pendant toute l’année au niveau des marchés hebdomadaires, des communautés rurales voisines,  tout en  évitant les ruptures de stock de ces produits.
texts.en:
The rural community of Ndoulo is located in the Keur Goumak ecovillage (http://www.sem-fund.org/keurgumaggfr.php). Since the village has suffered from many years of drought and desertification, the women grouped themselves together to start small businesses. The group's business consists of buying essential food products (bags of millet, Maggi cubes, dried milk sachets, cans of oil, cartons of soap, bags of sugar and rice, and boxes of biscuits) when the market prices are very low, and storing them. Once this is done, they will be able to meet the demands by organizing a continued redistribution “sale” year round at weekly markets and neighbouring rural communities, while avoiding stock shortages of these products.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of consumer products

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.

Delia es casada, tiene 37 años y 5 hijos, Delia viaja a dos ferias de la región como Pampamarca que se ubica a 2 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho y Trigopampa que se ubica a 1 hora de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde Delia vende ropa variada, verduras y de las ferias compra cereales, queso, que luego de acopiar vende a los comerciantes de los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Delia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de chompas, pantalones, casacas. Delia sueña con tener una tienda en su casa, tener capital propio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Delia is a partner in the Rainbow Communal Bank.

Delia is 37 years old and married, with five children. She travels to two regional markets: one is in Pampamarca, two hours away from Ayacucho and the other is in Trigopampa, one hour away from Ayacucho. Delia sells a variety of clothing and vegetables at the market and buys grains and cheese. She later sells these to local merchants in Ayacucho.

Delia needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she'll use to buy sweaters, pants, and jackets. Delia dreams of having a store in her home, of having capital of her own, and of her children growing up to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Delia needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she'll use to buy sweaters, pants, and jackets.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena F. is 24 years old. She is a wife and the mother of one kid who is now schooling. She loves selling goods, the business through which she obtains her daily source of livelihood. She has been selling yams for the past seven years to support her family. Yams are one of the favorite staple foods that supply carbohydrate components in diets.

Abena takes delivery from farmers who provide her with a direct supply. This enables her to avoid middlemen who buy from the farmers and re-sell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to buy yams in bulk to better serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kid in school. Abena is a member of a community group called Dorcas Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To purchase more yams directly from the farmers

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.

Victoria es separada, tiene 43 años y 3 hijos, Victoria vive en una casa alquilada en el barrio de Wari Accopampa, Victoria viaja a 5 ferias de la región, en días distintos, en donde vende mantas, abarrotes variados y de las ferias compra cereales, queso, que luego de acopiar traslada a la ciudad de Ayacucho y lo vende a los comerciantes de los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Victoria necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de mantas, azúcar, arroz, fideos. Los sueños de Victoria son que sus hijos sean profesionales mejores que ella, mejorar su negocio y tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Victoria is a partner in the Rainbow Communal Bank.

Victoria is 43 years old and separated, with three children. She lives in a home that she rents in the Wari Accopampa neighborhood. Victoria travels to five different markets in the region, each on a different day. She sells blankets and various groceries at the markets, and buys grains and cheese, which she brings back to Ayacucho. Victoria then sells these products to the local merchants of Ayacucho.

Victoria needs a loan of 2000 soles which she'll use to buy blankets, sugar, rice, and noodles. Victoria dreams of her children growing up to be better professionals than herself, of improving her business and of owning her own home.


Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Victoria needs a loan of 2000 soles which she'll use to buy blankets, sugar, rice, and noodles.

loans.name: Rayda

texts.es:
Rayda es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.

Rayda es casada, tiene 32 años y 3 hijos, Rayda viaja a la feria Sallalli que esta a 3 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho y Niñobamba que queda a 2 horas, Rayda vende abarrotes surtidos y de las ferias compra cereales, quesos y animales que beneficia en su casa y lo vende de casa en casa. Además Rayda en los días que no viaja a las ferias vende comida por las noches en el estadio cercano a su casa en el barrio de Cuchipampa.

Rayda necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de quesos, animales menores. Los sueños de Rayda son salir adelante con sus hijos, mejorar su casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rayda is a partner in the Rainbow Communal Bank.

Rayda is 32 years old and married, with three children. She travels to the Sallalli market, which is three hours away from Ayacucho, and Niñobamba market, which is two hours away. At the markets, Rayda sells groceries and buys grains, cheeses, and livestock. She keeps some of these for her home, and sells the rest door to door. On the days that Rayda doesn't go to the markets, she spends her evenings selling food in the stadium near her home, in the Cuchipampa neighborhood.

Rayda needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she'll use to buy cheese and small animals.

Rayda dreams of getting ahead with her children, improving her home, and providing her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rayda needs a loan of 1000 soles which she'll use to buy cheese and small livestock.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.

Elena es casada, tiene 43 años y 4 hijos, Elena tiene una tienda muy surtida en su casa ubicada en el barrio Wari Accopampa, en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, cereales, frutas, carnes, especerías que ella prepara por las tardes, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hija y también de un personal. Además Elena tiene cabinas de Internet que esta ubicado al frente de su tienda en un local alquilado y esta atendido por un personal.

Elena necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que fue invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo, aceite. Elena sueña con seguir adelante, ampliar su negocio, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elena is a partner in the Rainbow Communal Bank.

Elena is 43 years old and married, with four children. She owns a well-stocked grocery store, where she sells vegetables, grains, fruits, meats, and fresh spices. She prepares the spices every afternoon with her daughter and an employee. Elena's store is located in her home in the Wari Accopampa neighborhood. She also runs an internet cafe, located in a rented space across the street. The internet cafe is tended to by an employee.

Elena needs a loan of 3000 soles, which she will use to buy rice, sugar, noodles, and cooking oil.

Elena dreams of getting ahead, expanding her business, and providing her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Elena needs a loan of 3000 soles, which was invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, noodles, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Ana Jacinta

texts.es:
Ana, D. 40 años D. edad, socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen D. Asunción D. Carhuaz”, espera tener un restaurante más amplio donD. pueda atender a más clientes, ya que tiene L. ayuda D. su esposo como cocinero y el apoyo D. sus 5 hijos adolescentes.

DesD. hace 6 años, el restaurante “Las Delicias” sirve a diversos comensales en L. ciudad D. Carhuaz, departamento D. Ancash y es  atendido por los hijos D. Ana, quienes cumplen labores D. meseros.

Con el préstamo D. S/ 200, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará sacos D. arroz,  y D. azúcar, 1 caja D. aceite y con lo demás pagará L. academia preuniversitaria D. su segundo hijo.
texts.en:
Ana is 40 years old and is a member of the community bank “Virgen D. Asunción D. Carhuaz”. She hopes to have a bigger restaurant where she would be able to serve more clients. She already has a restaurant with the help of her spouse as a chef and the help of her five adolescent children. For the past 6 years, the restaurant “Las Delicias” has served diverse food in the city of Carhuaz, in the department of Ancash. It is attended by Ana’s children, who work as waiters. With this loan of S/ 200, which she would repay in 4 months, she would buy sacks of rice and sugar, 1 box of oil and with the rest she would pay for a college-prep academy for her second son.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther es socia del Banco Comunal Cusi Urpi que significa Palomita Feliz en quechua.

Esther es casada, tiene 45 años y 3 hijo. Esther tiene un cafetín ubicado dentro del local de un instituto superior de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Esther vende golosinas, galletas, gaseosas y comida, el horario de atención es desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de un personal. Además Esther los días sábados y Domingos viaja a las ferias de la región donde vende abarrotes y de las ferias compra cereales que vende a los comerciantes de los mercados.

Esther necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas, arroz y azúcar. Esther sueña con ampliar su negocio, tener una casa comercial mayorista y brindar una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Esther is a partner in the Cusi Urpi Communal Bank. Cusi Urpi means "A Happy Approval" in Quechua.

Esther is 45 years old and married, with three children. She has a small cafe locted on a college campus in Ayacucho, where she sells sweets, cookies, sodas, and food. Esther's cafe is open from 7am to 7pm, and she has an employee who helps her in the cafe. On Saturdays and Sundays Esther travels to regional markets where she sells groceries and buys grains, which she later sells to local merchants.

Esther needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she'll use to buy sodas, rice, and sugar. Esther dreams of expanding her cafe, owning a wholesale business, and providing a good education for her son.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Esther needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she'll use to buy sodas, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
For the past eleven years, Hannah A. has been trading in the local market of Obuasi in Ghana. She is a fifty year-old woman, married with three children who at school.

Hannah is busy trader who sells yams and fish on top of a table in the local market. She is, however, convinced that her business can grow better with increased capital. She therefore wants this loan to buy more tubers of yams and fresh fish to increase her stock. She hopes to use part of her proceeds to finance her children's education.

She belongs to the trust group called Dorcas Trust Group. In this group, members assist one another to provide support in handling the repayment.

loans.use: To buy yam and dried fish in bulk.

loans.name: Basilica Ortencia

texts.es:
Basílica, de 44 años de edad, socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de Martha II” sueña con tener un local propio donde pueda vender anticuchos, pancitas, rachis a los clientes que ha ganado desde hace 18 años. Tiene 3 hijos y vive junto a su esposo, el cual es profesor.

Su domicilio está ubicado en el jirón Julián de Morales Nº 618 en la ciudad de Huaraz, al cual también lo utiliza como centro de trabajo. Todas las tardes sale a su puerta con una carpa y se establece para expender los anticuchos que ella misma prepara horas antes.

“Salir a vender siendo profesora fue mi mas grande reto que por los prejuicios mucha gente me observaba con recelo” afirma.

Con el préstamo de S/.200, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará un balón de gas y dará un adelanto para su nueva parrilla.
texts.en:
Basílica is 44 years old; she is a member of the Communal Bank "Señor de Martha II". She dreams of owning her own shop where she can sell kebabs, tripe, 'rachis' to the clients she has earned over the course of 18 years. She has three children and lives with her husband, who is a professor. Her home is located on Julián de Morales street, Number 618 in the city of Huaraz. She also uses her home as her workplace. Every afternoon, she sets a tent next to her front door and sells the kebabs that she makes herself hours beforehand. She says that "to go out and sell while being a teacher was her greatest challenge since people with prejudices looked down upon her". With this loan of $75 USD, which she will pay back in 4 months, she will buy a gas canister and will make a downpayment on her new grill.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a new gas canister and make a downpayment on a new grill

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena, de 32 años de edad, socia del banco comunal “Unión Pedregal”, quisiera que su negocio creciera más, ya que junto a su conviviente se dedican hace cuatro años a la venta de hamburguesas y sándwich en un pequeño local en el jirón la mar, una zona céntrica de la ciudad de Huaraz. 

Elena prepara los insumos y con la ayuda de su hija de 14 años, quien cuida a su hermanito menor, se dedican a este negocio.

El préstamo de S/. 500, el cual pagará en 4 meses, implementará el negocio comprando embutidos al por mayor y sillas para ambientar mejor el local.
texts.en:
Elena is 32 years old and is a member of the communal bank “Union Pedregal.” For four years, she and her partner have been selling hamburgers and sandwiches in a small stall in jiron la mar, a central neighborhood in the city of Huaraz. Her hope is to expand her business.

Elena prepares the ingredients with the help of her 14 year old daughter who also takes care of her younger brother. The loan of $175 - which she will pay in four months - will be used to purchase meats and to purchase chairs to improve the environment of business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of meats and chairs for restaurant.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris K. is a 38-year-old woman who is divorced and has two children in school. Doris works very hard to provide food for herself and her children. 

Doris has four years of experience selling goods, such as ladies' bags, shoes, materials and other footwear, in a market center at Obuasi, Ghana. She believes that, with her good human relations skills, and her proximity to the market area, the loan would help her to purchase the right quantity of goods demanded by her loyal customers. She says this would help her make more profit to expand her business and also finance her children's education. 

Doris K. is a member of the Prince trust group. In this group, members assist one another to provide support in handling repayment. Her picture was taking when she was visited at her shop.

loans.use: To buy more women shoes, bags, slippers, cloths and materials.

loans.name: Elidia Santa

texts.es:
Elidia, de 37 años de edad, socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen de Asunción de Carhuaz”, espera tener una tienda de venta de regalos en Carhuaz para poder mantener mejor a sus dos hijos, ya que su conviviente gana muy poco en los trabajos temporales que tiene.

Elidia vende abarrotes en una tiendita al frente del Hospital de Carhuaz, en el Jr.  Unión 230 en el departamento de Ancash. Los días viernes lleva productos a la capital (Lima) donde vende de manera ambulatoria y es en estos días que sus hijos se encargan del negocio.

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,700, el cual pagará en 8 meses, comprará 2 sacos de arroz , 2 sacos de azúcar y también lo invertirá en comprar productos de la zona para llevar a la ciudad de Lima.
texts.en:
Elidia is 37 years old and is a member of the comunal bank “Virgen de Asunción de Carhuaz.” Her hope is to have a gifts store in Carhuaz in order to better support her children since her partner does not earn much in his seasonal jobs.

Elidia sells groceries in a small store facing the Carhuaz hospital. On Fridays, when she travels to Lima to sell her products as a street vendor, her children take care of the business.

With this loan of $575 - which she will pay in eight months - she will purchase two sacks of rice, 2 sacks of sugar and she will also invest in purchasing products to sell in Lima.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar and other products.

loans.name: Elisa Benjamina

texts.es:
Elisa, de 49 años de edad, socia del Banco Comunal “Unión Pedregal”, sueña con tener un negocio propio, como un restaurante. 

Debido a que ella realiza actividades en su barrio, la venta de alimentos como las tamaladas, polladas y otros, beneficia en parte a su familia, a pesar de contar con ingresos que genera su esposo, también (su esposo) colabora junto a sus tres menores hijos con la realización de este negocio. 

Elena prepara los alimentos en su casa, el cual está ubicada en el barrio de pedregal alto en la ciudad de Huaraz, luego lo distribuye a pedido de los clientes. La mayor dificultad está en que a veces los clientes no le pagan a tiempo, pero aún así, ella espera tener un local donde pueda tener un negocio de servicio de restaurante.

Con el préstamo de S/. 500, el cual pagará en 4 meses, invertirá en insumos para sus polladas, platos y tenedores descartables que lo almacenará para las próximas actividades.
texts.en:
Elisa is 49 years old and is a member of the communal bank “Union Pedregal.” Her dream is to have her own restaurant.

She works selling food such as tamaladas and polladas in her neighborhood in order to benefit her family. Even though they count on her husband’s income, her husband and her three small children also help Elisa with her business.

Elisa prepares the food in her home which is located in the pedregal alto neighborhood in the city of Huaraz. She then distributes her clients’ orders. Her biggest difficulty is that her clients sometimes do not pay her in time. Even so, she hopes to be able to have her own business space where she can establish a restaurant.

With this $175 loan - which she will repay in four months - she will purchase ingredients for her polladas, plates and disposable forks.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for her buisiness.

loans.name: Lastenia

texts.es:
Lastenia, de 56 años de edad, socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de Cautivo II” de Huaraz, manifiesta tener muchos altibajos en su negocio, pero a pesar de ello sigue adelante ya que L. venta en su bodega le permite colaborar con el sostén del hogar junto a su esposo, que es profesor en una Institución Educativa estatal.

Por 21 años, L. señora Lastenia ha sabido mantener el negocio de venta de abarrotes, ofreciendo a sus clientes todos los productos de primera calidad, mas bien debido al alza actual que han sufrido todos los alimentos, se ha visto en L. necesidad de solicitar un financiamiento.

Con el préstamo de S/ 300, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará un saco de azúcar, un saco de arroz y dos cajas de leche, los cuales le servirán para implementar el negocio.

A pesar que ya ha pasado mucho tiempo desde que perdió a sus padres, elL. aún considera que fue su peor momento y espera que su único hijo de 15 años no sufra ese dolor.
texts.en:
Lastenia is 56 years old and is a member of the communal bank “Señor de Cautivo II” in Huaraz. In spite of the many ups and downs in her business, she has been successful and the sales in her store allow her to contribute to the support of her family. Her husband is a professor in a state educational institution.

Lastenia has had her business selling groceries for 21 years. She offers her clients first rate products. With the increase in the price of food she has been forced to look for a loan. With the loan of $100 - which she will repay in four months - she will buy a sack of sugar, a sack of rice and two boxes of milk.

Even though it has been a long time since she lost her parents, she still considers that to be her worst moment and she hopes that her only son who is 15 years old will not suffer that pain.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Lorenza Maria

texts.es:
Lorenza, de 40 años de edad, socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen De Asunción de Carhuaz”, le gustaría comprar chacras y sembrar maíz en grandes cantidades para poder distribuir a los mayoristas que llevan el choclo a la capital.  

Lorenza es conviviente y tiene seis hijos, de los cuales 3 de ellos depende de ella ya que los otros se han ido de su casa, son independientes y tienen sus propias familias.
 
Lorenza se dedica a la venta de verduras, que con ayuda de sus tres menores hijos, trata de sacar adelante el negocio, el cual se encuentra ubicado en las puertas del mercado modelo de Carhuaz. 

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará choclo de la chacra y lo venderá al por mayor, ya que con 12 años de experiencia ella tiene clientes fijos.
texts.en:
Lorenza is 40 years old, and is a member of the "Virgen De Asunción de Carhuaz" Communal Bank. She would like to buy a farm and plant maize in large quantities to distribute to wholesalers who take the corn to the capital. Lorenza lives with her partner and has six children, 3 of whom depend on her support; the others have left home, are independent and have their own families. Located at the front of the Carhuaz market, Lorenza sells vegetables with the help of her three younger children while trying to advance the business. The loan of S/. 1,000 that she will pay in 6 months, it will buy corn that she will then sell at wholesale; with 12 years of experience she has many regular customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn from farms

loans.name: Fagarou Group

texts.fr: Le Groupement  FAGAROU situé dans l'écovillage(http://www.sem-fund.org/keurgumaggfr.php) est un groupe de petits vendeurs au détail très dynamique qui tournent dans la périphérie des grands marchés hebdomadaires.  Avec le contexte économique très marqué par une année hivernale dont les prévisions sont en baisse en terme production agricole ; un système de vente de proximité dans le milieu rural et péri-urbain peut rapporter beaucoup de bénéfices. Avec ce prêt, ils pourront acheter et  vendre et des produits comme l'arachide, le riz et le mil suivant les opportunités des marchés de la région du centre. Ce qui leur permettra non seulement de satisfaire la demande, mais aussi de renforcer leur stock, diversifier leurs produits, générer des revenus pour les membres en vue d'une garantie d'une activité durable.
texts.en:
The FAGAROU group, located in an ecovillage (http://www.sem-fund.org/keurgumaggfr.php), is a group of very dynamic small-retail salespeople who work on the periphery of large weekly markets. With an economic situation affected by a winter year whose forecasts are poor in terms of agricultural production; a system of sale in proximity to rural and peri-urban environments can bring back many benefits. With this loan, they will be able to buy and sell products such as peanuts, rice and millet and take advantage of the central region's markets. This will not only enable them to satisfy the demand, but also to build their stock, diversify their products, and generate income for the group's members with a goal of securing a long-term business.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of foodstuffs

loans.name: Dialki Djigue Group

texts.fr: Dans le cadre de la lutte contre la pauvreté, les femmes de notre groupement pour améliorer  la qualité de leur vie ont décidé de s'adonner à des activités génératrices de revenus en demandant un prêt à Kiva. Cette activité est la vente de fruits (pastèques, oranges, manques etc.) et légumes (carottes, choux, patates, courges, etc..) que nous récoltons de nos champs et allons vendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires qui regroupent des milliers de personnes mais aussi de transporter notre marchandise vers d'autres horizons d'où venir les vendre en ville particulièrement à Dakar là où le besoin se fait sentir le plus.
texts.en:
In the fight against poverty, the women of our group, in order to improve their quality of life, decided to devote themselves to businesses in applying for a loan at Kiva. This business is in selling fruits (watermelons, oranges, mangoes, etc.) and vegetables (carrots, cabbages, potatoes, squash, etc.) that we harvest from our fields and either go to sell in weekly markets where thousands gather or take it elsewhere to sell in the city, especially in Dakar, where there is great need.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to sell fruits an vegetables

loans.name: Dental Group

texts.fr: Le GIE Dental de Kael est localisé à Mbacké dans la région de Diourbel (http://www.sem-fund.org/keurgumaggfr.php). Il est constitué de cinq membres dont deux femmes. Le GIE a pour but le développement socio-économique de ses membres. Ses principales activités sont le commerce, l’élevage, l’embouche bovine.Le projet d’embauche bovine se situe en ligne droite  des activités du Groupement. Le GIE fait le commerce de bœuf, de mouton, de chèvre dans la zone de Mbacké. Chaque jour de marché hebdomadaire, un membre prospecte les bonnes affaires, achète le bétail et celui-ci est vendu sur d’autres marchés notamment dans les villes comme Mbacké. Cette activité est très lucrative mais le volant d’argent disponible comme fonds de roulement limite les capacités du Groupement dans son commerce de bétail. L’opportunité qu’offre Kiva dans le cadre du micro-crédit devra permettre de renforcer le fonds de roulement et financer l’achat de plus de moutons et de bœufs.
texts.en:
The Economic Interest Group, Dental, of Kael, is located in Mbacké in the Diourbel region (http://www.sem-fund.org/keurgumaggfr.php). It consists of five members of which two are women. The goal of the Economic Interest Group is the socio-economic development of its members. Its principal businesses are in the commerce, raising, and fattening of cattle. This project is line with the association’s businesses. The Economic Interest Group does its business in ox, sheep, and goats in the Mbacké area. Every day at the weekly market, one member prospects good deals, buys the livestock and sells it at other markets, especially in cities like Mbacké. This business is very lucrative but the funds available as working capital limit the capacity of the association in its livestock business. The opportunity that Kiva offers in the realm of microcredit should help reinforce the working capital and finance the purchase of more sheep and ox.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: raising cattle

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, tiene 61 años de edad, socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de Martha II”, que a pesar de su edad desea tener un puesto para poder vender todas las polleras (vestimenta típica de la región), aunque afirma que la salud ya no le permite coser como antes lo hacía. Su esposo la abandonó con sus 4 hijas pequeñas. Vive en el malecón norte del Río Quillcay s/n, distrito de Independencia, provincia de Huaraz. En dicho lugar elabora afanosamente los trajes típicos, elaborando mandiles, fustanes y polleras.

María logró crecer en el negocio. Ha comprado cuatro máquinas de coser y una remalladora que ahora, con tristeza, no sabe quién utilizará sus herramientas ya que ninguna de sus hijas ha deseado practicar su oficio. Los jueves vende en la av. Raymondi, los días de feria vende en la ciudad de Huaraz.

Con el préstamo de S/. 300, el cual pagará en cuatro meses, adquirirá telas, blondas y ovillos para continuar la producción.
texts.en:
Maria, is 61 years old, a member of the "Señor de Martha II" Communal Bank. Despite her age she wants to have a stand to be able to sell all her skirts (traditional regional clothing), although she says her health no longer allows her to sew as she did before. Her husband abandoned her and left her with 4 small daughters. She lives on the jetty north of Río Quillcay, in the Independence District, in the Province of Huaraz. In that place she painstakingly makes traditional attire, aprons, slips and skirts. Maria managed to grow the business. She has purchased four sewing machines and an overlock. Sadly enough, she does not know who will use her tools as none of her daughters wanted to practice her craft. Thursday’s she sells on Raymondi Avenue, on fair days she sells in the city of Huaraz. With a loan of S /. 300, which will be repaid in four months, she will acquire fabrics, lace and yarn to continue production.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric, lace, yarn, etc.

loans.name: Marina Florentina

texts.es:
Marina, de 45 años de edad, socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen de Asunción de Carhuaz”, junto a su esposo, el cual es chofer y radica en la ciudad de Lima por motivos de trabajo, busca hacer crecer a sus dos únicas hijas, que ambas sean profesionales y puedan enfrentar a la vida con éxito. Vive en malecón norte, distrito de Independencia, provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Marina es nombrada en el hospital de Carhuaz en el área de contabilidad. En las tardes se dedica a tejer los pedidos de los clientes desde hace 23 años en su casa donde vive con sus hijas.

Con el préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, implementará su pequeño negocio comprando lanas al por mayor y otra parte será destinada para pagar la academia preuniversitaria de su hija.
texts.en:
Marina, 45 years old, is a member of the Virgen of Asunción de Carhuaz village bank with her husband. He is a taxi driver and lives in Lima for work purposes. She hopes to raise both of her daughters to be professionals who can be successful in life. She lives in the northern district of Independence, in the province of Huaraz, Ancash, Peru. Marina works in the Carhuaz hospital in the accounting department. For the past 23 years, she has spent the afternoons weaving the orders of her customers in the house where she lives with her daughters. With this $350 loan which she will repay in 6 months, she will grow her business by purchasing wholesale wool, while the rest will go towards paying for her daughter’s pre-university tuition.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale wool

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Jose V., mi unico trabajo desde niño es y ha sido la zapateria, tengo 3 años de tener mi propio taller, esto me ayuda a salir adelante con mis hijos, actualmente necesito tener una mayor produccion de zapatos ya que las exigencias de mis clientes son grandes, pero no tengo el capital para poder comprar mas materia prima, por tal razon necesito una ayuda para poder salir adelante con mi negocio y con mis hijos. gracias
texts.en:
Hello, my name is Jose V.; my only job since I was a child has been that of a cobbler. For the past 3 years, I have worked in my own workshop which helps me to move forward with my children. Currently, I need to increase my shoe production since I have many orders from my customers, but I don’t have the necessary capital to purchase more raw materials. This is why I need financial assistance in order to grow my business and take care of my children. Thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for the repair and manufacture of shoes

loans.name: Noa Aalia

texts.es:
Noa, de 28 años de edad, socia del Banco Comunal “Unión Pedregal”, quisiera tener un negocio independiente, talvez una boutique, donde pueda atender a los clientes y así poder tener más ingresos. Tiene una hijita pequeña, junto a su conviviente cubren los gastos de la casa, aunque ella maneja los ingresos que le proporciona el negocio. Vive en Jr. Inés Huaylas, distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Aunque es profesora de profesión, no lo ejerce y es por esta razón que desde hace tres años se dedica a la venta de ropa y también a la venta de abarrotes en la casa de su madre.
