Kokouvi A. is 28 years old and single with no children. He has been running a word-processing office for 2 years in Adeta, a village about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. He would like to use this loan to buy a new copier, since the first one is worn out and requires a lot of money for repairs, as well as office furniture. This chance will allow him to respond to the clientele’s service needs, and the funds will help him repay his loan and to make some profits in order to provide for his needs, as well as the needs of his little brothers.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a copier and office furniture

loans.name: Betty Petrona

texts.en:
Betty and her husband live in the tropical Santa Cruz region of eastern Bolivia. They have one 18-year-old son, whom they support financially, and they are taking out this loan together to pay for repairs on the taxi they own. The couple earns income by renting the taxi to the driver at a fixed daily rate, and Betty's husband also works as a salesman, for which he receives a set monthly wage. They have five years of experience renting the taxi and working for the company. Since they are experienced in both areas, competition does not present a major problem.

Betty and her husband are taking out this loan to repair the taxi's motor, which will cost $400. They are refinancing a previous loan of $3,010 in order to take out their current loan. They have $1,336.86 left to repay on the previous loan, and have always made their payments on time and in full.

loans.use: Taxi repairs

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro lives in the tropical Santa Cruz region of eastern Bolivia. He and his partner have four children, who are 14, 11, 8 and 3 years old. Pedro has been working as a gardener and growing fruit for about 20 years. He works out of his home, and his partner sells his fruit according to the season. He has many clients who know of his work, and he is easy for them to find since he is always working from the same location. He has been able to position himself well in the market thanks to his partner, who has been selling fruit for a long time and is very experienced.

Pedro will use this loan to buy some machinery that he needs for gardening. This is his third loan from AgroCapital, and he has always been very punctual with his repayments. Pedro only has loans out with our institution, according to his credit report.

loans.use: Buy machinery for gardening

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama S. sells soup, rice, sugar and other goods at Abrobiano in Elmina. Mariama has received junior high school education. She is married and has 1 child. Her husband is a driver.

Mariama has been selling soup, rice, sugar, etc. since 2002. She is responsible for paying for school fees and food for the family. Her loan will be used to add to her capital to buy more grocery items for sale. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for re-sale

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Fati S., a 48-year-old woman, is married and has five children. She runs a grocery shop in her neighborhood and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned foods, peanuts, evaporated milk, etc. She needs the loan to enable her to restock her shop with more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil and roasted groundnuts, etc. to scale up sales. 

She is hopeful that she would be able to raise enough income to sponsor her kids' education.  She would be thankful for that support; she is a member of the group called "Hakuri" group Trust, meaning Patience's. Members in this group agree to guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and sugar, boxes of cigarettes, cartons of vegetable oil, evaporated milk etc.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia A. has been doing business in the local market in Obuasi in the Ashanti Region of Ghana, where she lives with her family. She is a 46-year-old woman, a widow and mother of five children who are currently schooling. She is a busy petty trader who sells foodstuffs like beans and yams. She is also a manufacturer of palm oil and she sells these items on top of a table in the market.

Lydia does not have sufficient working capital to run the business, a fact which retards her business progress. With the loan, she wants to inject more working capital into the business to purchase increased stocks of palm kernel to process into palm oil to revive that aspect of her business.

She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality stock to upgrade her inventory. She would be most grateful for your assistance. She is a member of the group called "Nkwaredea" meaning Truthfulness. Members in this group agree to guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase increased stocks of palm oil, yams, and beans, etc.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 39 years old and lives in the tropical Santa Cruz region of eastern Bolivia. She lives in her 34-year-old brother's house along with her family and her three-year-old son. She and her brother are taking out this loan together

Flora sells groceries out of her home with the help of her mother. She also works at the ALG poultry farm giving vaccinations to the animals. Her brother works on the "Inacruz" poultry farm, where he works as a mechanic and welder. He also owns a stand on 25th of May St. (the main street in the area where they live) where he sells drinks. Both Flora and her brother have many years of experience in their respective activities. Though there is some competition both in grocery sales and drink sales, Flora and her brother never lack customers, since they both have experience running high-quality operations. Each has a steady source of income, as well, so their earnings are fairly stable.

Flora plans to use her loan to buy more groceries. This is her third loan with AgroCapital, and she has been an excellent client in the past. She does not have any outstanding debts with any other financial institutions.

loans.use: Buy bulk groceries to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret G. is thirty-nine years old. She is a wife and mother of three children. Margaret is a resourceful mother and a successful businesswoman. She works hard to support her children in school. At the moment, her first-born child is in senior high school.

Margaret sells women's slippers, ladies' shoes, children's shoes and ladies' bags in Obuasi town. Margaret does personal selling, that is she moves from house to house to sell her goods to her loyal customers. She has inadequate working capital to support business growth. She believes that with the loan, she will be more able to supply her customers with quality shoes and slippers. She hopes to raise good income to support her family.

Margaret wants to use the loan to buy more women's slippers, ladies' shoes, children's shoes and ladies' bags. She belongs to the community group called 'Judah Abusua Kuo' (meaning, Judah's Family) Trust Group. In this group, members agree to guarantee for one another as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her business

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael A. is 31 years old. He is married and expecting his first-born child any moment. He has been sewing for seven years. He is a specialist in women's and men's wear. His skills and designs are in a class by themselves. He sews various kinds of styles that give his customers new look, like kaba and slit, wedding dresses, funeral clothes, men's short sleeved shirts, kids' wear, etc. He also sews children's school uniforms for most of the schools in Obuasi as subsidiary to give him extra income to support his family.

Michael wants to use the loan to buy sewing materials like linen, thread, thimbles, etc. to increase his output and efficiency. He hopes to increase his savings to provide for his family, including his unborn child. He is a member of the community group called 'Judah Abusua Kuo' Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access and repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials such as linen, thread, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: James B.

texts.en:
James B. M. is married and has five children. He has received schooling through senior high school. 
James sells groceries such as biscuits, oats, milk and other canned products at Abrobeano in Elmina, which he has done since 1988. His wife is a trader. 
James uses his income to pay for his children's school fees and house-keeping expenses. James will use the loan to purchase bags of sugar, boxes of milk and other items for resale. 
With the new profits from his expanded business, James plans to reinvest.

loans.use: James will use the loan to purchase bags of sugar, boxes of milk and other items for resale.

loans.name: Rabi

texts.en:
Rabi S. is 37 years old. She is divorced and the mother of three kids. Rabi S. is very resourceful in provision of food and payment of bills for her family. She is a food vendor and sells kenkey and fish with pepper. She sells kenkey in the mornings and in the afternoon and evening. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaian enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper.

Rabi S. wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to pay for her children's education. She belongs to the community group called "Yedada Allah" Trust Group meaning 'believe in God'. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood etc.

loans.name: Wass Na God Dae Sabe Group

texts.en:
Kadiatu C. is the leader of the Wass Na God Dae Sabe group. She was born in Magburaka and is 37 years old. She is married to a business man and they have 4 children. Two of her children are already in school, and two are still too young to go to school. For 3 years, Kadiatu has been selling cooked rice, cold water, and soft drinks. She added some money to her previous loan to buy the freezer that she is using to sell the drinks. With this new loan, she plans to buy bags of rice and the condiments that she uses for cooking.

The other members of the group are Kadiatu C., Nenneh C., and Adama B.. They are all local entrepreneurs in Magburaka town, the headquarters of the Tonkolili District. They are requesting their third loan from Kiva through SMT. They have repaid their previous loans successfully. However, they are requesting a new loan to add to their current principle. Their previous loans allowed them to make a lot of improvements in their lives, so they are requesting a new loan.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for restaurant

loans.name: Mame Bousso

texts.fr: Mame Bousso est née le 17 juillet 1971 à Kaolack.elle est mariée et s'active dans le commerce de crintin (cloture) et des denrées alimentaires depuis quatre ans.
texts.en:
Mame Bousso was born on July 17, 1971 in Kaolack. She is married and has been in the business of bamboo fences and general food items for four years.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of general food items and fences

loans.name: Cholitas Marinas Group

texts.en:
The Cholitas Marinas Group is maD. up of eleven women and one man who live in the central Cochabamba region of Bolivia. "Cholita" is a term commonly used to refer to indigenous Andean women who usually dress in skirts with long braids and sometimes wear bowler hats; the group's name, roughly translated, means "Cholitas of the Sea."

The group members have a variety of businesses, mostly food sales: Rosemary has a beauty salon, Maria Macedonia and Giovanna sell groceries, Alejandrina sells bread, Aparicia and Victoria sell prepared meals, Eugenia sells vegetables, Maria Antonieta drives a taxi, Meliza sells comforters, Mercedes sells clothing, and Fredy has a kiosk. Most of the group members have significant experience in their various lines of work, giving them an edge over the competition.

Most of the group plans to use their loans to buy more merchandise, or to offer a wider variety of products and services. Most of the group members have had previous experience with group loans at Pro Mujer and Crecer, other Bolivian microfinance institutions.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Wague Bakh Group

texts.fr: Nous souhaitons avoir un financement auprès de Kiva pour créer des activités génératrices de revenu afin de pouvoir avoir des emplois stables et durables. Le projet consiste à la création d'un poulailler dans l'écovillage de Louly, qui bien que des initiatives ont été prises par des habitants du village, les besoins en ravitaillement de poulets de chair font toujours défaut. Ce qui fait que pour combler ce manque, nous avons décidé de mettre sur pied un projet d'élevage de poulets. Cela nous permettra de fournir les populations et les différents restaurants de la zone touristique côtière située à Mbour. Avec le prêt, nous allons construire une poussinière et acheter du matériel d’élevage (abreuvoir, mangeoire, pondoir, nichoir)
texts.en:
We would like to have a loan from Kiva to start businesses in order to be able to have stable and lasting jobs. The plan consists of creating a henhouse in the ecovillage of Louly, where although the villagers took initiative, the supply needs of the chicken are lacking. To make up for this shortage, we have decided to set up a plan to raise chickens. This will allow us to provide for the population and the different restaurants in the touristic area located in Mbour. With the loan, we are going to construct a henhouse and buy poultry-farming supplies (drinking trough, feeding tray, laying place, nest box).

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to raise and sell hens

loans.name: Rokel Group Ii

texts.en:
Yeabu S., who is the leader of the Rokel Group II group, was born in Magburaka. She is 50 years of age, a widow with 5 children; 4 of whom are already grown ups. Yeabu is a farmer and also sells dishes. She has been doing this for over 20 years. With her previous loans, Yeabu was able to pay for one of her sons, who wanted to learn welding as a trade, and also paid school fees for her youngest son. She plans to use this loan to buy more dishes to sell and invest in her farm.

The Rokel Group II includes Yeabu S. and Beintu S.. They are small-scale business women in Magburaka, the headquarters in Tonkolili District. This is their third loan from Kiva through SMT. Previous loans meant a lot in the lives and businesses of these people. They were able to expand their businesses, and consequently, their profits also increased. Today, these people are thankful for those loans because their livelihoods have improved over the days before the loans.

loans.use: Invest in farm and purchase more dishes to sell

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte O. is 38 years old. She is a wife and the mother of three kids. Charlotte O. is very resourceful in providing food and paying bills for her family. She is a food vendor and sells kenkey and fish with pepper. She sells kenkey in the mornings and in the afternoon and evening. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has a very strong customer base since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper.

She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children's education. She belongs to the community group called St. Paul's Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama M. is a single parent and has 2 children. She has never received schooling. Ama sells a variety of local dish like Banku (a product of maize and cassava dough), Wakye (acombination of rice and beans) and Fufu (a combination of cassava and plantain pounded together). These are the most popular meals in the country.

Her chop bar is located in Abrobiano in Elmina, where she has worked since 2007. Ama uses her income to pay utility bills. Ama will use the loan to purchase food stuffs and ingredients such as rice, beans, oil, cassava, fish, meat, maize and others. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to reinvest.

loans.use: Ama will use the loan to purchase food stuffs and ingredients such as rice, beans, oil, cassava, fish, meat, maize and others.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.en:
The Maria Auxiliadora group is maD. up of eleven women and two men who live in the Villa Mexico neighborhood of Cochabamba. The group members have limited resources and work hard to repay their loans.

The group members are mostly ambulatory vendors, with the exception of RuD. and Ines, who sell clothing and underwear, Maria Elena, who is a seamstress, Amalia, who sells crystal dishes, and Omar, who drives a bus. About half of the group has around five years of experience, and the other half has more than 10 years of experience. Clara Julia has been working as a vendor for 35 years!

Most of the group plans to spend their loan to buy more wares to sell. This is the group's fourth loan cycle. Their previous three loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: Buy more bulk merchandise to retail

loans.name: Jesús Alberto

texts.es:
El Sr. Jesús Alberto y su esposa la Sra. Alicia tiene dos hijos que están en la edad escolar pero tiene un problema en esté momento no cuentan con el dinero necesario para la comprar de útiles escolares y los uniformes de la escuela.

El Sr. Jesús trabaja en una compañía de agua el está en el puesto de repartidor de agua por varias colonias de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo y su esposa la Sra. Alicia se dedica a la venta de ropa usada afuera de su casa los fines de semana estos son sus ingresos familiares.

Cuando fuimos ha ser la visita a la casa de la familia M. el Sr. Jesús no se encontraba en su casa el estaba trabajando solo estaba su esposa la Sra. Alicia y sus dos hijos.

El sr. Jesús nos está solicitando un préstamo de $475.00 dlls para la compra de los útiles escolares y los uniformes ya que en la escuela se los están exigiendo a los niños por seguridad de ellos mismos
texts.en:
Mr. Jesús Alberto and his wife Mrs. Alicia have two school-aged children but, at this moment, they have a problem in that they don’t have the money that is necessary to buy supplies and uniforms for school. Mr. Jesús works in a water company. He is a water distributor for various neighborhoods in the city of Nuevo Laredo. His wife Mrs. Alicia sells used clothes outside her house during the weekends. These activities contribute to their household income. When we went to visit their home, only Mrs. Alicia and her two children were home, as Mr. Jesús was working. Mr. Jesús is requesting a loan for $475.00 to buy school supplies and uniforms since the children are required to go to school for their own security.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies and uniforms for his children

loans.name: Tamaraneh Iii Group

texts.en:
Musa (pictured on the right) is the leader of this group, called Tamaraneh III. This is a Temne word meaning: "Let's help one another." He was born in Magburaka, and he is 30 years of age. Musa is married to a business woman who sells pastes, toothbrushes, creams, and so on. Musa sells cigarettes. They have two children; one is in primary school and the other is still a baby. Musa was able to feed his children and mum, and pay school fees for his child out of the proceeds from his business. With this new loan, Musa is expecting a boom in his business because of the increase in capital the loan will provide.

The members of this group are all business people in Magburaka town, the main town in the Tonkolili District. They now request a new loan to further strengthen their businesses. This is their third loan from Kiva through SMT. They have completely and successfully repaid their previous loans.

loans.use: Purchase more goods to sell to expand their businesses

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia O., a 34-year-old trader, is married with two children. Among these children, one has high school completed and the other one is still in school. 
Emelia supports her husband in providing for the household through the sale of used clothing and lace materials. Selling used clothing is lucrative in Ghana, because many people purchase it, especially the economically active poor.  
She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing and lace materials to increase her inventory. She believes this loan would help her save for her children's education. She would be grateful for that assistance. 
She belongs to the group called St. Paul's Trust Group. In this group, members also guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy increased bales of used clothing and clothing materials.

loans.name: Petty-Traders Group

texts.en:
These are Jariatu K., Aiafu K. and Isatu S.. They named their group Petty Traders. They want a loan of Le 1,500,000.00.

Jariatu, who is the leader of this group, was born in Sanda about 30 miles from Makeni. But she now lives with her husband here in Makeni where she also does her business. She is 32 and has 4 children. She sells slippers and has been in this business for the past 10 years now. Previous loans have helped Jariatu a lot. They have helped her business grow. She was able to pay her children's school fees and also handles most of her numerous problems. With a new loan, Jariatu's stock of slippers will increase from 6 cartons to 12 cartons.

Aiafu also sells slippers. Previous loans have now helped him get a total of 4 cartons of slippers. He used to have only 2 cartons. With a new loan, he is expecting to get 6 cartons.

Isatu sells items like gum, biscuits, batteries, mints, lollipops etc. She thanks God for the previous loans she got with SMT. Such loans have helped her business grow and out of the proceeds, she is able to make a livelihood.

loans.use: Buy more cartons of slippers for re-sale

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali Y. sells cell phone credit cards and phone accessories at Elmina market. Ali has received no formal education. He is single and has no children.

Ali has been selling cell phone credit cards and phone accessories since 2007. He is responsible for paying utility bills. His loan will be used to buy more phone credit cards and phone accessories for re-sale. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to increase his capital base for the expansion of his business.

loans.use: to buy more phone credit cards and phone accessories for sale.

loans.name: Hilda Milda

texts.es:
La señora Hilda Milda, tiene 54 años, está casada, estudió la carrera de auxiliar de Enfermería en el Instituto San Hilario en la ciudad de Trujillo, no ejerce su profesión porque se casó y después se dedicó a cuidar a sus hijos, tiene 03 hijos, son estudiantes, vive en  el Distrito de Trujillo en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad.
La empresaria trabajaba en el centro de salud en la Provincia de Julcan, pero después decidió venir a la ciudad de Trujillo para que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales. Después tuvo la iniciativa de empezar a trabajar, y por este motivo viajaba a la Provincia de Julcan los días domingos para comprar verduras. Tiene 02 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos, por una amiga decidió participar en el Banco Comunal “MUJERES AL ÉXITO II” además   la socia  tenía poco capital y a veces no le alcanzaba para seguir invirtiendo en el negocio y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibió compró harina, trigo, haba, papa.
Con este préstamo de S/. 600.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 04 meses, tiene pensado invertir en la compra de papa, porque es lo que se vende más rápido.
La socia sueña con tener una tienda de abarrotes en la ciudad de Trujillo, para no viajar a la Provincia de Julcan.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hilda MIlda is 54 years old and married. She studied nursing at the Institute San HIlario in the city of Trujillo, but does not currently work in nursing because she decided to get married and dedicated herself to raising her children. She has three children, all of whom are in school. Hilda lives in the Trujillo District in the province of the same name in the department of La Libertad. She used to work in the health center in the Julcan Province, but decided to move to the city of Trujillo so that her children could study and become professionals. She later decided to start to work, and began traveling to Julcan Province each Sunday to buy vegetables (which she then resells in Trujillo). She has been working with Manuela Ramos for two years; she first started by participating in the "Women Towards Success II" Communal Bank (a group loan), thanks to a friend. She had little money at the time, and sometimes did not have enough to keep investing in her business. With her first loan of 300 soles (a little more than US $100), HIlda bought flour, wheat, broad beans and potatoes. With this loan of 600 soles (slightly more than US $200), which she will repay in four months, she is considering buying potatoes, because that is what sells the fastest. Hilda dreams of having a store in Trujillo to buy vegetables from so that she does not have to travel to Julcan Province any more.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy potatoes in bulk

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
El Sr. Orlando es padres de familia tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad el y su esposa están preocupados ya que el casa no esta nada protegida para seguridad de su hijo.

El Sr. orlando está preocupado por su familia ya que por su trabajo casi no está en su casa y teme que les pueda pasar algo a ellos cuando el no esté en casa con las bardas y protecciones a su casa la familia estará más segura cundo el no esté en su casa.

El trabaja en una compañía de paquetería en el aria de entregar paquetería (papeles o documentación) y mercancía a diferentas partes de la republica Mexicana (Por ejemplo a Monterrey, Veracruz, Guadalajara, México.) este es su ingreso familiar.

Ellos están solicitando un préstamo de $750.00 dlls a Kiva para la comprar de material ya que a su casa le está haciendo falta las bardas y protecciones ya que por el momento no cuenta con el capital que necesitan.
texts.en:
Mr. Orlando and his wife, who have a five-year-old son, are worried because their house isn’t protected for the security of their son. Mr. Orlando is worried for his family since he is rarely at home because of his job. He fears that something will happen to his family when he isn’t there. With walls and protections for the house, the family will be safer when Orlando isn’t home. Orlando works in a packaging company where he delivers packages (papers or documents) and merchandise to different parts of Mexico (for example to Monterrey, Veracruz, and Guadalajara). This makes up his family’s income. They are requesting a loan for $750.00 from Kiva so that they can buy materials for walls and protections that they lack outside their house because they don’t have the capital at the moment.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The construction of walls and protections

loans.name: Felicity

texts.en:
Felicity A. started her local restaurant 17 years ago in Tutuka, a suburb of Obuasi where she lives. Since then, she has become one of the most popular food vendors in her neighborhood. She is now 41 years old and married with six children, who are all currently in school. 

She serves many kinds of local dishes, like fufu, rice and stew, rice balls, and banku with okra stew, among others. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantains and taken with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and taken with hot peppers or soup.

Felicity wants to use this loan to buy more raw materials, like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantains, meat, fish, and firewood. She also hopes to use part of the proceeds to finance her children's educations. She is a member of the group called "yehowa nemewhefo" Trust Group meaning "God is my Shepherd." In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials, like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, and firewood.

loans.name: Irma Marleni

texts.es:
La señora Irma Marleny, tiene 43 años, está casada, estudió la carrera de Contabilidad	en el Instituto Trujillo, nunca lo ejerció porque se dedicó al negocio y cuidar a sus hijos, tiene 04 hijos, son estudiantes, vive en el Distrito de El Porvenir en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad. Para ayudarse económicamente, optó por poner negocio estable de suelas, plantas de PVC cuando sus hijos crecieron, tiene 03 años en este negocio, anteriormente viajaba a Lima para comprar ropa, después dejó ese negocio. Tiene 02 años en el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, una amiga la recomendó en el Banco Comunal “ESPERANZA DEL MAÑANA” ella decidió pertenecer a este Banco porque necesitaba capital para tener un negocio sólido y con el primer préstamo de S/. 500.00 que recibió compró plantas de PVC a sus  proveedores.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,100.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 04 meses, tiene pensado invertir en la compra de plantas, suelas de PVC.

La empresaria sueña con seguir creciendo dentro de sus posibilidades.
En el Banco Comunal al que pertenece tiene el cargo de presidenta, cuya función es dar bienvenida, animar a las nuevas socias para que paguen puntualmente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Irma Marleny is 43 years old, married, and she studied Accounting in the Trujillo Institute. She has 4 children who are students, and she lives in the El Porvenir district, Trujillo province in La Libertad state. To help herself economically she opted to open a stable business of insoles and soles of PVC while her children were growing up. She has had this business for 3 years, previously she would travel to Lima to buy clothing but she left this business. She has been involved with Manuela Ramos for 2 years as a friend recommended the Communal Bank “Esperanza del Mañana” and she decided to join this Bank because she needed the capital to have her business be solid. With the first loan for S/. 500.00 that she received she bought PVC insoles from her suppliers. With the loan for S/. 1,100.00 which will be repaid in 4 months, she is thinking of investing in the purchase of insoles and soles of PVC. This businesswoman dreams of continuing to grow the possibilities of business. She is the president of the Communal Bank to which she belongs, her function is to welcome and inspire new members to pay punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soles and insoles for shoes

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha Q. vive en casa de sus padres (calle 23 de marzo, zona de Obispo Bosque, ciudad de La Paz), junto a su hija y el abuelo (el esposo que es policía esta trabajando en el Chapare, una zona tropical del departamento de Cochabamba, pero su salario es mínimo). Martha solicita crédito para cubrir los gastos médicos de su padre quien no puede caminar debido a un doloroso accidente. 

Es cliente antigua de Impro, tiene un buen historial y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Martha Q. lives in her parents’ house (23 de marzo Street, Obispo Bosque zone, La Paz) with her daughter and grandfather. Her husband, who is a police officer, is working in the Chapare, a tropical zone in Cochabamba, but his salary is minimal. Martha is requesting this loan to cover her father’s medical costs. Martha’s father cannot walk because of a painful accident. Martha is an old client of Impro. She has a good record and can manage a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To cover medical expenses

loans.name: Herlin

texts.es: El Sr. Herling tiene 31 años de edad,  y habita en el Barrio Waspan Norte de Managua, es casado, tiene dos hijos de 7 y 9 años de edad que están cursando la primaria, su esposa es comerciante, vende productos varios los cuales oferta de manera ambulante y también los clientes llegan a su casa de habitación. Don Harling trabaja en topógrafo y tiene un año de estar laborando en esta área. La solicitud que está haciendo es para hacer mejoras en su vivienda en la instalación de  un servicio higiénico y tuberías de  aguas negras, esto es debido que en la parte donde vive ya están instalándose los tubos de aguas negras para el barrio, él piensa que es un gran avance para el barrio donde habita ya que ahora podrán tener más higiene en sus viviendas, sobre todo porque ya no será necesario el uso de letrinas.
texts.en:
Herling, 31, lives in the Waspan Norte barrio in Managua. He is married and has two children, 7 and 9, who attend elementary school. His wife sells various products on the street and out of their home. Herling has been working as a topographer for a year. The loan he is requesting will be used to improve his home by installing a toilet and sewage, since a sewage system is being installed in his barrio Herling believes this new sewage system will be a great improvement to the hygiene in his neighborhood, because latrines will no longer be needed

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installing toilet and sewage

loans.name: Dolores Aleyda

texts.es: Dolores es una joven de 24 años de edad, labora en un instituto de educación, desempeñándose como docente de ecuación primaria, es madre soltera de una niña de 6 meses, por la que debe luchar muy duro ya que todos los gastos familiares recaen sobre ella. Vive la casa de su familia y son ellos quienes le apoyan con el cuido de la menor, desde muy joven le ha tocado trabajar ya que apoya a su familia, y ahora tiene que mantener a su pequeña hija. Mientras está trabajando su madre cuida del bebé. Actualmente el techo de su casa de habitación está en muy malas condiciones, y las lluvias les están afectando mucho, es por eso que solicita el crédito para cambiar el techo de su vivienda, y así asegurar la salud de su familia sobre todo la de su bebé, ya que la casa está húmeda y cuando llueve tienen que estar pendientes de que no se mojen los bienes de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Dolores is a 24 year old young woman, she works in school as an elementary teacher. She is a single mother and has a 6 month old daughter, for whom she works very hard as meeting all the household expenses fall to Dolores. She lives in her family's home and they support her by taking care of her daughter. She has worked ever since she was young to support her family, and now she has to support her small daughter also. While she works her mother watches the baby. Today the roof of their home is in poor condition. Rain is affecting them a lot, and therefore she is seeking a loan to change their home's roof and thereby ensure her family's, and above all her daughter's, health. Their home is very humid an dwhen it rains they have to be careful that their belongings do not get wet.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the roof on her home.

loans.name: Fary

texts.fr: Fary B. est née le 01 janvier 1959 à Bambey. Ellee vit au quartier léona avec son mari.Elle vend du petit déjeuner depuis cinq ans.
texts.en:
Fary B. was born on January 1, 1959 in Bambey. She lives in the neighborhood of ------- with her husband. She has been selling breakfast for the last five years.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Breakfast sale

loans.name: Victoria Gladis

texts.es:
La señora Victoria Gladis, tiene 34 años, actualmente es conviviente, estudió la carrera de obstetricia, no la culminó porque salió embarazada, después tuvo una amenaza de aborto y como no podía subir las gradas del instituto Alexander Fleming  porque  estudiaba en el 3er piso, es por este motivo  que decidió retirarse, tiene 03 hijos, son estudiantes, vive en el Distrito de Trujillo en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad.
Para ayudarse económicamente empezó vendiendo productos cosméticos de belleza, una amiga le hizo la propuesta para que ofrezca  estos productos, ella aceptó porque quería trabajar,  además en tiempo de verano vende cremoladas, arroz con leche, mazamorra. Tiene 02 años en el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su amiga la recomendó en el Banco Comunal “MUJERES AL ÉXITO II” ella decidió pertenecer en este Banco porque quería incrementar el capital  y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibió compró hielos, vasos, cucharas, maíz, chuño, azúcar, arroz, leche.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00  que cancelará en un plazo de 04 meses, tiene pensado invertir este dinero en la compra de productos cosméticos más cómodos tales como: perfumes, labiales, aretes, relojes, cremas, para después venderlos  a otro precio.

En el Banco Comunal al que pertenece tiene el cargo de fiscal, cuya función es informar a las nuevas socias, explicarles  en que consiste la ONG Manuela Ramos.
La socia sueña con comprar un local para vender ropa, calzado o tener una pequeña juguería y a parte seguir vendiendo productos cosméticos.
texts.en:
Miss Victoria Gladis is 34 years old, at present she is a domestic partner. She studied the career of midwifery, but she didn't finish because she became pregnant, and later she had an abortion threat and since she couldn't go up the stairs to the third floor of Alexander Fleming Institute, she had to stop. She has 3 children who are all in school. They live in the District of Trujillo in the Department of La Libertad.

In order to help herself economically, she started selling beauty cosmetic products. A friend suggested her to sell these products, she accepted because she wanted to work. Also during the summer she sells smoothies, rice with milk, and maize with honey.

She has been with the Manuela Ramos for two years, a friend recommended her to the MUJERES AL ÉXITO Communal Bank. She decided to belong to this Bank because she wanted to increase her working capital and with the first loan of $115 she bought ice, glasses, spoons, corn, potato flour, sugar, rice, and milk. With this loan of $350 that she will repay over a period of 4 months, she plans to buy cosmetic products that are easier to sell such as: perfumes, labials, earrings, clocks, creams. In the Communal Bank where she belongs she has a legal role where she informs to the new partners what Manuela Ramos is about. The partner dreams of buying a retail space to sell clothes, footwear or to have a small toy store and still be able to sell cosmetic products.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wholesale cosmectic products.Compra de productos cosméticos al por mayor.

loans.name: Martina Sabina

texts.es: Doña Martina a sus 48 años de edad, ha podido sobresalir de tantas dificultades pues es madre soltera de su hija de 15 años de edad, está separada, pero el padre de su hija la apoya económicamente, habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, tiene que velar por su hija para que pueda salir adelante en sus estudios, actualmente está en secundaria y se requiere de muchos gastos y atención personal. Doña Martina trabaja en un comedor y es la que prepara los alimentos que ahí se ofrecen, tiene cinco años de estar laborando en el comedor, aunque no es fácil por que desde muy temprano llega a su trabajo y sale tarde, y tiene que estar pendiente de su hija, su abuelita cuida de la adolescente para que ella no esté sola en la casa. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para poder hacer reparación en el techo que está en mal estado para eso necesita comprar perlines y zinc. A largo plazo es poder cambiar de trabajo para tener más tiempo para su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Martina at 48 years of age has been able to overcome many difficulties. She is the single mother of her 15 year old daughter, and is divorced, but the father supports his daughter financially. Martina lives in the North Laureles neighborhood. She has to monitor her daughter so that she comes out ahead academically, as she is currently in high school and requires many things and personal attention. Ms. Martina works in a cafeteria, and is the one who cooks the food that is offered there. She has been working there for 5 years, although it is not easy because she arrives early and leaves late, and has to be available to her daughter. Martina's mother looks after her daughter so that she doesn't have to be home alone. The loan is to repair the roof of the house, as it is in bad shape. To do this, Martina needs purlins and zinc. In the long run, Martina would like to change jobs to have more time to spend with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase zinc sheets to roof her house.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria habita en un barrio de Laureles Norte, tiene 42 años de edad, su esposo trabaja de cadete de taxi. Tiene 2 hijas de 13 y 16 años de edad quienes estudian la educación secundaria. Doña Maria trabaja todos los días lavando y planchando ajeno y  tiene dos años de estar lavando y planchando y no le ha ido tan mal cada día que pasa tiene mas clientes que requieren de su servicio, ya que admiran su labor y cuido de la ropa. Algunas veces para ella es muy cansado pero tiene que apoyar a su esposo en la manutención de su familia. La solicitud del préstamo es para hacer mejoras en su vivienda en la construcción de un porche para poder disfrutar las tardes más cómoda con su familia. A largo plazo es poder estar mejor económicamente, poder tener las fuerzas y salud para apoyar a sus hijas en los estudios.
texts.en:
Maria lives in a neighborhood of North Laureles. She is 42 years old. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Maria has two daughters, ages 13 and 16, who are currently in high school. Maria works every day cleaning and ironing for others. She has worked in the cleaning business for two years, and things have gone fairly well for her, as she has more clients every day. Her clients admire her hard work and how careful she is with their clothes. Sometimes Maria is tired, but she has to support her husband in maintaining the family. She is seeking the loan to make improvements in her house, such as a porch so that the family can enjoy the afternoons together. In the long term, Maria hopes to be in a better financial situation and have the strength and health to support her little girls in their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a porch in her house.

loans.name: Khady Sy

texts.fr: Khady Sy Sall est née le 14 mars 1964 à Bargny. Elle habite au quartier de léona dans la commune de Bambey.Elle s'active dans le commerce de produit d'entretien depuis cinq ans.
texts.en:
Khady Sy Sall was born on March 14, 1964 in Bargny. She lives in the city of Bambey. She's been selling cleaning products for five years.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell cleaning products

loans.name: Lizbeth Aimet

texts.es:
La señora Lizbeth Aimet, tiene 29 años, está casada, estudió Dental Técnico y corte y confección, tiene 03 hijos, se encuentran estudiando, vive en el Distrito de Trujillo en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad.
Para ayudarse económicamente, empezó trabajando en un taller de costura, como no le daba el tiempo para cuidar a sus hijos, decidió trabajar en su casa porque tiene libertad de escoger horario de trabajo además tiene 01 máquina de coser y 01 remalladora, la socia tiene 05 años en este negocio, elabora buzos deportivos, ropa sobre medida, arreglos de basta, cierres.
Tiene 01 año trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su sobrina la recomendó en el Banco Comunal “MUJERES AL ÉXITO” ella decidió pertenecer a este Banco porque necesitaba un préstamo para ampliar el pequeño taller y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibió compró tela polar para hacer buzos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 200.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 04 meses, tiene pensado invertir en la compra de cintas para buzos, cierres, hilos de colores. 
En el Banco Comunal al que pertenece tiene el cargo de secretaria, cuya función es llenar el libro de actas, pasar lista a las socias.
La empresaria sueña con ampliar el taller para tener mercería y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Miss Lizbeth Aimet is 29 years old, she is married, she studied Dental Technician and dressmaking. She has 3 children who are in school. She lives in the District of Trujillo, Province of Trujillo in the Department La Libertad.

In order to help herself economically, she started working at seamstress workshop, since she didn't have time to look after her children, she decided to work from home because she would have the freedom of choosing her own work schedule. She has a sewing machine and a overlook machine. She makes track suits, made to measure clothes, hems and zippers. The partner has had this business for 5 years.

She has been working with the Movement Manuela Ramos for one year. Her niece recommended her to the MUJERES AL EXITO Communal Bank. She decided to belong to this Bank because she needed a loan to expand the small workshop. With the first loan of $115 she bought polar cloth to make the track suits.

With this loan of $ 675 that she will repay over a period of 4 months, she plans to buy ribbons for the track suits, zippers and threads of different colors. She is the secretary at the Communal Bank. Her role is to do the minutes book, and take roll call of the partners. The businesswoman dreams are extending the workshop to have a notions store and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy zippers, threads, ribbons, and other materials.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
El Sr. Domingo solicita un préstamo para cambiar el techo de su casa ya que el que tiene actualmente es de madera y con las lluvias y el sol se a maltratado mucho el quiere poner le un techo de concreto (Losa) ya que cuando llueve le entra agua a su casa y los muebles también se están maltratando. Por su trabajo el casi no se encuentra en su casa y le preocupa que les pueda pasar algo a su familia por lo maltratado que esta el techo.

El Sr. Domingo trabaja en una compañía de trasportes en el aria de chofer este es su ingreso familia.

Cuando se realizamos la visita a la casa del Sr. Domingo no se encontraba en su casa andaba trabajando y solo se encontraba su esposa la Sra. María Victoria y sus hijos.

El Sr. Domingo no cuenta por el momento con el dinero para ser el cambiar el techo de su casa es por eso que se acerca a nosotros a solicitar un préstamo de $ 800.00 dlls para poner el techo de concreto (losa) en su casa y su familia estará mas protegida del clima.
texts.en:
Domingo is seeking a loan to change the roof of his home as the one he has is made of wood and the rain and sun have taken their toll and he wants to put on a concrete roof. When it rains the water enters his home and the furniture is also damaged. Because of work he is almost never home and he worries that something could happen to his family because of the roof’s poor condition. Domingo works for a transportation company as a driver, and this is his family’s income. When we visited Domingo’s house he wasn’t at home as he was working and we met his wife María Victoria y sus hijos. Domingo doesn’t have the money at the moment to replace his roof so therefore he approached us for a loan of $800 to put a concrete room on his home so his family will be better protected from the weather.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replace the home's wood roof with a concrete roof

loans.name: Ndella

texts.fr: Ndella S. est née le 26 janvier 1978 à Rufisque.Elle habite au quartier DVF dans la commune de Bambey avec son mari. Elle fait de la couture depuis trois ans.
texts.en:
Ndella S. was born on January 26, 1978 in Rufisque. She lives with her husband in the DVF quarter in the city of Bambey. She's been a seamstress for three years.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sewing

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La señora María Elena, tiene 46 años, está casada, estudió secundaria completa, no continúo estudiando porque tuvo su compromiso, tiene 04 hijos, se encuentran trabajando, vive en el Distrito de El Porvenir en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad.
Para ayudarse económicamente, empezó hace 23 años a vender cebiche, papa rellena, cachanga, en el verano vende raspadillas, como la socia tenía un restaurante donde su esposo se encargaba de vender cerveza, pero como el señor  se tomaba la cerveza,  trajo como consecuencia que el negocio cierre.
Tiene 03 años trabajando en el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, una amiga la recomendó en el Banco Comunal “ESPERANZA DEL MAÑANA” ella decidió pertenecer a este Banco porque quería incrementar el capital y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibió compró aceite, fideo, arroz, etc.

Con el préstamo de S/. 600.00 que cancelará en 04 meses, tiene pensado invertir en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc.

La empresaria sueña con seguir adelante en su trabajo, como su esposo es alcohólico, ella es padre y madre para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Elena, is 46 and married. She completed her secondary education, but did not continue studying because she was engaged. She has 4 children who are working. She lives in the El Porvenir district, Trujillo Province, La Libertad department. In order to help herself economically, she began 23 years ago selling cebiche (a popular shrimp dish), stuffed potatoes, and cachanga (a type of bread), and in the summer she sells shaved ice. She had a restaurant where her husband took care of selling beer, but as he also drank the beer, consequently the business failed. She has been working for 3 years with the Manuela Ramos Movement. A friend recommended the communal bank ESPERANZA DEL MAÑANA (Hope for Tomorrow) to her and she decided to join this bank because she wanted to increase her capital. With the first loan of $110, she bought oil, noodles, rice, etc. With this loan of $225, which she will repay in 4 months, she intends to invest in rice, sugar, noodles, etc. This businesswoman dreams of getting ahead through her work--since her husband is an alcoholic, she is father and mother to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food supplies

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.en:
The San Cayetano group is made up of twelve women and two men who live in Oruro, a small mining city in southwestern Bolivia. The group members are involved in different businesses: Marcela and Elizabeth sell baked goods, Norka Jasmine has a hair salon, Neidy, Tania, and Nery sell clothing (both used clothing and new, trendy clothing). Primitiva sells prepared meals, Virginia sells groceries, Ingrid sells cosmetics, Norka sells meats, and Walter has a hardware store. The group members have a range of experience levels with their respective businesses, anywhere from three to eighteen years. The group meets every other Friday at the group president's house in the Pedro Ferrari neighborhood at 2:30 in the afternoon.

Most of the group members plan to use their loan to purchase more goods or merchandise to sell. In the photo, each group member is holding their check.

Translated and elaborated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

El grupo San Cayetano esta compuesto de 14 personas dentro las cuales existen dos varones y 12 mujeres de las cuales en su mayoría las señoras se dedican a la repostería y en otros casos a la venta de diferentes artículos y las reuniones de recuperación se realizan en casa de la presidenta ubicada en la urbanización pedro Ferrari los días viernes a las 14:30 Hrs.

loans.use: Purchase bulk merchandise to sell

loans.name: Sokhna

texts.fr: Sokhna T. est née le 11 juin 1949 à Dakar.Elle habite au quartier DVF de Bambey avec son mari et ses enfants.Elle s'active dans vla vente de bijoux depuis six ans.
texts.en:
Sokhna T. was born on June 11, 1949, in Dakar. She lives with her husband and her children in the DVF quarter in Bambey. She's been selling jewelry for six years.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Jewlery sale

loans.name: Sucrenses Group

texts.en:
The Sucrenses group is made up of ten women and two men who live in Sucre, Bolivia. Most of the group members are mothers. The group is involved with various businesses and is very entrepreneurial. On average, the members have five years of experience in their respective businesses: Magali, Shirley, and Mariela sell cosmetics, Maria Luisa and Jhonny work in transportation, Johnny repairs cell phones, Jhonatan has a neighborhood store, Jovana sells prepared meals, Virginia sells vegetables, and Mirna and Angelica sell party favors.

Most of the group members will use their loans to buy more merchandise to sell, and thus increase their income. Most of them did not have access to credit before they joined this group.

loans.use: Buy bulk merchandise to re-sell

loans.name: Clavelitos Group

texts.en:
The Clavelitos ("Little Carnations") group is made up of six men and eight women from Oruro, a small mining city in southwestern Bolivia. Most of the group sells food: Julia, Eugenia, Gladys, Sabina, and Hilda sell prepared meals, Clemente and Maximo sell potatoes, Gregoria sells coffee, Filiberto sells meat, and Jorge sells beer. Of the remaining group members, Juan Alvaro sells replacement parts, Beatriz and Florentino sell clothing, and Jacinto sells pants. Most of the group members have 5 years of experience or less in their respective businesses, though four of them have more than 10 (and Beatriz has 25!). Their meetings are held every other Monday at 5pm at Clemente's house.

Most of the group members plan to use their loans to buy more ingredients to prepare food or more merchandise to sell.

Translated and elaborated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

el grupo los clavelitos consta de 14 integrantes, la mayor parte de los integrantes del grupo se dedican a la venta de comida, tambien comercio como ser venta de verduras, carne, ropa usada y de abarrotes.las reuniones son cada lunes a las 17:00 en casa de Clemente H. C..

loans.use: Buy ingredients to prepare meals and other merchandise to sell

loans.name: Estrellas Group

texts.en:
The Estrellas ("Stars") group is made up of five men and eight women who live in Oruro, a small mining city in southwestern Bolivia. Most of the group members sell clothing: Jose Manuel, Rocio, Venancia, Shirley, Elvis, Luis, Reyna, Suzana, Carolina and Griselda. Of the remaining group members, Javier is in another type of commerce, Milfred sells prepared meals, and Carlos sells boards. Most of the group members plan to use this loan to buy more merchandise to sell.

Most of the group members have five years of experience or less in their respective businesses, though three members have more than ten years' experience and Venancia has 25 years of experience.

The group was originally made up of 15 people, but two group members did not show up for the loan disbursal so they were excluded from the group.

Translated and elaborated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

esta fotografia corresponde al banco comunal las estrellas constituido por cuatro varones y ocho mujeres o este desembolso no asistieron dos socias quienes fueron escluidas del banco.

loans.use: Buy bulk clothing to resell

loans.name: Zaki

texts.en: Zaki is 57 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in a small village close to Nabatieh located in Southern Lebanon. Zaki owns a small bakery that attracts many clients from the region. He has requested a loan of $US1,000 to fund his purchase of ingredients for his tasty treats. This is Zaki's seventh time requesting a loan from Al Majmoua. Zaki has consistently repaid his monthly installments in full and on time.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for bakery products

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es: Don Juan tiene 51 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, es casado, tiene dos hijos de 13 y16 años de edad, que están estudiando. Su esposa se dedica a lavar y planchar ajeno para ayudar en los gastos de su familia. Don Juan tiene una zapatería llamada Rumbin y lleva veintidós años de experiencia, la zapatería está ubicada en un mercado de la capital, a veces el negocio esta mal, poco trabajo, entonces se va atrabajar a su finca para no dejar de percibir ingresos para su familia. Con la solicitud del préstamo quiere invertir en materia prima, en compra de productos varios para la zapatería, para mejorar la oferta y atraer más clientes. A largo plazo es fortalecer el volumen de inventario de su negocio, invertir más en la finca para ver mejores resultados, así como ayudar a sus hijos a prepararse profesionalmente
texts.en:
Mr. Juan is 51 years old and lives in the North Laureles neighborhood. He is married and has two children ages 13 and 16, who are students. His wife cleans and irons for other people to help cover the family's expenses. Juan owns a shoe store called "Rumbin" and has 22 years of experience. The shoe store is located in a market in the capital. Sometimes business is bad and there is little work to be done, but other times it is great and Juan works hard to make money for his family. Juan is seeking the loan to purchase raw materials for making shoes to increase his offerings and attract more clients. In the long run, Juan would like to increase the store's inventory and invest more in the business to make more money so that he can help his children prepare themselves professionally.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to make shoes.

loans.name: Elbira

texts.es: Doña Elvira tiene 44 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Norte es madre soltera, con tres hermosos hijos de 24, 25 y 27 años de edad, los cuales son independientes a ella, le costó mucho sacar adelante a su familia, ya que nunca contó con el poyo del padre de sus hijos. Con el apoyo de todos sus hijos y con el de ella propio lograron poner una pulpería que tiene ya tres años de tenerla la cual ha podido mantenerse ya que a través del tiempo ha podido captar clientes al mismo tiempo ha ido creciendo su inventario. Ahora pretende captar nuevos segmentos de mercado y por eso solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de belleza y del hogar y así ofertarlos en su pulpería. Espera poder mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia a través de este negocio porque ella dice que el negocio es de toda la familia. Ella ha dedicado el tiempo y amor necesario para que mis hijos sean buenos hombres ante esta sociedad.
texts.en:
Ms. Elvira is 44 years old and lives in the North Laureles neighborhood. She is the single mother of three beautiful children, ages 24, 25 and 27, who now live on their own. It was difficult for Elvira to maintain her family because she was never able to rely on the support of her children's father. With all of her children's support, and with her own fortitude, the family was able to open a general store, which is now 3 years old. The family has been able to maintain it by attracting clients and increasing the inventory. Now Elvira is ready to attract new segments of the market, which is why she is requesting the loan. The loan will be used to purchase beauty products and household goods to sell in the store. Elvira hopes to improve the quality of her family's life through this business because she considers it a possession of the entire family. She has dedicated the time and love so that her children are good members of society.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products and household goods.

loans.name: Lucía Adelaida

texts.es: La Sra. Lucia vende repostería y cosmético desde hace tres años. Negocio que puso con capital propio y ha ido sacando adelante poco a poco. Comenta que ha tenido tiempos difíciles debido a la cara que está la vida actualmente, pero no a perdido las esperanzas y ha logrado mantener el negocio. El uso del préstamo es para comprar materia prima para elaborar las reposterías y también invertirá en la compra de cosméticos y así poder fortalecer su negocio. Lucia habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, tiene 49 años de edad, y con tres hijos mayores de edad, de 18, 24 y 30 años,  su esposo trabaja y siempre ha estado pendiente de las necesidades de la familia. A largo plazo es establecer su negocio en un local amplio y poner una cafetería ya que eso le generaría mas ingresos, ayudar a su hija de 18 años a salir a delante y a que se prepare ya que es la única que esta a su cargo porque los otros están casados.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucia has sold baked goods and cosmetic products for three years. She started the business with her own capital, and has continued moving forward little by little. She has had difficult times as a result of the high cost of living, but has not lost hope and continues running her business. Mrs. Lucia will use the loan to purchase raw goods from which she will make her baked goods. She will also use the loan to purchase cosmetic products, and strengthen her business in this way. Lucia is 49 years old and lives in the Laureles North neighborhood. She has three children, ages 18, 24 and 30. Her husband works and has always been sensitive to the family's needs. In the long term, Lucia would like to move her business to a larger location and add a cafeteria, which will increase her profits. With the additional income she will support her 18 year old daughter, as she is the the only one currently living in the house because Lucia's other children are married.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to make baked goods, and purchase cosmetic products to sell.

loans.name: Hermenegildo

texts.es: El Sr. Hermenegildo es un hombre muy trabajador, tiene 52 años de edad. Toda su vida ha trabajado en la preparación y venta de rosquillas. Son cuarenta años de experiencia ya que su familia de eso subsistía, y así aprendió a trabajar y hacer las ricas rosquillas que son elaboradas a base de maíz, queso y manteca, actualmente está soltero, sus hijos son mayores de edad e independientes. El préstamo lo necesita para comprar un caballo y así facilitar  sus ventas y poder moverse con  rapidez.
texts.en:
Mr. Hermenegildo is 52 years old and is a hard working man. His entire life he has worked in the preparation and sales of hot cakes. He has 40 years of experience. His family used to live off the hot cakes, and as a result Mr. Hermenegildo has refined a delicious recipe, combining corn, cheese and butter. Currently, he is single and his children are grown up. Mr. Hermenegildo is requesting the loan to purchase a horse which will help him sell his product and move more quickly.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a horse

loans.name: Yehya

texts.en: Yehya, 26 years old, is married and has one child. He lives in a small village close to Nabatieh in Southern Lebanon. Yeyha, an ambitious young man, owns an automobile electronic maintenance business. Yehya's enthusiasm and will power have helped his business grow. He has requested a loan of $US1,000 to purchase a more diverse supply of automobile parts. His new inventory will allow him to respond to a wider range of his clients' vehicle troubles. This will be Yehya's second loan with Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase and diversify inventory

loans.name: Yolanda Bertha

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda Bertha, tiene 44 años, está casada, estudió laboratorio clínico, hizo sus prácticas en Huamachuco durante 07 meses, después tuvo su bebe, renunció a su trabajo, vive en el Distrito de El Porvenir en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad.
Para ayudarse económicamente empezó a trabajar hace 02 años en el negocio de cosmetología, la socia estudió 01 año  cosmetología y trituración. Tiene año y medio trabajando en el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su hermana la impulsó para que inicie un negocio para que salga adelante por ella misma, ella decidió participar en el Banco Comunal “ESPERANZA DEL MAÑANA” porque quería implementar el negocio y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibió compró tintes, secadora, líquidos, máquina para cortar el cabello, etc. 

Con el préstamo de S/. 600.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 04 meses, tiene pensado invertir este dinero en la implementación del negocio.
La empresaria sueña con comprar ómnibus, medios de transporte porque es más rentable además contrataría personal y ella lo administraría.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yolanda Bertha is 44 and married. She studied Clinical Laboratory Science and did 7 months internship in Huamachuco. After she had her baby, she quit work, and now lives in the El Porvenir district, Trujillo Province, La Libertad department. In order to help herself economically, she started work 2 years ago in cosmetology. She studied one year of cosmetology and has worked in the Manuela Ramos Movement for a year and a half. Her sister gave her the impetus to start a business so she could get ahead by herself. She decided to participate in the communal bank ESPERANZA DEL MAÑANA (Hope for Tomorrow) because she wanted to start her business. With the first loan of $110, she bought dies, hair products, a hair dryer, a hair cutter, etc. With this loan of $225, which she will repay in 4 months, she plans to invest in the running of the business. This businesswoman dreams of buying a bus, a means of transportation that is more profitable, she would rent it personally as well and administrate it.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Running the business, including tools and products

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El  Sr. Juan tiene 44 años de edad, es casado, y habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación. Su esposa trabaja en una casa particular en servicios domésticos, quien se levanta en horas de la mañana para poder hacer sus labores en su hogar,  atender a su esposo e hijos ya que estudian dos por la mañana en la primaria y los otros dos cursan la secundaria por la tarde, y después ella sale para su trabajo. El negocio de don Juan, es la reparación de radios, TV, equipos, entre otros, también brinda servicio de acarreo, y así se ayuda con otros ingresos para cubrir los gastos del hogar, lleva dieciocho años en el negocio, desea tener mas publicidad para captar mas clientes, el trabajaba en soldadura metalúrgica y estudio un curso de electrónica así fue que tuvo la idea de tener su propio negocio el cual ha sido una fuente de ingreso para subsistir con su familia. La solicitud de préstamo es para infraestructura va a terminar de construir su porche, hará el enverjado, para tener un poco mas de seguridad ante la delincuencia.
texts.en:
Juan, 44, is married and lives in the Villa Reconciliacion neighborhood. His wife works as a maid; she gets up very early to do her own housework, take care of her husband's and their four children's needs, and then she goes off to work. Two of the children go to elementary school in the morning, and the other two attend middle school in the afternoon. Juan's business is a TV, radio, stereo repair shop. He also has a delivery service on the side to increase his family income. Juan used to work in welding, and after taking an electronics course, he got the idea of starting the repair business eighteen years ago, and it has become the main source of income for his family. He would like to reach more customers for his business, but the purpose for this loan is to finish building a gated porch to stay a little safer from theft and vandalism.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish home's gated porch

loans.name: Carmen Dora

texts.es:
La señora Carmen Dora, tiene 56 años, es V., estudió secundaria completa, no continuó estudiando porque se C.ó, tiene 05 hijos, 04 trabajan y 01 está haciendo tesis, vive en el Distrito D. El Porvenir en la Provincia D. Trujillo en el Departamento D. La Libertad.
Antes ha trabajado 08 años administrando un grifo en la ciudad D. Trujillo, después ha trabajado 05 años administrando un grifo en la ciudad D. Piura, hace 02 años que vino a Trujillo y tuvo la iniciativa D. tener un negocio propio porque siempre había trabajado, ella empezó a tener una bodega en el momento que le hizo el préstamo a Manuela Ramos, gracias a su sobrina pertenece en el Banco Comunal “ESPERANZA DEL MAÑANA”  y con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 compró harina, huevos, leches, etc.
Con el préstamo D. S/. 1100.00 que cancelará en 4 cuotas, tiene pensado invertir este dinero en la compra D. productos D. limpieza, fideos, aceite, ace, arroz.
La empresaria sueña con tener una hamburguesería y pollería.
texts.en:
Señora Carmen Dora is 56 years old. She is a widow. She finished secondary school, but didn’t continue studying because she got married. She has 5 children, 4 who are working and 1 who is doing a thesis. She lives in the District of El Porvenir in the Province of Trujillo in the Department of La Libertad. She worked for 8 years running a petrol station in the city of Trujillo. After this she worked for 5 years running a petrol station in the city of Piura. It has been 2 years since she came to Trujillo and took the initiative to have her own business. Because she was always working, she began with a neighbourhood store at the very moment she got the loan from Manuela Ramos, thanks to her niece she belongs to the Community Bank “Esperanza del Mañana” (Hope of Tomorrow). With the first loan of S/.300.00 she bought flour, eggs, milk, etc. With this loan of S/. 1100.00 that she will repay in 4 installments, she wants to invest in the purchase of cleaning products, vermicelli, oil, and rice. These businesswoman dreams of having a hamburger and chicken restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various household products for resale

loans.name: Najib

texts.en: Najib, 41 years old, is married and has 6 children. He lives in a small village in the area of Nabatieh located in Southern Lebanon. Najib owns a home furniture retail store. This can at times be a very capital-intensive business, and Najib has requested a loan of US$ 1,200 to purchase more furniture and decoration items for his constantly expanding stock. This will be Najib's second loan with Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase new products for a home furniture retail business

loans.name: Erick David

texts.es: Don Erick tiene 38 años de edad, habita en el barrio Sierra Maestra, es casado y tiene una niña menor que está estudiando en la primaria, su esposa trabaja en una tienda en el Centro Comercial Metrocentro se desempeña como encargada de limpieza  de esa forma apoya a su familia para salir adelante. Don Erick vende fritanga desde doce años se ha dedicado a las venta de comida, el comenzó los días domingo vendiendo sopa y luego se proyectó a la venta de comida lo cual le ha resultado. Con el dinero que está solicitando es para invertir en las mejoras del local así como invertir también en la materia prima del negocio para ofrecer a sus clientes sus ricos platos y poder mantener la variedad de alimentos.
texts.en:
Erick, 38, lives in the Sierra Maestra barrio, is married and has a young daughter who attends elementary school. His wife works as a janitor in a store at the Metrocentro shopping mall to contribute to the family's income. Erick has a food stand where he sells traditional fried food. He started twelve years ago selling soup on Sundays, and from there his food sales business took off. The loan he is requesting will be invested in improvements for the stand, and in purchasing additional ingredients to offer his customers his delicious dishes and maintain variety in his menu.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improving food stand and purchasing ingredients

loans.name: Silvia Soledad

texts.es:
La señora Silvia Soledad, tiene 48 años, es divorciada, estudió secundaria completa, no siguió estudiando porque se casó, después estudió cosmetología, artesanía, tiene 03 hijos, vive en el Distrito D. El Porvenir en la Provincia D. Trujillo en el Departamento D. La Libertad.
La empresaria trabaja en artesanía en hilos y cueros, empezó como distracción, también se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos, D. ropa, trabaja por campañas. La socia tiene 02 años trabajando en el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su hermana la recomendó en el Banco Comunal “ESPERANZA DEL MAÑANA” ella decidió participar en este Banco porque siempre se le cerraban las puertas para adquirir el préstamo  en otra entidad, porque tenía que tener la garantía D. su esposo (AVAL), era un reto, porque siendo capaz, podía desenvolverse  además  salir adelante sin el apoyo D. otra persona y con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 que recibió compró hilos, agujas, palillos, agujas D. tejer.
Con el préstamo D. S/. 1200.00 que cancelará en 04 meses, tiene pensado invertir este dinero en la compra D. plantas PVC, docenas D. polos.
La socia sueña con seguir trabajando, porque es un estimulo como mujer ser independiente.
En el Banco Comunal al que pertenece, tiene el cargo D. tesorera, cuya función es llevar la contabilidad y ver que todo esté conforme.
texts.en:
Mrs. Silvia Soledad is 48 years old, divorced, and has completed her secondary education. She did not continue her studies because she got married, but she later studied cosmetology and folk art. She has 3 children and lives in the El Provenir district in Trujillo Province in the La Liberdad department. This businesswoman works in folk art, both needlework and leather, which she began as a hobby. She also sells cosmetics and clothing, and works for campaigns. She has been a working member of the Manuela Ramos Movement. Her sister recommended her to the communal bank ESPERANZA DEL MAÑANA (Hope for Tomorrow). She decided to participate in this bank because the doors were always closed to getting a loan elsewhere because she needed her husband, Aval, as a guarantor. This was a challenge, because being a capable person, she was able to cope and even get ahead without anybody else's help. With the first loan of $1000 that she received, she bought threads, needles, knitting needles, and weaving needles. With this loan of $425, which she will repay in 4 months, she intends to invest in artificial plants and dozens of poles. This member dreams of continuing to work, because it is stimulating to be an independent woman. She is the treasurer of the communal bank that she belongs to, whose function is to do the bookkeeping and see that everything is proper.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of artificial plants and poles.

loans.name: Guillermina De Los A

texts.es: Guillermina habita en el barrio La Primavera, vende cosmético desde hace un año, ha captado clientela y son productos accesibles de vender por su calidad y precio, inició con esfuerzos propios, actualmente tiene 23 años de edad, casada y con una niña de 3 años de edad, su esposo trabaja en una empresa de zona franca desempeñándose como operario de línea, Guillermina es activa y con deseo de superación con el préstamo que esta solicitando es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de líneas de cosméticos para ofrecer al publico en general así como a sus clientes. Alargo plazo es alquilar o hacer un establecimiento  donde pueda desarrollarse mas solidamente con sus ventas, también espera tener salud y  suficiente capital para apoyar a su hija con los estudios.
texts.en:
Guillermina lives in La Primavera neighborhood. She has been selling cosmetics for a year, and thanks to the quality and price of her products, her clientele has been steadily increasing. Guillermina is 23 years old, married and has a 3-year-old daughter. Her husband works in an industrial free zone as an assembly line operator. Guillermina is a very active go-getter. The loan she is requesting will be used as a work capital in her cosmetic business to offer a wider variety of products to her clients. Her long-term goal is to rent or build a small store to expand her business, and she hopes to stay healthy and have enough money to provide for her daughter's education.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing cosmetics

loans.name: Erick Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Erick habita en la II etapa del barrio de Hialeah, tiene 27 años de edad, su esposa es ama de casa, ya que tiene que cuidar a sus dos pequeños hijos. Don Erick trabaja como conductor de las rutas urbanas  de las cooperativas de esta ciudad de la Capital de Managua, el cual se levanta temprano ya que comienza a dar la primera vuelta en las primera horas de la mañana, y son cinco vuelta las que realiza por días,  ya son diez años los que tiene de andar en las rutas pues le ha permitido hacer su pequeña casa así como subsistir. Con la solicitud que está haciendo es para terminar de construir una habitación, para eso necesita comprar materiales como arena, cemento, piedra. A largo plazo es  tener su propia ruta de transporte para trabajarla y tener mejores ingresos para poder ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
Erick, 27, lives in the Hialeah barrio in Managua. His wife is a stay-home mother, who cares for their two small children. Erick works as a bus driver for the cooperatives in Managua. He gets up very early each day, because the first trip begins in the early hours of the morning, and makes five trips throughout the day. He has been at this job for ten years, and has been able to build their small home and make a living. The loan he is requesting will be used to finish an additional room in his home; he needs sand, cement, and stone. His long-term goal is to own a bus, work his own routes and have a better income to provide for his children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finishing the construction of a room

loans.name: Flavia

texts.es:
Flavia tiene 34 años D. edad, estudió tercero D. secundaria, es casada, madre D. cuatro hijos, vive en la comunidad D. Machacmarca.

Es una D. las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal Ciudad Nueva D. la  Comunidad D. Machacmarca, Distrito D. Pilcuyo, Provincia del Collao-Puno, con su primer préstamo 
D. S/.300.00 nuevos soles compró 03 ovinos para su posterior venta, Doña Flavia manifiesta que desD. los 15 años D. edad empezó a vender gaseosas en la feria D. Pilcuyo, desD. que convive con su esposo se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganado vacuno, ovino, los días martes compra D. Huacullani y venD. los días domingos en la feria D. Ilave.  

Con este crédito D. S/. 1,700.00 Nuevos Soles, que pagará en 04 cuotas, comprará 01 toro para su posterior venta.

Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales, comprar una casa en la ciudad D. Puno y seguir con su negocio aumentando más ganado para su comercialización.
texts.en:
