Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of fruit.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Doña Reyna habita en un barrio de la capital, llamado Laureles Sur, tiene 38 años de edad, con dos hijos de 14 y 20 años de edad, su esposo es comerciante y esta pendiente de su familia. La Sra. Reyna trabaja en servicios domésticos en una casa particular, desde hace un año, ya que se propuso trabajar para ayudar a  su esposo y a sus hijos a que sigan estudiando. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para infraestructura en la construcción de una pared de su casa ya que las paredes que tiene son de tabla y quiere comenzar hacer mejoras para estar bien con su familia. A largo plazo es terminar de hacer su casa, y poder ayudar a sus hijos a que estudien.
texts.en:
Reyna lives in the capital city in a neighbourhood called Laureles Sur, she is 38, has two children ages 14 and 20, her husband is a vendor that takes care of the family. A year ago, Reyna started providing domestic services in a private house to help her husband, and to help her children continue studying. The loan request is to build a wall in her house because the current walls are made of thin wood and she wants to make improvements for the well-being of her family. In the long term she wants to finish her house and be able to help her children with their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
La señora Tania pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Lomas de Yarina, ubicado en Av. José Faustino Sánchez # 451, distrito de Yarinacocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tania tiene 31 años y es madre de 2 hijos. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300, decidió invertir en productos de belleza.

Tania, en la actualidad continúa con la venta de productos de belleza.

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,500, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza como 2 colonias, 3 esmalte, 2 sombra, 5 lápices labial y 3 perfumes.
 
Tania es una madre bien jovial con muchas ganas de seguir adelante y a pesar  de algunas adversidades ella sigue adelante. Además está muy agradecida de que se le de la oportunidad de acceder a un crédito el cual puede trabajarlo de manera independiente.
texts.en:
Tania belongs to the communal bank Las Lomas de Yarina, located at 451 Avenida José Faustino Sánchez in the Yarinacocha district of the Ucayali region. Tania, 31, is the mother of 2 children. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for 300 Peruvian soles, Tania decided to invest in beauty products. Tania continues to work selling beauty products. With this loan for 1500 Peruvian soles, which she will repay in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of beauty products, including 2 types of cologne, 2 nail polishes, 2 types of eye shadow, 5 lip pencils and 3 perfumes. Tania is a young and happy mother eager to move herself ahead. Despite obstacles she continues working to move forward. She is very appreciative for the opportunity to be loaned the capital that allows her to work independently.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will invest in the purchase of beauty products.

loans.name: Horacio Alexander

texts.es: Don Horacio habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua ubicado en ciudadela Nicaragua, casado y con dos hijos de 13 y 18 años de edad, que están cursando la secundaria, su esposa es ama de casa y cuida de su familia. El Sr. Horacio es fotógrafo con treinta años de experiencia, lo mas difícil fue el inicio el poder hacer su clientela. Con el préstamo es para invertir en capital de trabajo en compras de material fotográfico y así poder siempre ofrecer sus fotos de  estilo y variedad. A largo plazo es poder instalar un estudio fotográfico, remodelar su casa y poder dar estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Horacio lives in a neighborhood in the capital of Managua located in the citedel of Nicaragua. He is married with two children ages 13 and 18, who are studying in secondary school; his wife is a housewife and she takes care of the family. Horacio is a photographer with 30 years of experience. The most difficult part was the beginning in establishing a clientele. With the loan he will invest in buying photographic materials and in this way always be able to offer a variety of styles of photos to his clients. In the long term he wants to install a photographic studio, remodel his home and be able to continue with his children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in photographic materials

loans.name: Dolly

texts.es:
La señora Dolly, socia del BC “Picota”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Picota. Se dedica a la venta de gaseosas, gelatinas y flan. El negocio está ubicado en su domicilio, en la Carretera Fernando Belaunde  Terry s/n, en dicho lugar atiende a los clientes, los cuales son los vecinos y transeúntes que visitan su distrito.   

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará gelatina en cantidad, azúcar, leche y gaseosas de diferentes marcas, tamaños y sabores, para que los clientes encuentren lo que requieran.

Dolly tiene 34 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, quienes la apoyan en la atención de los clientes. Es una mujer muy perseverante y responsable, con ganas de salir adelante y apoyar a su esposo en la economía de la casa. Desea contar con un local para la venta de refrigerios.
texts.en:
Dolly is a member of the Communal Bank “Picota,” she lives in the San Martín region in the province and state of Picota. She sells soda pop, gelatin, and flan (pudding). The business is located in her home, on Carretera Fernando Belaunde Terry s/n, where she takes care of her customers, many of whom are neighbors and visitors to her area. With the loan of S/. 1,000, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy gelatin in bulk, sugar, milk, and different sizes, brands and flavors of soda pop so that her customers may find what they need. Dolly is 34 years old, she lives with her husband and children, who help her serve her customers. She is a responsible woman and very perseverant, with the drive to succeed and support her husband in meeting household expenses. She wishes to have a locale to sell snacks.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy gelatin in bulk, sugar, milk and soda pop.

loans.name: Flor De Canela (C) Group

texts.en:
The Flor D. Canela ("Cinnamon Flower") group is maD. up of 13 people who work as blacksmiths, selling car parts, upholstery, CD sales, sewing and selling clothing, and potato and vegetable sales. The president, Mrs. Carmen Rosa M., sells different types of potatoes that she imports from Peru in bulk in the city of El Alto (La P.). When their loans were disbursed, the president reminded the group members to be cautious and responsible in their behavior during this loan cycle and towards AgroCapital.* All the group members agreed to keep working this way both for this loan cycle and for those to come.

Most of the women plan to use their loans to buy more merchandise to sell.

*Loans that appear on Kiva have actually already been disbursed (so that clients don't have to wait for their loan to be funded on Kiva); Kiva's partner MFIs are reimbursed at the end of each month. This is why Flor D. Canela has already received their loan.

Translated and elaborated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

El Banco Comunal Flor D. canela C esta compuesto por 13 personas que se dedican a la venta D. herrerÃ­a, tambiÃ©n a la comercializaciÃ³n, ropas que elaboran y las comercializan, venta D. papa, verdura, Y la presidenta la Sra. Carmen Rosa M. es comerciante D. venta D. diferentes variedades D. papas que impota desD. PerÃº para repartir por mayor en la ciudad del alto ( La P.) Durante el desembolso la presidenta los recomendÃ³ a sus asociados para tengan el cuidado necesario, y la responsabilidad para trabajar en este ciclo que empieza y tambiÃ©n hacia la instituciÃ³n. Y se comprometieron a trabajar y que en el siguiente ciclo tambiÃ©n puedan seguir participando D. la misma manera D. cÃ³mo se esta empezando.

loans.use: Buy merchandise in bulk to resell

loans.name: Ederlinda

texts.es:
La Señora Ederlinda, socia del Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, vive en la Región y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la confección y venta de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños y sábanas que después sale a vender a sus amigos, familiares y a clientes en los pueblos más cercanos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual cancelará en 06 meses, comprará hilos de diferentes colores, blondas, telas de diversas variedades, colores y acabados, elásticos, agujas, etc., y de esa manera poder contar con lo necesario para tener un buen acabado en las prendas que ella confecciona y satisfacer las exigencias de sus clientes.

Ederlinda tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos quienes la motivan en todo lo que ella se propone. Es una mujer positiva y emprendedora. Su meta es comprar una maquina industrial para tener su propio taller de costura y dar trabajo a otras personas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ederlinda is a partner in the "Orchids" Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martín region and province, in the Tarapoto district. Ederlinda is a seamstress, and she sells clothing for women, men, and children, as well as sheets. She sells these products to her friends, family, and clients in nearby towns. With a loan of 1,000 soles, Ederlinda will buy colored thread, lace, a variety of fabrics, as well as hems, elastics, needles, etc. She'll pay back the loan in six months. In this way Ederlinda can have the necessary tools to add detail to the clothes that she makes, and satisfy her clients. Ederlinda is 37 years old, and lives with her husband and children. She is an optimistic, hard-working woman, and her family is the motivation behind all that she does. Ederlinda's goal is to buy an industrial sewing machine in order to have her own sewing workshop and create jobs others.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will by thread, lace, fabric, elastics, etc.

loans.name: Gledis

texts.es:
La señora Gledis, socia del BC “Mujeres Rumbo al Desarrollo”, vive en la Región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Morales. Se dedica a la venta de  golosinas, chupetes, dulces regionales y frutas como el aguaje y maní. Realiza las ventas de manera ambulatoria en una de las principales calles de su distrito, frente a la plaza de armas, lugar muy concurrido por lo que le va muy bien hasta la fecha.   

Con este préstamo de S/. 800, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará aguaje en saco, azúcar en saco, bolsitas para chupetes, dulces de diferente sabores y variedades, maní en kilos para tostar y darle diversos usos (dulce de maní o saladito). 

Gledis tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su esposo y 2 de sus hijos quienes aún dependen de ella. Gladis es una mujer muy perseverante y responsable, con ganas de salir adelante y apoyar a su esposo en la economía de la casa. Desea tener una casa y poner un negocio en la misma.
texts.en:
Mrs Gledis is a partner of the "Women Towards Development" communal bank. She lives in the region and province of San Martin in the district of Morales. Mrs Gledis sells candies, lollipops, peanuts, regional sweets and fruits like aguaje. She is a street vendor and is settled in one of the main streets of her district, in front of the main square, as it is a very crowded spot, her business has done very well so far. Gledis requests a loan of S/. 800, which she will pay in 4 installments. With it, she will buy sugar, candies of different types and flavors, peanuts (which she will toast and sell either sweet or salty), aguaje and little bags for the candies. Gledis is 35 years old, she lives with her husband and together they have 2 kids who still depend on them. Gledis is a very persevering and responsible woman and she has the drive to succeed and to help her husband with the house expenses. Gledis hopes to own a house and to open up a little business herself.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, candies of different types and flavors, peanuts, aguaje and little bags for the candies

loans.name: Giovani

texts.es:
La Señora Giovanni, socia del Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, vive en la región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes. Giovanni está creciendo poco a poco en el negocio, porque no tiene mucho tiempo en el negocio, apenas 1 año y le va bien. El negocio está ubicado en su propio domicilio en el Jr. Bolognesi Nº 1102, lugar donde acuden diariamente a comprar los clientes que son mayormente los vecinos de su  barrio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 800, el cual cancelará en 6 cuotas, comprará  productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en saco, leche, aceite, conservas en cajas de diferentes tamaños, papel higiénico en paquetes y otros productos de mayor rotación y así surtir bien el negocio y que los clientes encuentren lo que buscan. 

Giovani vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos que aún están pequeños. Ella que a sus 28 años es una mujer trabajadora, carismática y con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando para crecer en el negocio porque le gusta lo que hace, también quiere darle una profesión a sus hijos. Su meta es crecer en el negocio y llegar a vender al por mayor.
texts.en:
Mrs. Giovanni, a member of the Communal Bank “Las Orquídeas," lives in the region and province of San Martín in the Tarapoto district. She sells groceries. Giovanni is growing little by little in her business, because she hasn’t been open for very long, barely 1 year and her business is going well. The business is located in her own home at Jr. Bolognesi Nº 1102, a place where her customers gather daily to shop as they are primarily her neighbors from her neighborhood. With this loan for S/. 800, which will be repaid in 6 payments, she will buy basic needs products such as rice, bagged sugar, milk, oil, different sizes of canned goods, packages of toilet paper, and other products that sell quickly and in this way stock her business well so that the customers find what they are looking for. Giovani lives with her husband and 2 small children. She is 28 years old, hard-working, charismatic, and with a great desire to continue working to grow her business because she like what she does, and she also wants to provide a profession to her children. Her goal is to grown the business and become a wholesaler.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic needs products such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, etc.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria Isabel Z. L. is in the process of applying to purchase a home through a Mexican government program called Infonavit.  Infonavit provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families’ incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home. La  señora Maria Isabel Z. López va a tramitar una casa de infonavit por que desea empezar un patrimonio para su hija ya que ella es madre soltera.Prefiere estar pagando  su propia casa en lugar de pagar renta . Maria trabaja en una maquiladora de esta misma ciudad con  el transcurso de los años ella ha recopilado ciertos dinero para tramitar su casa pero aun así no completa la cantidad para la casa. Ella solicita la cantidad de $325 dólares.

loans.use: Comprar casa

loans.name: Hidelsa

texts.es:
La Señora Hidelsas, socia del Banco Comunal “Judith Tuanama”, vive en la región y provincia de El Dorado, distrito de San José de Sisa. Se dedica al cultivo y venta de cacao. Hidelsa cultiva en su chacra para luego venderlo a los compradores mayoristas del distrito y los recolectores de cacao que vienen desde Tarapoto en busca de esta semilla la cual es muy buscada en el mercado. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual cancelará en 6 cuotas, comprará  abonos e insecticidas para asegurar la producción, también pagará la mano de obra de los peones, ya que requiere de ellos para realizar los trabajos de cuidado de la chacra y de esa manera sacar un buen producto porque depende de ello para darle buen precio al producto y así satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.

Hidelsa tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, quienes la apoyan en las actividades de la chacra. Es una mujer trabajadora y con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando. Su meta está en aumentar la chacra en el cultivo de cacao y construir una casa.
texts.en:
La Señora Hidelsas, socia del Banco Comunal "Judith Tuanama", vive en la región y provincia de El Dorado, distrito de San José de Sisa. Se dedica al cultivo y venta de cacao. Hidelsa cultiva en su chacra para luego venderlo a los compradores mayoristas del distrito y los recolectores de cacao que vienen desde Tarapoto en busca de esta semilla la cual es muy buscada en el mercado. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual cancelará en 6 cuotas, comprará abonos e insecticidas para asegurar la producción, también pagará la mano de obra de los peones, ya que requiere de ellos para realizar los trabajos de cuidado de la chacra y de esa manera sacar un buen producto porque depende de ello para darle buen precio al producto y así satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Hidelsa tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, quienes la apoyan en las actividades de la chacra. Es una mujer trabajadora y con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando. Su meta está en aumentar la chacra en el cultivo de cacao y construir una casa.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, insecticide, and pay wages of her workers

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
La Señora Juana Maria M. tiene 39 años de edad, habita en el Barrio Villa Reconciliación del distrito seis de Managua, su compañero de vida trabaja como conductor y ayuda para las necesidades del hogar, tiene 2 hijas en edad escolar, (a esta señora en el crédito anterior de Kiva, se le falleció uno de sus hijos) 
Doña Juana Maria tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación, donde ofrece productos básicos para el hogar, su mayor clientela la tiene en todo su entorno, inicio su negocio hace quince años con capital propio  e inventario muy poco, su mayor anhelo es ver crecer su negocio para una mejor atención a sus clientes, es por eso que solicita este préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de consumo básico y poder ampliar la diversidad de su oferta.
texts.en:
Señora Juana Maria M. is 39 years old and lives in the Villa Reconiliación neighborhood of the 6th district of Managua. Her life companion works as a conductor and helps with the necessities of the house. She has 2 daughters of school age (since the previous loan from Kiva, one of her children passed away) Señora Juana Maria has a store in her house, where she offers basic products for the home. She gets most of her clientele from her local area. She started the business fifteen years ago with her own capital and very little inventory. Her greatest wish is to see her business grow to give better attention to her clients. Therefore she requests this loan to invest in the purchase of basic consumer goods and to be able to expand the diversity of her offerings.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic consumer goods for her general store.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: Maria Rosario tiene 61 años, ha sido una madre soltera que tuvo 7 hijos, 5 varones y 2 mujeres los dos últimos menores, uno esta en la Universidad y el otro en la Escuela Secundaria. Doña Maria Rosario se preparo en cursos de Estilismo y cosmetología y logro poner una pequeña sala de Belleza con pequeños prestamos, en la actualidad cuenta con 41 años de experiencia en el ramo y solicita su crédito para poder ver hecho realidad sus metas de mejorar su nivel de vida y poder heredar a los hijos un  negocio auto sostenible y su empeño es seguir diversificando productos en la Sala de Belleza ofertando  además de cosméticos, accesorios para el cabello,  Ropa y zapatos.
texts.en:
Maria Rosario is 61 years old. She has been a single mother who had 7 children; 5 boys and 2 girls. The two youngest are minors. One attends the University and the other is in Secondary School. Doña Maria Rosario prepared herself with courses in fashion design and cosmetology and managed to start a small beauty salon with small loans. Currently she relies on 41 years of experience in the area and requests a loan to be able to realize her goals to improve her standard of living and to be able to leave the children a self-sustaining business. She plans to continue diversifying products in the beauty salon, offering hair accessories, clothes and shoes, in addition to cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her beauty salon by diversifying the products she offers.

loans.name: Familia Unida Group

texts.en:
The Familia Unida ("United Family") Communal Bank is maD. up of people involved in various businesses: hardware stores, drink sales, sewing and vending clothing. One of the men is a contractor, and the other makes ads and jingles for the media. The president, Mrs. Maritzabel T., is also involved with the media. During the loan disbursal,* the president gave a rousing speech in which she urged her fellow group members to take the necessary caution and be responsible with their work ethic and in their behavior towards the institution (AgroCapital) in this upcoming loan cycle. The group members echoed this sentiment and supported Mrs. T., and they all committed themselves to work hard, so that they can continue to get credit with AgroCapital.

Most of the group members plan to use this loan to buy more merchandise to sell. Most of the women have many years of experience working in their respective fields; all but three have more than five years of experience.

*Note: Loans that appear on Kiva have actually already been disbursed (so that clients don't have to sit and wait for their loan to be funded on Kiva); Kiva's partner MFIs are reimbursed at the end of each month, after the loans are funded on Kiva. This is why Familia Unida has already received their loan.

Translated and elaborated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

El Banco Comunal Familia Unida esta compuesto por personas que se dedican a la atenciÃ³n D. FerreterÃ­as, tambiÃ©n a la comercializaciÃ³n D. refrescos, ropas que elaboran y las comercializan, uno D. los dos varones que participan en la asociaciÃ³n es albaÃ±il, el otro hace spots, y jingles para medios D. comunicaciÃ³n. Y la presidenta la Sra. Maritzabel T. tambiÃ©n tiene vÃ­nculos con los medios D. comunicaciÃ³n. Durante el desembolso la presidenta arengo a sus asociados para tengan el cuidado necesario, y la responsabilidad para trabajar en este ciclo que empieza y tambiÃ©n hacia la instituciÃ³n, este sentir fue acogido y tambiÃ©n respaldado por los miembros D. la asociaciÃ³n y se comprometieron a trabajar y que en un segundo ciclo tambiÃ©n puedan seguir participando D. la misma manera D. cÃ³mo se esta empezando.

loans.use: Buy bulk merchandise to resell

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
El señor Martin T. S., cuenta actualmente con 53 años de edad, nació en 				
la Aldea Xojola, Nahuala, Sololá  y reside actualmente en la misma aldea, su actividad 				
diaria es en el cultivo siembra y cosechas de maxan, banano y café, gracias a esta				
actividad y con los esfuerzos día a día logro sacar a sus hijos adelante, que a				
ahora ya se graduaron y tienen sus trabajos, don Martin T. S. es un ejemplo 				
su comunidad porque anteriormente se dedica a limpia de terreno con otras personas				
y ahora ya cuenta con sus terrenos que con el paso del tiempo ha logrado que 				
su familia tenga una mejor condición de vida, y con el objetivo de incrementarlo 				
mas y poder  seguir con mejores condiciones, tuvo la necesidad  de acudir 				
en las oficinas de la Asociación ASDIR, para solicitar un crédito el cual lo 				
utilizara en la mejora de sus cosechas.				
Don Martin siempre ha sido una persona apreciable en su comunidad porque				
ha generado fuentes de empleo y con su actitud y amabilidad y colaboración 				
en la comunidad ha logrado un gran aprecio de las personas.
texts.en:
Mr Martin T. S. is 53 years old, he was born in the town of Xojola, Nahuala, Sololá and still lives there. Mr T. grows maxan, banana and coffee. Thanks to this activity, he successfully raised his children; they all went to school, graduated and have jobs. Mr T. is seen as a role model in his community. Before he would clean the land for other people, now he has his own land and over time he has succeeded in raising the standard of living of his family. Moreover, his work has created employment in the area and as he is a very kind and collaborative person, he is highly regarded by the community. Mr T. requested a loan from Associación ASDIR, he will use it to improve the quality of his harvests.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Planting and Harvesting Maxan, Coffee and Bananas

loans.name: Filena

texts.es: Doña Filena de 51 años, habita en el Barrio Villa Reconciliación Sur, esta casada y su esposo es dueño de una unidad de Taxi  conduciéndolo el mismo y ayudando para los gastos de la casa, tienen 4 hijos ya mayores de edad y trabajan independiente. Doña Filena se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo específicamente productos de cosmetología tiene 5 años de ejercer esta actividad, lo inicio con apoyo de su esposo y su anhelo es poder ampliar este pequeño negocio, Solicita el crédito para inversión del mismo y compra de Ropa, Zapatos y artículos del hogar para ofrecerlos a sus clientes en esta temporada y poder obtener mejores ganancias para el incremento del negocio y apoyo a sus gastos.
texts.en:
Doña Filena is 51 years old and lives in the Villa Reconciliación Sur neighborhood. She is married and her husband owns a taxi, which he drives himself, to help with household expenses. They have 4 children, all are adults and work on their own. Doña Filena sells products by catalog, specifically cosmetics. She has been doing this for 5 years and started the business with the help of her husband. Her wish is to be able to expand this small business. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business and buy clothing, shoes and home goods to offer to her customers so she can make more profit, expand the business and help out with expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes and home goods.

loans.name: Chuyma Sartañani Group

texts.en:
This is the Communal Bank. In Aymara, "chuyma sartanani" means "we will lift up our hearts." This is the way that both the president and all of the other group members feel. The president, Mrs. Teresa R., is a hard-working woman who sells sweaters in at the morning market in the center of Tumusla. Two of the other group members are involved in the same line of work. Others work at local stores and telephone centers, while the men in the group work at veterinarian's clinics, as drivers, and are involved in other miscellaneous work. This group is starting out strong in their first loan cycle, and hopes to achieve great success and continue to work with the institution (AgroCapital) in the future.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Este es el Banco Comunal Chuyma Sartanani, que en el castellano significa "Nos Levantaremos de Corazon". Y este es el sentir la presidenta y en se­ de todos los componentes de la asociacion, la presidenta la Sra. Tereza R. es una senora trabajadora y que se dedica a la comercializacion de chompas en la centrica feria de las mananeras de la zona de la Tumusla, y que tambien juntamente con ella hay otras dos personas que tambien tienen la misma actividad. Hay quienes atienden tiendas de pulperi­a, puntos telefonicos y otros entre los varones quienes atienden veterinarias, choferes, y es de esta miscelinea que este grupo esta emprendiendo con mucha fuerza en su primer ciclo, y que se espera los mejores exitos tambien con ello seguir trabajando con la institucion en el futuro.

loans.use: Purchase bulk merchandise to resell

loans.name: Héctor

texts.es:
Hector M. V. is in the process of applying to purchase a home through a Mexican government program called Infonavit. Infonavit provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families’ incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home.

El señor Héctor M. V. es un joven soltero que desea independizarse y empezar su propio camino sin sus padres, el quiere hacer desde este momento un patrimonio para cuando el desee formar una familia ya tengan un establecimiento donde vivir. Hector solicita la cantidad de 300 dolares.

El trabaja en un maquiladora y con estos ingresos va a poder pagar el préstamo recibido.
texts.en:
Hector M. V. is in the process of applying to purchase a home through a Mexican government program called Infonavit. Infonavit provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families' incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home. Héctor M. V. is a young single man who wishes to become independent and begin his own path without his parents. Today he wants to build a home so that when he wishes to have a family they will have an established place to live. Hector is asking for $300 dollars. He works in a factory and with these earnings he is going to be able to pay the loan he receives.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire a house

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Mr. Sothea K., 46, and his wife, Mrs. Bunthoeun Ro, 34, live in a small village off of National Road Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They were married in 1990 and have three children: one son and two daughters. One of their children works in a garment factory and the other two children study in a local school.

Mr. Sothea has been a mason for 15 years. He does his work in his village and in a nearby province, but sometimes he has a job in Phnom Penh City too.  His wife cuts grass to sell for cows' feed. She earns around $2.50 per day. Sothea and his wife are in the process of fixing their house and lack the money to finish some parts of their house. Therefore, Sothea is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase materials to make the walls of his house.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make the walls of his house.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mr. Sopheap O., 26, and his wife, Mrs. Mom Kin, 27, live in a small village off of National Road Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They were married in 2006 and have one daughter (shown in the picture with him).

Mr. Sopheap has been a construction worker for nine years. He does his work in the village and in a nearby province.  His wife has been a garment factory worker for five years. The couple is in the process of building their new house and lacks the money to finish the walls of the house. Therefore, Sopheap is requesting a loan of US$300 to purchase cement to finish the walls of his house.

loans.use: To purchase cement to finish wall of his house.

loans.name: Sreymom's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreymom S. (shown in the picture on the left) was selected to be a group leader by members for a loan from Maxima. In the group there are two families including hers. All of the group members are living along National Road Number Two about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

1-Mrs. Sreymom S., 28, and her husband, Mr. Bunthoeun Sum, 33, were married in 1998 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. One of the children studies in a local school. Seymom has been selling grocery items for one year. She buys them from a Ta Khmao market for resale in the village, while her husband has been a mason for 10 years. Sreymom is requesting a loan in the amount of $300 to purchase more grocery items for resale at her shop.

2-Mrs. Sophal P., 51, (shown in the picture on the right) and her husband, Mr. Ngi Sav, 55, were married in 1979 and have four daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home and the other two children work in a garment factory. Sophal and her husband have been selling vegetables and recycling materials for two years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $300 to purchase vegetables for resale.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items and vegetable for resale.

loans.name: Sam-At

texts.en:
Mr. Sam-at L. (pictured with his mother), 20, is single, and lives in a small village across Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. He has six brothers and sisters. Three of them study in a local school. One sister is a silk weaver, and one brother is a worker. His parents buy recycling materials to sell in the village.

Mr. Sam-at has been a worker for many years. He works for villagers in his village and earns about $70 per month for helping his parents. He stopped his studies when he was young.  His house is always flooding when heavy rains come, so he wants to level his house's foundation but lacks the money. Therefore, Sam-at is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase dirt for leveling the house's foundation and purchasing silk material for his sister's weaving.

loans.use: To purchase dirt for leveling his house foundation and purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Roeun N., 65, and her husband, Mr. Pich Chhun, 65, live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1965 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. Four of their children are married and live outside the family home and one son works in a restaurant.

Mrs. Roeun has been raising pigs for five years. Now she is creating another business of selling sugarcane juice. Mr. Pich has been a motor taxi driver for four years. He carries people from his village to other villages. Roeun is requesting a loan of $500 to buy a sugarcane juice machine and piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase a sugarcane juice machine and piglets for raising.

loans.name: Chompey

texts.en:
Mr. Chompey P., 23, and his wife, Mrs. Sreypum Moeun , 23, live along National road number six about 18 kilometers north of Phnom Penh. They were married in 2005 and have one son. 
The couple lives with Chompey's old mother.

Mr. Chompey has been raising ducks to sell for three years. He bought baby ducks from Kampong Cham province to raise at his house and sell to the middleman in the village, while his wife sells Cambodian cake to the villagers in front of the house in the morning. Before starting this business, she used to be a construction worker.

Now, Chompey is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase baby ducks to raise and buy dirt for leveling his house foundation.

loans.use: To purchase ducks to raise and buy dirt for leveling house foundation.

loans.name: Sam-Orn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-orn H., 41, is a widow with one daughter who was married in 2008. Her daughter is a garment factory worker and her son-in-law is a farmer. He grows rice and buys fruit for resale at the market in Phnom Penh. The family lives along national road number one about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sam-orn has been working in a garment factory since 2000. Currently, her son-in-law lacks the money to purchase mangoes on contract. He pays a cheaper price before the harvest season to the farmers for the mangoes they will grow and he will sell. Therefore, Sam-orn is requesting a loan of $1000 to give to her son-in-law for purchasing mangoes on contract.

loans.use: To purchase mangoes in contract.

loans.name: Bunthorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Bunthorn C. and her husband, Mr. Vin Phun, who live along national Road 1 about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1992 and have three children; one son and two daughters. One of their children is a garment factory worker and the other two children study in a local school.

Mrs. Bunthorn has been growing vegetables for three years. She grows them in her village to sell to an NGO. Her husband does fishing and construction work. Fishing season is coming soon so Bunthorn needs one boat and some other fishing materials for her husband's business. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase one boat, fishing nets, and some for purchasing seeds, fertilizer and pesticide for growing vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase one boat and fishing nets, and for growing vegetables

loans.name: Sovannary

texts.en:
Miss Sovannary T., 22, is single and lives with her parents on an island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Her mother is a housewife and her father is a silk weaver.

Miss Sovannary has been a silk weaver since 2002, a skill he learned from her sister. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Sovannary has one brother who sells grocery items at one market in Phnom Penh and now he needs to expand his business but lacks the money. Therefore, Sovannary is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase silk materials for her weaving and some for her brother to buy more grocery items for resale.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving and buy grocery items for selling.

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en:
Mrs. Kunthea P., 27, and her husband, Mr. Sambath Khan, 42, who live on an island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2002 and have two children: one son and one daughter.

Mrs. Kunthea has been a silk weaver for 15 years, a skill she learned from her aunt. She also has taught her husband to become a silk weaver as well. Besides weaving, he is also a musician. The couple sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh.

Kunthea is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase silk materials for her weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Kay

texts.en:
Mrs. Kay T., 63, is a widow with three children: two sons and one daughter. They live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. One of her children is married and lives outside the family home. One son is a construction worker and one daughter is a silk weaver.

Mrs. Kay has been a silk weaver since she was 10 years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Now she is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase silk materials for her weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en: Tatu is 24 years old, and married with a 1-year-old child. She runs her own shop and she has been a clothes and cassava seller since 2005. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $100 from her sales. Tatu is now looking for a loan to expand her business by increasing her current stock.

loans.use: Tatu would like to expand her business by increasing her current stock.

loans.name: Clothing Sales Group

texts.en:
Fatma  is a widow with 3 children aged 20, 8 and 5 years old. She is  a clothes and snacks seller. Every day, she works  at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

In the past, Fatma has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Fatma is now looking for a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have  businesses dealing with tailoring, snacks sales, juice sales, clothes and shoes sales.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Mariam's Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Mariam is 29 years old, and married with two children aged 1 and 5 years old. She has been a clothes seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 6am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $100 from her sales.
Mariam now requests a loan to expand her business by adding to her current stock. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Nadhifa, who also has business dealing with clothes sales.

loans.use: Mariam would like to expand her business by adding to her current stock.

loans.name: Mariam's Hatuna Tabu Group

texts.en:
Mariam is 36 years old and married with one child aged 5 years old. She has been a charcoal and juice seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.
Mariam now seeks a loan to expand her current business and to open a new business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Tatu, who also has a business dealing with charcoal and bites sales.

loans.use: Mariam would like to expand her current business and to start a new business.

loans.name: Mwanaisha's Tumekindi Group

texts.en: Mwanaisha is 20 years and she is divorced with one child, aged 2 years old. She has been a fish and bites seller since 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales. Mwanaisha is now looking for a loan to buy more fish and to make more bites to re-sell. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mkasi, who also has a business dealing with firewood and handbags sales.

loans.use: Mwanaisha would like to buy more fish and to make more bite to re-sell.

loans.name: Mwanaid

texts.en: Mwanaid is 25 years old and married with one child aged 6 years old. She runs her own salon and she has been a clothes (khanga & vitenge) and home utensils seller since 2006. Every day, she works at her business. In the past, Mwanaid has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to open her business. Mwanaid is now looking for a loan to expand her business by adding to her current stock.

loans.use: Mwanaid would like to expand her business by adding to her current stock.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab is 30 years old and married with three children aged 2, 5 and 7 years old. She has been a charcoal and firewood seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $550 from her sales. Zainab now requests a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: Zainab would like to buy more charcoal and firewood for the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is 28 years,She is divorced with 1 child aged 6 years old. She has been a clothes, shoes and handbags seller since 2007. Every day, she works from 9am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

In the past, Rukia has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Rukia now seek for a loan to increase her current stock for the expansion of her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mwanajuma and Zamda.

loans.use: To increase her current stock for the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Mtumwa

texts.en: Mtumwa is married with five children aged between 3 months and 16 years old. She has been a coconuts and firewood  seller since June 2008. Every day, she works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales. Mtumwa now requests a loan to buy more coconuts and firewood for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: Mtumwa would like to buy more coconuts and firewood for the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en: Tabu is 32 years old and married with two children, aged 3 and 5 years old. She has been a clothes seller since 2006. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales. In the past, Tabu has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Tabu now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes to re-sell.

loans.use: Tabu would like to buy more clothes to re-sell.
